Id:MAC-1_Classified
Digital Signature Status:NOT DIGITALLY SIGNED
Stream Installation Date:2020-02-06
Status:accepted (2020-01-24)
Title:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 Security Technical Implementation Guide
Description:This Security Technical Implementation Guide is published as a tool to improve the security of Department of Defense (DoD) information systems. The requirements are derived from the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) 800-53 and related documents. Comments or proposed revisions to this document should be sent via email to the following address: disa.stig_spt@mail.mil.

    • The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect /etc/gshadow. - (CCE-80432-8) - Fail
  • SRG-OS-000004-GPOS-00004
    • The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect /etc/shadow. - (CCE-80431-0) - Fail
  • SRG-OS-000004-GPOS-00004
    • The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect /etc/opasswd. - (CCE-80430-2) - Fail
  • SRG-OS-000480-GPOS-00227
    • The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must ignore Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) redirect messages. - (CCE-80158-9) - Fail
  • SRG-OS-000375-GPOS-00160
    • The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must uniquely identify and must authenticate users using multifactor authentication via a graphical user logon. - Fail
  • SRG-OS-000378-GPOS-00163
    • The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the Datagram Congestion Control Protocol (DCCP) kernel module is disabled unless required. - Fail
  • SRG-OS-000480-GPOS-00227
    • The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must implement virtual address space randomization. - Fail
  • SRG-OS-000029-GPOS-00010
    • The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must prevent a user from overriding the screensaver idle-activation-enabled setting for the graphical user interface. - Fail
  • SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00216
    • The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the create_module syscall. - Fail
  • SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00216
    • The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the finit_module syscall. - (CCE-80547-3) - Fail
  • SRG-OS-000080-GPOS-00048
    • Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating systems version 7.2 or newer with a Basic Input/Output System (BIOS) must require authentication upon booting into single-user and maintenance modes. - (CCE-27309-4) - Fail
  • SRG-OS-000342-GPOS-00133
    • The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured to use the au-remote plugin. - Fail
  • SRG-OS-000342-GPOS-00133
    • The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must configure the au-remote plugin to off-load audit logs using the audisp-remote daemon. - Fail

Detailed Results

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must display the Standard Mandatory DoD Notice and Consent Banner before granting local or remote access to the system via a graphical user logon.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86483r4_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-010030
Identities:CCE-26970-4
CCI-000048 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-8 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-8.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-8 a)
Description: Display of a standardized and approved use notification before granting access to the operating system ensures privacy and security notification verbiage used is consistent with applicable federal laws, Executive Orders, directives, policies, regulations, standards, and guidance.

System use notifications are required only for access via logon interfaces with human users and are not required when such human interfaces do not exist.

The banner must be formatted in accordance with applicable DoD policy. Use the following verbiage for operating systems that can accommodate banners of 1300 characters:

"You are accessing a U.S. Government (USG) Information System (IS) that is provided for USG-authorized use only.

By using this IS (which includes any device attached to this IS), you consent to the following conditions:

-The USG routinely intercepts and monitors communications on this IS for purposes including, but not limited to, penetration testing, COMSEC monitoring, network operations and defense, personnel misconduct (PM), law enforcement (LE), and counterintelligence (CI) investigations.

-At any time, the USG may inspect and seize data stored on this IS.

-Communications using, or data stored on, this IS are not private, are subject to routine monitoring, interception, and search, and may be disclosed or used for any USG-authorized purpose.

-This IS includes security measures (e.g., authentication and access controls) to protect USG interests--not for your personal benefit or privacy.

-Notwithstanding the above, using this IS does not constitute consent to PM, LE or CI investigative searching or monitoring of the content of privileged communications, or work product, related to personal representation or services by attorneys, psychotherapists, or clergy, and their assistants. Such communications and work product are private and confidential. See User Agreement for details."


Satisfies: SRG-OS-000023-GPOS-00006, SRG-OS-000024-GPOS-00007, SRG-OS-000228-GPOS-00088 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to display the Standard Mandatory DoD Notice and Consent Banner before granting access to the system.

Note: If the system does not have GNOME installed, this requirement is Not Applicable.

Create a database to contain the system-wide graphical user logon settings (if it does not already exist) with the following command:

# touch /etc/dconf/db/local.d/01-banner-message

Add the following line to the [org/gnome/login-screen] section of the "/etc/dconf/db/local.d/01-banner-message":

[org/gnome/login-screen]
banner-message-enable=true

Update the system databases:

# dconf update

Users must log out and back in again before the system-wide settings take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:922
Result:false
Title:Enable GNOME3 Login Warning Banner
Description:Enable the GNOME3 Login warning banner.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (GUI banner is enabled)
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • true (dconf user profile exists)
        • false (All child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • true (package dconf is installed)
    • false (All child checks must be true.) (negated)
      • true (package dconf is installed)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:925 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:GUI banner is enabled
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2720 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • behavior requirements:
    • max_depth = 1
    • recurse_direction = down
  • path must be equal to '/etc/dconf/db'
  • filename must match the pattern '^[0-9].*$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^\[org/gnome/login-screen\]([^\n]*\n+)+?banner-message-enable\s*=\s*true\s*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Include Items If:
  • all path matches the pattern '^/etc/dconf/db/[^/]+\.d/?$'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1022 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:true
Title:dconf user profile exists
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2792 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/etc/dconf/profile/user'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^user-db:user\nsystem-db:local$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Collected Item Properties:
  • filepath equals '/etc/dconf/profile/user'
  • path equals '/etc/dconf/profile'
  • filename equals 'user'
  • pattern equals '^user-db:user\nsystem-db:local$'
  • instance equals '1'
  • text equals 'user-db:user system-db:local'
  • line equals 'user-db:user system-db:local'
  • subexpression does not exist
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1252 (rpminfo_test)
Result:true
Title:package dconf is installed
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2983 (rpminfo_object)
Object Requirements:
  • name must be equal to 'dconf'
Collected Item Properties:
  • name equals 'dconf'
  • arch equals 'x86_64'
  • epoch equals '(none)'
  • release equals '4.el7'
  • version equals '0.28.0'
  • evr equals '0:0.28.0-4.el7'
  • signature_keyid equals '199e2f91fd431d51'
  • extended_name equals 'dconf-(none):0.28.0-4.el7.x86_64'

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must display the approved Standard Mandatory DoD Notice and Consent Banner before granting local or remote access to the system via a graphical user logon.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86485r4_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-010040
Identities:CCE-26892-0
CCI-000048 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-8 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-8.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-8 a)
Description: Display of a standardized and approved use notification before granting access to the operating system ensures privacy and security notification verbiage used is consistent with applicable federal laws, Executive Orders, directives, policies, regulations, standards, and guidance.

System use notifications are required only for access via logon interfaces with human users and are not required when such human interfaces do not exist.

The banner must be formatted in accordance with applicable DoD policy. Use the following verbiage for operating systems that can accommodate banners of 1300 characters:

"You are accessing a U.S. Government (USG) Information System (IS) that is provided for USG-authorized use only.

By using this IS (which includes any device attached to this IS), you consent to the following conditions:

-The USG routinely intercepts and monitors communications on this IS for purposes including, but not limited to, penetration testing, COMSEC monitoring, network operations and defense, personnel misconduct (PM), law enforcement (LE), and counterintelligence (CI) investigations.

-At any time, the USG may inspect and seize data stored on this IS.

-Communications using, or data stored on, this IS are not private, are subject to routine monitoring, interception, and search, and may be disclosed or used for any USG-authorized purpose.

-This IS includes security measures (e.g., authentication and access controls) to protect USG interests--not for your personal benefit or privacy.

-Notwithstanding the above, using this IS does not constitute consent to PM, LE or CI investigative searching or monitoring of the content of privileged communications, or work product, related to personal representation or services by attorneys, psychotherapists, or clergy, and their assistants. Such communications and work product are private and confidential. See User Agreement for details."

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000023-GPOS-00006, SRG-OS-000024-GPOS-00007, SRG-OS-000228-GPOS-00088 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to display the approved Standard Mandatory DoD Notice and Consent Banner before granting access to the system.

Note: If the system does not have GNOME installed, this requirement is Not Applicable.

Create a database to contain the system-wide graphical user logon settings (if it does not already exist) with the following command:

# touch /etc/dconf/db/local.d/01-banner-message

Add the following line to the [org/gnome/login-screen] section of the "/etc/dconf/db/local.d/01-banner-message":

[org/gnome/login-screen]

banner-message-enable=true

banner-message-text='You are accessing a U.S. Government (USG) Information System (IS) that is provided for USG-authorized use only.\nBy using this IS (which includes any device attached to this IS), you consent to the following conditions:\n-The USG routinely intercepts and monitors communications on this IS for purposes including, but not limited to, penetration testing, COMSEC monitoring, network operations and defense, personnel misconduct (PM), law enforcement (LE), and counterintelligence (CI) investigations.\n-At any time, the USG may inspect and seize data stored on this IS.\n-Communications using, or data stored on, this IS are not private, are subject to routine monitoring, interception, and search, and may be disclosed or used for any USG-authorized purpose.\n-This IS includes security measures (e.g., authentication and access controls) to protect USG interests--not for your personal benefit or privacy.\n-Notwithstanding the above, using this IS does not constitute consent to PM, LE or CI investigative searching or monitoring of the content of privileged communications, or work product, related to personal representation or services by attorneys, psychotherapists, or clergy, and their assistants. Such communications and work product are private and confidential. See User Agreement for details. '

Note: The "\n " characters are for formatting only. They will not be displayed on the GUI.

Run the following command to update the database:
# dconf update
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0

        • true (dconf user profile exists)
        • false (All child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • true (package dconf is installed)
    • false (All child checks must be true.) (negated)
      • true (package dconf is installed)

    • recurse_direction = down

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must display the Standard Mandatory DoD Notice and Consent Banner before granting local or remote access to the system via a command line user logon.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86487r3_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-010050
Identities:CCE-27303-7
CCI-000048 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-8 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-8.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-8 a)
Description: Display of a standardized and approved use notification before granting access to the operating system ensures privacy and security notification verbiage used is consistent with applicable federal laws, Executive Orders, directives, policies, regulations, standards, and guidance.

System use notifications are required only for access via logon interfaces with human users and are not required when such human interfaces do not exist.

The banner must be formatted in accordance with applicable DoD policy. Use the following verbiage for operating systems that can accommodate banners of 1300 characters:

"You are accessing a U.S. Government (USG) Information System (IS) that is provided for USG-authorized use only.

By using this IS (which includes any device attached to this IS), you consent to the following conditions:

-The USG routinely intercepts and monitors communications on this IS for purposes including, but not limited to, penetration testing, COMSEC monitoring, network operations and defense, personnel misconduct (PM), law enforcement (LE), and counterintelligence (CI) investigations.

-At any time, the USG may inspect and seize data stored on this IS.

-Communications using, or data stored on, this IS are not private, are subject to routine monitoring, interception, and search, and may be disclosed or used for any USG-authorized purpose.

-This IS includes security measures (e.g., authentication and access controls) to protect USG interests--not for your personal benefit or privacy.

-Notwithstanding the above, using this IS does not constitute consent to PM, LE or CI investigative searching or monitoring of the content of privileged communications, or work product, related to personal representation or services by attorneys, psychotherapists, or clergy, and their assistants. Such communications and work product are private and confidential. See User Agreement for details."

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000023-GPOS-00006, SRG-OS-000024-GPOS-00007 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to display the Standard Mandatory DoD Notice and Consent Banner before granting access to the system via the command line by editing the "/etc/issue" file.

Replace the default text with the Standard Mandatory DoD Notice and Consent Banner. The DoD required text is:
"You are accessing a U.S. Government (USG) Information System (IS) that is provided for USG-authorized use only.

By using this IS (which includes any device attached to this IS), you consent to the following conditions:

-The USG routinely intercepts and monitors communications on this IS for purposes including, but not limited to, penetration testing, COMSEC monitoring, network operations and defense, personnel misconduct (PM), law enforcement (LE), and counterintelligence (CI) investigations.

-At any time, the USG may inspect and seize data stored on this IS.

-Communications using, or data stored on, this IS are not private, are subject to routine monitoring, interception, and search, and may be disclosed or used for any USG-authorized purpose.

-This IS includes security measures (e.g., authentication and access controls) to protect USG interests--not for your personal benefit or privacy.

-Notwithstanding the above, using this IS does not constitute consent to PM, LE or CI investigative searching or monitoring of the content of privileged communications, or work product, related to personal representation or services by attorneys, psychotherapists, or clergy, and their assistants. Such communications and work product are private and confidential. See User Agreement for details."
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:899
Result:false
Title:System Login Banner Compliance
Description:The system login banner text should be set correctly.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (All child checks must be true.)
    • false (correct banner in /etc/issue)
    • false (no extra text in /etc/issue)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:900 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:correct banner in /etc/issue
Check Existence:One and only one collected item may exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2702 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • behavior requirements:
    • multiline = false
    • singleline = true
  • filepath must be equal to '/etc/issue'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^(.*)$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:2752 (textfilecontent54_state)
State Requirements:
  • for all subexpression, the following must be true:
    • subexpression must match the pattern '^(\\n|\s)*You\s+are\s+accessing\s+a\s+U\.S\.\s+Government\s+\(USG\)\s+Information\s+System\s+\(IS\)\s+that\s+is\s+provided\s+for\s+USG-authorized\s+use\s+only\.\s*(\\n|\n)+\s*By\s+using\s+this\s+IS\s+\(which\s+includes\s+any\s+device\s+attached\s+to\s+this\s+IS\),\s+you\s+consent\s+to\s+the\s+following\s+conditions\:\s*(\\n|\n)+\s*-The\s+USG\s+routinely\s+intercepts\s+and\s+monitors\s+communications\s+on\s+this\s+IS\s+for\s+purposes\s+including,\s+but\s+not\s+limited\s+to,\s+penetration\s+testing,\s+COMSEC\s+monitoring,\s+network\s+operations\s+and\s+defense,\s+personnel\s+misconduct\s+\(PM\),\s+law\s+enforcement\s+\(LE\),\s+and\s+counterintelligence\s+\(CI\)\s+investigations\.\s*(\\n|\n)+\s*-At\s+any\s+time,\s+the\s+USG\s+may\s+inspect\s+and\s+seize\s+data\s+stored\s+on\s+this\s+IS\.\s*(\\n|\n)+\s*-Communications\s+using,\s+or\s+data\s+stored\s+on,\s+this\s+IS\s+are\s+not\s+private,\s+are\s+subject\s+to\s+routine\s+monitoring,\s+interception,\s+and\s+search,\s+and\s+may\s+be\s+disclosed\s+or\s+used\s+for\s+any\s+USG-authorized\s+purpose\.\s*(\\n|\n)+\s*-This\s+IS\s+includes\s+security\s+measures\s+\(e\.g\.,\s+authentication\s+and\s+access\s+controls\)\s+to\s+protect\s+USG\s+interests--not\s+for\s+your\s+personal\s+benefit\s+or\s+privacy\.\s*(\\n|\n)+\s*-Notwithstanding\s+the\s+above,\s+using\s+this\s+IS\s+does\s+not\s+constitute\s+consent\s+to\s+PM,\s+LE\s+or\s+CI\s+investigative\s+searching\s+or\s+monitoring\s+of\s+the\s+content\s+of\s+privileged\s+communications,\s+or\s+work\s+product,\s+related\s+to\s+personal\s+representation\s+or\s+services\s+by\s+attorneys,\s+psychotherapists,\s+or\s+clergy,\s+and\s+their\s+assistants\.\s+Such\s+communications\s+and\s+work\s+product\s+are\s+private\s+and\s+confidential\.\s+See\s+User\s+Agreement\s+for\s+details\.(\\n|\s)*$'
Collected Item Properties:
  • filepath equals '/etc/issue'
  • path equals '/etc'
  • filename equals 'issue'
  • pattern equals '^(.*)$'
  • instance equals '1'
  • text equals '\S Kernel \r on an \m '
  • line equals '\S Kernel \r on an \m '
  • subexpression equals '\S Kernel \r on an \m '
Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8648700 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:no extra text in /etc/issue
Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:8648700 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/etc/issue'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^(.+)$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
Exclude Items If:
  • for all subexpression, the following must be true:
    • subexpression matches the pattern '^(\\n|\s)*You\s+are\s+accessing\s+a\s+U\.S\.\s+Government\s+\(USG\)\s+Information\s+System\s+\(IS\)\s+that\s+is\s+provided\s+for\s+USG-authorized\s+use\s+only\.\s*(\\n|\n)+\s*By\s+using\s+this\s+IS\s+\(which\s+includes\s+any\s+device\s+attached\s+to\s+this\s+IS\),\s+you\s+consent\s+to\s+the\s+following\s+conditions\:\s*(\\n|\n)+\s*-The\s+USG\s+routinely\s+intercepts\s+and\s+monitors\s+communications\s+on\s+this\s+IS\s+for\s+purposes\s+including,\s+but\s+not\s+limited\s+to,\s+penetration\s+testing,\s+COMSEC\s+monitoring,\s+network\s+operations\s+and\s+defense,\s+personnel\s+misconduct\s+\(PM\),\s+law\s+enforcement\s+\(LE\),\s+and\s+counterintelligence\s+\(CI\)\s+investigations\.\s*(\\n|\n)+\s*-At\s+any\s+time,\s+the\s+USG\s+may\s+inspect\s+and\s+seize\s+data\s+stored\s+on\s+this\s+IS\.\s*(\\n|\n)+\s*-Communications\s+using,\s+or\s+data\s+stored\s+on,\s+this\s+IS\s+are\s+not\s+private,\s+are\s+subject\s+to\s+routine\s+monitoring,\s+interception,\s+and\s+search,\s+and\s+may\s+be\s+disclosed\s+or\s+used\s+for\s+any\s+USG-authorized\s+purpose\.\s*(\\n|\n)+\s*-This\s+IS\s+includes\s+security\s+measures\s+\(e\.g\.,\s+authentication\s+and\s+access\s+controls\)\s+to\s+protect\s+USG\s+interests--not\s+for\s+your\s+personal\s+benefit\s+or\s+privacy\.\s*(\\n|\n)+\s*-Notwithstanding\s+the\s+above,\s+using\s+this\s+IS\s+does\s+not\s+constitute\s+consent\s+to\s+PM,\s+LE\s+or\s+CI\s+investigative\s+searching\s+or\s+monitoring\s+of\s+the\s+content\s+of\s+privileged\s+communications,\s+or\s+work\s+product,\s+related\s+to\s+personal\s+representation\s+or\s+services\s+by\s+attorneys,\s+psychotherapists,\s+or\s+clergy,\s+and\s+their\s+assistants\.\s+Such\s+communications\s+and\s+work\s+product\s+are\s+private\s+and\s+confidential\.\s+See\s+User\s+Agreement\s+for\s+details\.(\\n|\s)*$'
Exclude Items If:
  • all subexpression matches the pattern '^\s+$'
Exclude Items If:
  • all subexpression matches the pattern '^\s*You\s+are\s+accessing\s+a\s+U\.S\.\s+Government\s+\(USG\)\s+Information\s+System\s+\(IS\)\s+that\s+is\s+provided\s+for\s+USG-authorized\s+use\s+only\.\s*$'
Exclude Items If:
  • all subexpression matches the pattern '^\s*By\s+using\s+this\s+IS\s+\(which\s+includes\s+any\s+device\s+attached\s+to\s+this\s+IS\),\s+you\s+consent\s+to\s+the\s+following\s+conditions\:\s*$'
Exclude Items If:
  • all subexpression matches the pattern '^\s*-The\s+USG\s+routinely\s+intercepts\s+and\s+monitors\s+communications\s+on\s+this\s+IS\s+for\s+purposes\s+including,\s+but\s+not\s+limited\s+to,\s+penetration\s+testing,\s+COMSEC\s+monitoring,\s+network\s+operations\s+and\s+defense,\s+personnel\s+misconduct\s+\(PM\),\s+law\s+enforcement\s+\(LE\),\s+and\s+counterintelligence\s+\(CI\)\s+investigations\.\s*$'
Exclude Items If:
  • all subexpression matches the pattern '^\s*-At\s+any\s+time,\s+the\s+USG\s+may\s+inspect\s+and\s+seize\s+data\s+stored\s+on\s+this\s+IS\.\s*$'
Exclude Items If:
  • all subexpression matches the pattern '^\s*-Communications\s+using,\s+or\s+data\s+stored\s+on,\s+this\s+IS\s+are\s+not\s+private,\s+are\s+subject\s+to\s+routine\s+monitoring,\s+interception,\s+and\s+search,\s+and\s+may\s+be\s+disclosed\s+or\s+used\s+for\s+any\s+USG-authorized\s+purpose\.\s*$'
Exclude Items If:
  • all subexpression matches the pattern '^\s*-This\s+IS\s+includes\s+security\s+measures\s+\(e\.g\.,\s+authentication\s+and\s+access\s+controls\)\s+to\s+protect\s+USG\s+interests--not\s+for\s+your\s+personal\s+benefit\s+or\s+privacy\.\s*$'
Exclude Items If:
  • all subexpression matches the pattern '^\s*-Notwithstanding\s+the\s+above,\s+using\s+this\s+IS\s+does\s+not\s+constitute\s+consent\s+to\s+PM,\s+LE\s+or\s+CI\s+investigative\s+searching\s+or\s+monitoring\s+of\s+the\s+content\s+of\s+privileged\s+communications,\s+or\s+work\s+product,\s+related\s+to\s+personal\s+representation\s+or\s+services\s+by\s+attorneys,\s+psychotherapists,\s+or\s+clergy,\s+and\s+their\s+assistants\.\s+Such\s+communications\s+and\s+work\s+product\s+are\s+private\s+and\s+confidential\.\s+See\s+User\s+Agreement\s+for\s+details\.\s*$'
Collected Item Properties:
  • filepath equals '/etc/issue'
  • path equals '/etc'
  • filename equals 'issue'
  • pattern equals '^(.+)$'
  • instance equals '1'
  • text equals '\S'
  • line equals '\S'
  • subexpression equals '\S'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must enable a user session lock until that user re-establishes access using established identification and authentication procedures.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86515r6_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-010060
Identities:CCE-80112-6
CCI-000056 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-11 b; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-11.1 (iii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-11 b)
Description: A session lock is a temporary action taken when a user stops work and moves away from the immediate physical vicinity of the information system but does not want to log out because of the temporary nature of the absence.

The session lock is implemented at the point where session activity can be determined.

Regardless of where the session lock is determined and implemented, once invoked, the session lock must remain in place until the user reauthenticates. No other activity aside from reauthentication must unlock the system.

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000028-GPOS-00009, SRG-OS-000030-GPOS-00011 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to enable a user's session lock until that user re-establishes access using established identification and authentication procedures.

Create a database to contain the system-wide screensaver settings (if it does not already exist) with the following example:

# touch /etc/dconf/db/local.d/00-screensaver

Edit the "[org/gnome/desktop/screensaver]" section of the database file and add or update the following lines:

# Set this to true to lock the screen when the screensaver activates
lock-enabled=true

Update the system databases:

# dconf update

Users must log out and back in again before the system-wide settings take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:988
Result:false
Title:Enable GNOME3 Screensaver Lock After Idle Period
Description:Idle activation of the screen lock should be enabled.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (screensaver lock is enabled)
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • true (dconf user profile exists)
        • false (All child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • true (package dconf is installed)
    • false (All child checks must be true.) (negated)
      • true (package dconf is installed)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:989 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:screensaver lock is enabled
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2767 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • behavior requirements:
    • max_depth = 1
    • recurse_direction = down
  • path must be equal to '/etc/dconf/db/'
  • filename must match the pattern '^[0-9].*$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^\[org/gnome/desktop/screensaver\]([^\n]*\n+)+?lock-enabled\s*=\s*true\s*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1022 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:true
Title:dconf user profile exists
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2792 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/etc/dconf/profile/user'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^user-db:user\nsystem-db:local$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Collected Item Properties:
  • filepath equals '/etc/dconf/profile/user'
  • path equals '/etc/dconf/profile'
  • filename equals 'user'
  • pattern equals '^user-db:user\nsystem-db:local$'
  • instance equals '1'
  • text equals 'user-db:user system-db:local'
  • line equals 'user-db:user system-db:local'
  • subexpression does not exist
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1252 (rpminfo_test)
Result:true
Title:package dconf is installed
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2983 (rpminfo_object)
Object Requirements:
  • name must be equal to 'dconf'
Collected Item Properties:
  • name equals 'dconf'
  • arch equals 'x86_64'
  • epoch equals '(none)'
  • release equals '4.el7'
  • version equals '0.28.0'
  • evr equals '0:0.28.0-4.el7'
  • signature_keyid equals '199e2f91fd431d51'
  • extended_name equals 'dconf-(none):0.28.0-4.el7.x86_64'

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must initiate a screensaver after a 15-minute period of inactivity for graphical user interfaces.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86517r5_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-010070
Identities:CCE-80110-0
CCI-000057 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-11 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-11.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-11 a)
Description: A session time-out lock is a temporary action taken when a user stops work and moves away from the immediate physical vicinity of the information system but does not log out because of the temporary nature of the absence. Rather than relying on the user to manually lock their operating system session prior to vacating the vicinity, operating systems need to be able to identify when a user's session has idled and take action to initiate the session lock.

The session lock is implemented at the point where session activity can be determined and/or controlled. false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to initiate a screensaver after a 15-minute period of inactivity for graphical user interfaces.

Create a database to contain the system-wide screensaver settings (if it does not already exist) with the following command:

# touch /etc/dconf/db/local.d/00-screensaver

Edit /etc/dconf/db/local.d/00-screensaver and add or update the following lines:

[org/gnome/desktop/session]
# Set the lock time out to 900 seconds before the session is considered idle
idle-delay=uint32 900

You must include the "uint32" along with the integer key values as shown.

Update the system databases:

# dconf update

Users must log out and back in again before the system-wide settings take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:981
Result:false
Title:Configure the GNOME3 GUI Screen locking
Description:The allowed period of inactivity before the screensaver is activated.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (screensaver idle delay is configured)
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • true (dconf user profile exists)
        • false (All child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • true (package dconf is installed)
    • false (All child checks must be true.) (negated)
      • true (package dconf is installed)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:982 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:screensaver idle delay is configured
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2761 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • behavior requirements:
    • max_depth = 1
    • recurse_direction = down
  • path must be equal to '/etc/dconf/db/'
  • filename must match the pattern '^[0-9].*$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^\[org/gnome/desktop/session\](?:[^\n]*\n+)+?idle-delay\s*=\s*uint32[\s]+([0-9]*)'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:2764 (textfilecontent54_state)
State Requirements:
  • for all subexpression, all of the following must be true:
    • subexpression must be less than or equal to '900'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1022 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:true
Title:dconf user profile exists
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2792 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/etc/dconf/profile/user'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^user-db:user\nsystem-db:local$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Collected Item Properties:
  • filepath equals '/etc/dconf/profile/user'
  • path equals '/etc/dconf/profile'
  • filename equals 'user'
  • pattern equals '^user-db:user\nsystem-db:local$'
  • instance equals '1'
  • text equals 'user-db:user system-db:local'
  • line equals 'user-db:user system-db:local'
  • subexpression does not exist
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1252 (rpminfo_test)
Result:true
Title:package dconf is installed
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2983 (rpminfo_object)
Object Requirements:
  • name must be equal to 'dconf'
Collected Item Properties:
  • name equals 'dconf'
  • arch equals 'x86_64'
  • epoch equals '(none)'
  • release equals '4.el7'
  • version equals '0.28.0'
  • evr equals '0:0.28.0-4.el7'
  • signature_keyid equals '199e2f91fd431d51'
  • extended_name equals 'dconf-(none):0.28.0-4.el7.x86_64'

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must have the screen package installed.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86521r3_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-010090
Identities:CCE-27351-6
CCI-000057 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-11 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-11.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-11 a)
Description: : A session time-out lock is a temporary action taken when a user stops work and moves away from the immediate physical vicinity of the information system but does not log out because of the temporary nature of the absence. Rather than relying on the user to manually lock their operating system session prior to vacating the vicinity, operating systems need to be able to identify when a user's session has idled and take action to initiate the session lock.

The screen and tmux packages allow for a session lock to be implemented and configured.
false
Fix Text:Install the screen package to allow the initiation of a session lock after a 15-minute period of inactivity.

Install the screen program (if it is not on the system) with the following command:

# yum install screen

OR

Install the tmux program (if it is not on the system) with the following command:

#yum install tmux
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:1280
Result:false
Title:Package screen or tmux Installed
Description:The RPM packages screen or tmux should be installed.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false (package screen is installed)
    • false (package tmux is installed)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1281 (rpminfo_test)
Result:false
Title:package screen is installed
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:3001 (rpminfo_object)
Object Requirements:
  • name must be equal to 'screen'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:128101 (rpminfo_test)
Result:false
Title:package tmux is installed
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:300101 (rpminfo_object)
Object Requirements:
  • name must be equal to 'tmux'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must initiate a session lock for the screensaver after a period of inactivity for graphical user interfaces.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86523r5_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-010100
Identities:CCE-80111-8
CCI-000057 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-11 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-11.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-11 a)
Description: A session time-out lock is a temporary action taken when a user stops work and moves away from the immediate physical vicinity of the information system but does not log out because of the temporary nature of the absence. Rather than relying on the user to manually lock their operating system session prior to vacating the vicinity, operating systems need to be able to identify when a user's session has idled and take action to initiate the session lock.

The session lock is implemented at the point where session activity can be determined and/or controlled. false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to initiate a session lock after a 15-minute period of inactivity for graphical user interfaces.

Create a database to contain the system-wide screensaver settings (if it does not already exist) with the following command:

# touch /etc/dconf/db/local.d/00-screensaver

Add the setting to enable screensaver locking after 15 minutes of inactivity:

[org/gnome/desktop/screensaver]

idle-activation-enabled=true

Update the system databases:

# dconf update

Users must log out and back in again before the system-wide settings take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:

        • false (All child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • true (package dconf is installed)
    • false (All child checks must be true.) (negated)
      • true (package dconf is installed)

    • recurse_direction = down

  • filename must match the pattern '^[0-9].*$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^\[org/gnome/desktop/screensaver\]([^\n]*\n+)+?idle-activation-enabled\s*=\s*true\s*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'

  • signature_keyid equals '199e2f91fd431d51'
  • extended_name equals 'dconf-(none):0.28.0-4.el7.x86_64'

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must initiate a session lock for graphical user interfaces when the screensaver is activated.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86525r3_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-010110
Identities:CCE-80370-0
CCI-000057 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-11 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-11.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-11 a)
Description: A session time-out lock is a temporary action taken when a user stops work and moves away from the immediate physical vicinity of the information system but does not log out because of the temporary nature of the absence. Rather than relying on the user to manually lock their operating system session prior to vacating the vicinity, operating systems need to be able to identify when a user's session has idled and take action to initiate the session lock.

The session lock is implemented at the point where session activity can be determined and/or controlled. false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to initiate a session lock for graphical user interfaces when a screensaver is activated.

Create a database to contain the system-wide screensaver settings (if it does not already exist) with the following command:

# touch /etc/dconf/db/local.d/00-screensaver

Add the setting to enable session locking when a screensaver is activated:

[org/gnome/desktop/screensaver]
lock-delay=uint32 5

The "uint32" must be included along with the integer key values as shown.

Update the system databases:

# dconf update

Users must log out and back in again before the system-wide settings take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:985
Result:false
Title:Enable GNOME3 Screensaver Lock Delay After Idle Period
Description:Idle activation of the screen lock should be enabled immediately or after a delay.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (screensaver lock is set correctly)
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • true (dconf user profile exists)
        • false (All child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • true (package dconf is installed)
    • false (All child checks must be true.) (negated)
      • true (package dconf is installed)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:986 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:screensaver lock is set correctly
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2765 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • behavior requirements:
    • max_depth = 1
    • recurse_direction = down
  • path must be equal to '/etc/dconf/db/'
  • filename must match the pattern '^[0-9].*$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^\[org/gnome/desktop/screensaver\]([^\n]*\n+)+?lock-delay\s*=\s*uint32\s+[0-5]\s*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1022 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:true
Title:dconf user profile exists
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2792 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/etc/dconf/profile/user'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^user-db:user\nsystem-db:local$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Collected Item Properties:
  • filepath equals '/etc/dconf/profile/user'
  • path equals '/etc/dconf/profile'
  • filename equals 'user'
  • pattern equals '^user-db:user\nsystem-db:local$'
  • instance equals '1'
  • text equals 'user-db:user system-db:local'
  • line equals 'user-db:user system-db:local'
  • subexpression does not exist
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1252 (rpminfo_test)
Result:true
Title:package dconf is installed
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2983 (rpminfo_object)
Object Requirements:
  • name must be equal to 'dconf'
Collected Item Properties:
  • name equals 'dconf'
  • arch equals 'x86_64'
  • epoch equals '(none)'
  • release equals '4.el7'
  • version equals '0.28.0'
  • evr equals '0:0.28.0-4.el7'
  • signature_keyid equals '199e2f91fd431d51'
  • extended_name equals 'dconf-(none):0.28.0-4.el7.x86_64'

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that when passwords are changed or new passwords are established, the new password must contain at least one upper-case character.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86527r3_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-010120
Identities:CCE-27200-5
CCI-000192 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (a))
Description: Use of a complex password helps to increase the time and resources required to compromise the password. Password complexity, or strength, is a measure of the effectiveness of a password in resisting attempts at guessing and brute-force attacks.

Password complexity is one factor of several that determines how long it takes to crack a password. The more complex the password, the greater the number of possible combinations that need to be tested before the password is compromised. false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to enforce password complexity by requiring that at least one upper-case character be used by setting the "ucredit" option.

Add the following line to "/etc/security/pwquality.conf" (or modify the line to have the required value):

ucredit = -1
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:484
Result:false
Title:Set Password ucredit Requirements
Description:The password ucredit should meet minimum requirements
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (All child checks must be true.)
    • false (check the configuration of /etc/security/pwquality.conf)
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (check the configuration of /etc/pam.d/system-auth)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:485 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:check the configuration of /etc/security/pwquality.conf
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2372 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/etc/security/pwquality.conf'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^ucredit[\s]*=[\s]*(-?\d+)(?:[\s]|$)'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:2373 (textfilecontent54_state)
State Requirements:
  • all instance must be equal to '1'
  • for all subexpression, the following must be true:
    • subexpression must be less than or equal to '-1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:480 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:true
Title:check the configuration of /etc/pam.d/system-auth
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2368 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/etc/pam.d/system-auth'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*password\s+(?:(?:required)|(?:requisite))\s+pam_pwquality\.so.*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Collected Item Properties:
  • filepath equals '/etc/pam.d/system-auth'
  • path equals '/etc/pam.d'
  • filename equals 'system-auth'
  • pattern equals '^\s*password\s+(?:(?:required)|(?:requisite))\s+pam_pwquality\.so.*$'
  • instance equals '1'
  • text equals ' password requisite pam_pwquality.so try_first_pass local_users_only retry=3 authtok_type='
  • line equals ' password requisite pam_pwquality.so try_first_pass local_users_only retry=3 authtok_type='
  • subexpression does not exist

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that when passwords are changed or new passwords are established, the new password must contain at least one lower-case character.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86529r5_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-010130
Identities:CCE-27345-8
CCI-000193 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (a))
Description: Use of a complex password helps to increase the time and resources required to compromise the password. Password complexity, or strength, is a measure of the effectiveness of a password in resisting attempts at guessing and brute-force attacks.

Password complexity is one factor of several that determines how long it takes to crack a password. The more complex the password, the greater the number of possible combinations that need to be tested before the password is compromised. false
Fix Text:Configure the system to require at least one lower-case character when creating or changing a password.

Add or modify the following line
in "/etc/security/pwquality.conf":

lcredit = -1

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that when passwords are changed or new passwords are assigned, the new password must contain at least one numeric character.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86531r3_rule

Description: Use of a complex password helps to increase the time and resources required to compromise the password. Password complexity, or strength, is a measure of the effectiveness of a password in resisting attempts at guessing and brute-force attacks.

Password complexity is one factor of several that determines how long it takes to crack a password. The more complex the password, the greater the number of possible combinations that need to be tested before the password is compromised. false

dcredit = -1

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that when passwords are changed a minimum of eight of the total number of characters must be changed.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86535r2_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-010160
Identities:CCE-26631-2
CCI-000195 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (b); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (b))
Description: Use of a complex password helps to increase the time and resources required to compromise the password. Password complexity, or strength, is a measure of the effectiveness of a password in resisting attempts at guessing and brute-force attacks.

Password complexity is one factor of several that determines how long it takes to crack a password. The more complex the password, the greater the number of possible combinations that need to be tested before the password is compromised. false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to require the change of at least eight of the total number of characters when passwords are changed by setting the "difok" option.

Add the following line to "/etc/security/pwquality.conf" (or modify the line to have the required value):

difok = 8

Weight:10.0

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that when passwords are changed a minimum of four character classes must be changed.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86537r2_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-010170
Identities:CCE-27115-5
CCI-000195 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (b); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (b))
Description: Use of a complex password helps to increase the time and resources required to compromise the password. Password complexity, or strength, is a measure of the effectiveness of a password in resisting attempts at guessing and brute-force attacks.

Password complexity is one factor of several that determines how long it takes to crack a password. The more complex the password, the greater the number of possible combinations that need to be tested before the password is compromised. false

Add the following line to "/etc/security/pwquality.conf conf" (or modify the line to have the required value):

minclass = 4

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that when passwords are changed the number of repeating consecutive characters must not be more than three characters.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86539r3_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-010180
Identities:CCE-27333-4
CCI-000195 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (b); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (b))
Description: Use of a complex password helps to increase the time and resources required to compromise the password. Password complexity, or strength, is a measure of the effectiveness of a password in resisting attempts at guessing and brute-force attacks.

Password complexity is one factor of several that determines how long it takes to crack a password. The more complex the password, the greater the number of possible combinations that need to be tested before the password is compromised. false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to require the change of the number of repeating consecutive characters when passwords are changed by setting the "maxrepeat" option.

Add the following line to "/etc/security/pwquality.conf conf" (or modify the line to have the required value):

maxrepeat = 3
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7

Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7

    • false (check the configuration of /etc/security/pwquality.conf)
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (check the configuration of /etc/pam.d/system-auth)
Tests:

  • pattern must match the pattern '^maxrepeat[\s]*=[\s]*(-?\d+)(?:[\s]|$)'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:2361 (textfilecontent54_state)

  • for all subexpression, the following must be true:
    • subexpression must be less than or equal to '3'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:480 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:true
Title:check the configuration of /etc/pam.d/system-auth
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2368 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/etc/pam.d/system-auth'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*password\s+(?:(?:required)|(?:requisite))\s+pam_pwquality\.so.*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Collected Item Properties:
  • filepath equals '/etc/pam.d/system-auth'
  • path equals '/etc/pam.d'
  • filename equals 'system-auth'
  • pattern equals '^\s*password\s+(?:(?:required)|(?:requisite))\s+pam_pwquality\.so.*$'
  • instance equals '1'
  • text equals ' password requisite pam_pwquality.so try_first_pass local_users_only retry=3 authtok_type='
  • line equals ' password requisite pam_pwquality.so try_first_pass local_users_only retry=3 authtok_type='
  • subexpression does not exist

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that when passwords are changed the number of repeating characters of the same character class must not be more than four characters.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86541r2_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-010190
Identities:CCE-27512-3
CCI-000195 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (b); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (b))
Description: Use of a complex password helps to increase the time and resources required to compromise the password. Password complexity, or strength, is a measure of the effectiveness of a password in resisting attempts at guessing and brute-force attacks.

Password complexity is one factor of several that determines how long it takes to crack a password. The more complex the password, the greater the number of possible combinations that need to be tested before the password is compromised. false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to require the change of the number of repeating characters of the same character class when passwords are changed by setting the "maxclassrepeat" option.

Add the following line to "/etc/security/pwquality.conf" conf (or modify the line to have the required value):

maxclassrepeat = 4
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:470
Result:false
Title:Set Password maxclassrepeat Requirements
Description:The password maxclassrepeat should meet minimum requirements using pam_pwquality
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (All child checks must be true.)
    • false (check the configuration of /etc/security/pwquality.conf)
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (check the configuration of /etc/pam.d/system-auth)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:471 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:check the configuration of /etc/security/pwquality.conf
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2358 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/etc/security/pwquality.conf'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^maxclassrepeat[\s]*=[\s]*(-?\d+)(?:[\s]|$)'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:2359 (textfilecontent54_state)
State Requirements:
  • for all subexpression, the following must be true:
    • subexpression must be less than or equal to '4'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:480 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:true
Title:check the configuration of /etc/pam.d/system-auth
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2368 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/etc/pam.d/system-auth'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*password\s+(?:(?:required)|(?:requisite))\s+pam_pwquality\.so.*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Collected Item Properties:
  • filepath equals '/etc/pam.d/system-auth'
  • path equals '/etc/pam.d'
  • filename equals 'system-auth'
  • pattern equals '^\s*password\s+(?:(?:required)|(?:requisite))\s+pam_pwquality\.so.*$'
  • instance equals '1'
  • text equals ' password requisite pam_pwquality.so try_first_pass local_users_only retry=3 authtok_type='
  • line equals ' password requisite pam_pwquality.so try_first_pass local_users_only retry=3 authtok_type='
  • subexpression does not exist

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that passwords for new users are restricted to a 24 hours/1 day minimum lifetime.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86549r2_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-010230
Identities:CCE-27002-5
CCI-000198 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (d); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (d))
Description: Enforcing a minimum password lifetime helps to prevent repeated password changes to defeat the password reuse or history enforcement requirement. If users are allowed to immediately and continually change their password, the password could be repeatedly changed in a short period of time to defeat the organization's policy regarding password reuse. false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to enforce 24 hours/1 day as the minimum password lifetime.

Add the following line in "/etc/login.defs" (or modify the line to have the required value):

PASS_MIN_DAYS 1
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:455
Result:false
Title:Set Password Expiration Parameters
Description:The minimum password age policy should be set appropriately.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (All child checks must be true.)
    • false (The value of PASS_MIN_DAYS should be set appropriately in /etc/login.defs)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:456 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:The value of PASS_MIN_DAYS should be set appropriately in /etc/login.defs
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:3730 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/etc/login.defs'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*PASS_MIN_DAYS\s+(\d+)\s*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:2346 (textfilecontent54_state)
State Requirements:
  • for all subexpression, at least one of the following must be true:
    • subexpression must be greater than or equal to '1'
Collected Item Properties:
  • filepath equals '/etc/login.defs'
  • path equals '/etc'
  • filename equals 'login.defs'
  • pattern equals '^\s*PASS_MIN_DAYS\s+(\d+)\s*$'
  • instance equals '1'
  • text equals 'PASS_MIN_DAYS 0'
  • line equals 'PASS_MIN_DAYS 0'
  • subexpression equals '0'
Additional Information:Check requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that passwords are restricted to a 24 hours/1 day minimum lifetime.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86551r2_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-010240
Identities:CCI-000198 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (d); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (d))
Description: Enforcing a minimum password lifetime helps to prevent repeated password changes to defeat the password reuse or history enforcement requirement. If users are allowed to immediately and continually change their password, the password could be repeatedly changed in a short period of time to defeat the organization's policy regarding password reuse. false
Fix Text:Configure non-compliant accounts to enforce a 24 hours/1 day minimum password lifetime:

# chage -m 1 [user]
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777

    • false (Passwords for interactive users must be restricted to a 1 day minimum lifetime.)
    • true (no shadow entries with null minimum password ages)
Tests:

  • for username, at least one of the following must be true:
    • username must be equal to 'ec2-user'

  • all chg_allow must be greater than or equal to '1'

  • exp_date equals ''
  • flag equals ''

    • pattern must match the pattern '^ec2-user:[^:]*:[^:]*::'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that passwords for new users are restricted to a 60-day maximum lifetime.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86553r2_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-010250
Identities:CCE-27051-2
CCI-000199 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (d); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (d))
Description: Any password, no matter how complex, can eventually be cracked. Therefore, passwords need to be changed periodically. If the operating system does not limit the lifetime of passwords and force users to change their passwords, there is the risk that the operating system passwords could be compromised. false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to enforce a 60-day maximum password lifetime restriction.

Add the following line in "/etc/login.defs" (or modify the line to have the required value):

PASS_MAX_DAYS 60
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:453
Result:false
Title:Set Password Expiration Parameters
Description:The maximum password age policy should meet minimum requirements.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (All child checks must be true.)
    • false (The value of PASS_MAX_DAYS should be set appropriately in /etc/login.defs)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:454 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:The value of PASS_MAX_DAYS should be set appropriately in /etc/login.defs
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:3729 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/etc/login.defs'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*PASS_MAX_DAYS\s+(\d+)\s*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:2344 (textfilecontent54_state)
State Requirements:
  • for all subexpression, at least one of the following must be true:
    • subexpression must be less than or equal to '60'
Collected Item Properties:
  • filepath equals '/etc/login.defs'
  • path equals '/etc'
  • filename equals 'login.defs'
  • pattern equals '^\s*PASS_MAX_DAYS\s+(\d+)\s*$'
  • instance equals '1'
  • text equals 'PASS_MAX_DAYS 99999'
  • line equals 'PASS_MAX_DAYS 99999'
  • subexpression equals '99999'
Additional Information:Check requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that existing passwords are restricted to a 60-day maximum lifetime.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86555r3_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-010260
Identities:CCI-000199 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (d); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (d))
Description: Any password, no matter how complex, can eventually be cracked. Therefore, passwords need to be changed periodically. If the operating system does not limit the lifetime of passwords and force users to change their passwords, there is the risk that the operating system passwords could be compromised. false
Fix Text:Configure non-compliant accounts to enforce a 60-day maximum password lifetime restriction.

# chage -M 60 [user]

  • username must match the pattern '.*'
Include Items If:
  • all user_id is greater than or equal to '1000'
Include Items If:
  • for all user_id, all of the following must be true:
    • user_id does not equal '65534'
    • user_id does not equal '65535'
    • user_id does not equal '4294967294'
    • user_id does not equal '4294967295'
Collected Item Properties:

  • password equals [MASKED PASSWORD FIELD]
  • user_id equals '1000'
  • group_id equals '1000'
  • gcos equals 'Cloud User'
  • home_dir equals '/home/ec2-user'
  • login_shell equals '/bin/bash'
  • last_login equals '0'

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that passwords are prohibited from reuse for a minimum of five generations.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86557r3_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-010270
Identities:CCE-26923-3
CCI-000200 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (e); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (e))
Description: Password complexity, or strength, is a measure of the effectiveness of a password in resisting attempts at guessing and brute-force attacks. If the information system or application allows the user to consecutively reuse their password when that password has exceeded its defined lifetime, the end result is a password that is not changed per policy requirements. false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to prohibit password reuse for a minimum of five generations.

Add the following line in "/etc/pam.d/system-auth" and "/etc/pam.d/password-auth" (or modify the line to have the required value):

password requisite pam_pwhistory.so use_authtok remember=5 retry=3

Note: Manual changes to the listed files may be overwritten by the "authconfig" program. The "authconfig" program should not be used to update the configurations listed in this requirement.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:486
Result:false
Title:Limit Password Reuse
Description:The passwords to remember should be set correctly.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
      • false (Test if remember attribute of pam_unix.so is set correctly in /etc/pam.d/system-auth)
      • false (Test if remember attribute of pam_pwhistory.so is set correctly in /etc/pam.d/system-auth)
    • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
      • false (Test if remember attribute of pam_unix.so is set correctly in /etc/pam.d/password-auth)
      • false (Test if remember attribute of pam_pwhistory.so is set correctly in /etc/pam.d/password-auth)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:487 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:Test if remember attribute of pam_unix.so is set correctly in /etc/pam.d/system-auth
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).

Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/etc/pam.d/system-auth'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*password\s+(?:(?:sufficient)|(?:required))\s+pam_unix\.so[^#\n\r]*remember=([0-9]*).*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:2375 (textfilecontent54_state)
State Requirements:
  • for all subexpression, the following must be true:
    • subexpression must be greater than or equal to '5'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

  • instance must be equal to '1'

    • subexpression must be greater than or equal to '5'

  • instance must be equal to '1'

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that passwords are a minimum of 15 characters in length.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86559r2_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-010280
Identities:CCE-27293-0
CCI-000205 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (i); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (a))
Description: The shorter the password, the lower the number of possible combinations that need to be tested before the password is compromised.

Password complexity, or strength, is a measure of the effectiveness of a password in resisting attempts at guessing and brute-force attacks. Password length is one factor of several that helps to determine strength and how long it takes to crack a password. Use of more characters in a password helps to exponentially increase the time and/or resources required to compromise the password. false
Fix Text:Configure operating system to enforce a minimum 15-character password length.

Add the following line to "/etc/security/pwquality.conf" (or modify the line to have the required value):

minlen = 15
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:476
Result:false
Title:Set Password minlen Requirements
Description:The password minlen should meet minimum requirements
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (All child checks must be true.)
    • false (check the configuration of /etc/security/pwquality.conf)
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (check the configuration of /etc/pam.d/system-auth)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:477 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:check the configuration of /etc/security/pwquality.conf
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2364 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/etc/security/pwquality.conf'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^minlen[\s]*=[\s]*(-?\d+)(?:[\s]|$)'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:2365 (textfilecontent54_state)
State Requirements:
  • all instance must be equal to '1'
  • for all subexpression, the following must be true:
    • subexpression must be greater than or equal to '15'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:480 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:true
Title:check the configuration of /etc/pam.d/system-auth
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2368 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/etc/pam.d/system-auth'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*password\s+(?:(?:required)|(?:requisite))\s+pam_pwquality\.so.*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Collected Item Properties:
  • filepath equals '/etc/pam.d/system-auth'
  • path equals '/etc/pam.d'
  • filename equals 'system-auth'
  • pattern equals '^\s*password\s+(?:(?:required)|(?:requisite))\s+pam_pwquality\.so.*$'
  • instance equals '1'
  • text equals ' password requisite pam_pwquality.so try_first_pass local_users_only retry=3 authtok_type='
  • line equals ' password requisite pam_pwquality.so try_first_pass local_users_only retry=3 authtok_type='
  • subexpression does not exist

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not have accounts configured with blank or null passwords.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86561r3_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-010290
Identities:CCE-27286-4
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
Description: If an account has an empty password, anyone could log on and run commands with the privileges of that account. Accounts with empty passwords should never be used in operational environments. false
Fix Text:If an account is configured for password authentication but does not have an assigned password, it may be possible to log on to the account without authenticating.

Remove any instances of the "nullok" option in "/etc/pam.d/system-auth" and "/etc/pam.d/password-auth" to prevent logons with empty passwords.

Note: Manual changes to the listed files may be overwritten by the "authconfig" program. The "authconfig" program should not be used to update the configurations listed in this requirement.
Severity:high
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:1229
Result:false
Title:No nullok Option in /etc/pam.d/system-auth or /etc/pam.d/password-auth
Description:The file /etc/pam.d/system-auth should not contain the nullok option
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (All child checks must be true.)
    • false (make sure nullok is not used in /etc/pam.d/system-auth)
    • false (make sure nullok is not used in /etc/pam.d/password-auth)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1230 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:make sure nullok is not used in /etc/pam.d/system-auth
Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2964 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/etc/pam.d/system-auth'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[^#]*\s*nullok\s*'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Collected Item Properties:
  • filepath equals '/etc/pam.d/system-auth'
  • path equals '/etc/pam.d'
  • filename equals 'system-auth'
  • pattern equals '^[^#]*\s*nullok\s*'
  • instance equals '1'
  • text equals 'auth required pam_env.so auth required pam_faildelay.so delay=2000000 auth sufficient pam_unix.so nullok try_first_pass auth requisite pam_succeed_if.so uid >= 1000 quiet_success auth required pam_deny.so account required pam_unix.so account sufficient pam_localuser.so account sufficient pam_succeed_if.so uid < 1000 quiet account required pam_permit.so password requisite pam_pwquality.so try_first_pass local_users_only retry=3 authtok_type= password sufficient pam_unix.so sha512 shadow nullok '
  • line equals 'auth required pam_env.so auth required pam_faildelay.so delay=2000000 auth sufficient pam_unix.so nullok try_first_pass auth requisite pam_succeed_if.so uid >= 1000 quiet_success auth required pam_deny.so account required pam_unix.so account sufficient pam_localuser.so account sufficient pam_succeed_if.so uid < 1000 quiet account required pam_permit.so password requisite pam_pwquality.so try_first_pass local_users_only retry=3 authtok_type= password sufficient pam_unix.so sha512 shadow nullok '
  • subexpression does not exist
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:123000 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:make sure nullok is not used in /etc/pam.d/password-auth
Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:296400 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/etc/pam.d/password-auth'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[^#]*\s*nullok\s*'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Collected Item Properties:
  • filepath equals '/etc/pam.d/password-auth'
  • path equals '/etc/pam.d'
