  • pattern equals '^[^#]*\s*nullok\s*'
  • instance equals '1'
  • text equals 'auth required pam_env.so auth required pam_faildelay.so delay=2000000 auth sufficient pam_unix.so nullok try_first_pass auth requisite pam_succeed_if.so uid >= 1000 quiet_success auth required pam_deny.so account required pam_unix.so account sufficient pam_localuser.so account sufficient pam_succeed_if.so uid < 1000 quiet account required pam_permit.so password requisite pam_pwquality.so try_first_pass local_users_only retry=3 authtok_type= password sufficient pam_unix.so sha512 shadow nullok '
  • line equals 'auth required pam_env.so auth required pam_faildelay.so delay=2000000 auth sufficient pam_unix.so nullok try_first_pass auth requisite pam_succeed_if.so uid >= 1000 quiet_success auth required pam_deny.so account required pam_unix.so account sufficient pam_localuser.so account sufficient pam_succeed_if.so uid < 1000 quiet account required pam_permit.so password requisite pam_pwquality.so try_first_pass local_users_only retry=3 authtok_type= password sufficient pam_unix.so sha512 shadow nullok '
  • subexpression does not exist
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must disable account identifiers (individuals, groups, roles, and devices) if the password expires.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86565r2_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-010310
Identities:CCE-27471-2
CCI-000795 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-4 e; NIST SP 800-53A: IA-4.1 (iii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-4 e)
Description: Inactive identifiers pose a risk to systems and applications because attackers may exploit an inactive identifier and potentially obtain undetected access to the system. Owners of inactive accounts will not notice if unauthorized access to their user account has been obtained.

Operating systems need to track periods of inactivity and disable application identifiers after zero days of inactivity. false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to disable account identifiers (individuals, groups, roles, and devices) after the password expires.

Add the following line to "/etc/default/useradd" (or modify the line to have the required value):

INACTIVE=0
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:443
Result:false
Title:Set Accounts to Expire Following Password Expiration
Description:The accounts should be configured to expire automatically following password expiration.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (All child checks must be true.)
    • false (the value INACTIVE parameter should be set appropriately in /etc/default/useradd)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:444 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:the value INACTIVE parameter should be set appropriately in /etc/default/useradd
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
State Operator:All item-state comparisons must be true.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2333 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/etc/default/useradd'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*INACTIVE\s*=\s*(\d+)\s*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:2334 (textfilecontent54_state)
State Requirements:
  • for all subexpression, the following must be true:
    • subexpression must be less than or equal to '0'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:2335 (textfilecontent54_state)
State Requirements:
  • all subexpression must be greater than '-1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that users must provide a password for privilege escalation.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86571r3_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-010340
Identities:CCE-80351-0
CCI-002038 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-11)
Description: Without re-authentication, users may access resources or perform tasks for which they do not have authorization.

When operating systems provide the capability to escalate a functional capability, it is critical the user re-authenticate.

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000373-GPOS-00156, SRG-OS-000373-GPOS-00157, SRG-OS-000373-GPOS-00158 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to require users to supply a password for privilege escalation.

Check the configuration of the "/etc/sudoers" file with the following command:
# visudo

Remove any occurrences of "NOPASSWD" tags in the file.

Check the configuration of the /etc/sudoers.d/* files with the following command:
# grep -i nopasswd /etc/sudoers.d/*

Remove any occurrences of "NOPASSWD" tags in the file.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:176
Result:false
Title:Ensure NOPASSWD Is Not Used in Sudo
Description:Checks sudo usage without password
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (All child checks must be true.)
    • false (NOPASSWD does not exist /etc/sudoers)
    • false (NOPASSWD does not exist in /etc/sudoers.d)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:177 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:NOPASSWD does not exist /etc/sudoers
Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2108 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/etc/sudoers'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^(?!#).*[\s]+NOPASSWD[\s]*\:.*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Collected Item Properties:
  • filepath equals '/etc/sudoers'
  • path equals '/etc'
  • filename equals 'sudoers'
  • pattern equals '^(?!#).*[\s]+NOPASSWD[\s]*\:.*$'
  • instance equals '1'
  • text equals 'ec2-user ALL=(ALL) NOPASSWD: ALL'
  • line equals 'ec2-user ALL=(ALL) NOPASSWD: ALL'
  • subexpression does not exist
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:178 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:NOPASSWD does not exist in /etc/sudoers.d
Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2109 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • path must be equal to '/etc/sudoers.d'
  • filename must match the pattern '^.*$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^(?!#).*[\s]+NOPASSWD[\s]*\:.*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Collected Item Properties:
  • filepath equals '/etc/sudoers.d/90-cloud-init-users'
  • path equals '/etc/sudoers.d'
  • filename equals '90-cloud-init-users'
  • pattern equals '^(?!#).*[\s]+NOPASSWD[\s]*\:.*$'
  • instance equals '1'
  • text equals 'ec2-user ALL=(ALL) NOPASSWD:ALL'
  • line equals 'ec2-user ALL=(ALL) NOPASSWD:ALL'
  • subexpression does not exist
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the delay between logon prompts following a failed console logon attempt is at least four seconds.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86575r2_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-010430
Identities:CCE-80352-8
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
Description: Configuring the operating system to implement organization-wide security implementation guides and security checklists verifies compliance with federal standards and establishes a common security baseline across DoD that reflects the most restrictive security posture consistent with operational requirements.

Configuration settings are the set of parameters that can be changed in hardware, software, or firmware components of the system that affect the security posture and/or functionality of the system. Security-related parameters are those parameters impacting the security state of the system, including the parameters required to satisfy other security control requirements. Security-related parameters include, for example, registry settings; account, file, and directory permission settings; and settings for functions, ports, protocols, services, and remote connections. false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to enforce a delay of at least four seconds between logon prompts following a failed console logon attempt.

Modify the "/etc/login.defs" file to set the "FAIL_DELAY" parameter to "4" or greater:

FAIL_DELAY 4
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:101
Result:false
Title:Ensure that FAIL_DELAY is Configured in /etc/login.defs
Description:The delay between failed authentication attempts should be set for all users specified in /etc/login.defs
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (All child checks must be true.)
    • false (check FAIL_DELAY in /etc/login.defs)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:102 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:check FAIL_DELAY in /etc/login.defs
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2055 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/etc/login.defs'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*FAIL_DELAY[\s]+([^#\s]*)'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:2056 (textfilecontent54_state)
State Requirements:
  • for all subexpression, the following must be true:
    • subexpression must be greater than or equal to '4'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not allow an unattended or automatic logon to the system via a graphical user interface.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86577r2_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-010440
Identities:CCE-80104-3
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
Description: Failure to restrict system access to authenticated users negatively impacts operating system security. false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to not allow an unattended or automatic logon to the system via a graphical user interface.

Note: If the system does not have GNOME installed, this requirement is Not Applicable.

Add or edit the line for the "AutomaticLoginEnable" parameter in the [daemon] section of the "/etc/gdm/custom.conf" file to "false":

[daemon]
AutomaticLoginEnable=false
Severity:high
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:

Result:false

Description:Disable the GNOME Display Manager (GDM) ability to allow users to automatically login.

Tests:
  • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (AutomaticLoginEnable present in daemon section)
      • false (All AutomaticLoginEnable lines are set correctly)
    • false (All child checks must be true.) (negated)
      • true (package gdm is installed)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1121 (textfilecontent54_test)

Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.

  • filepath must be equal to '/etc/gdm/custom.conf'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^\[daemon]\n(?!([^\n]*\n+)*\[[^\n\]]*]([^\n]*\n+)*AutomaticLoginEnable[ ]?=[ ]?)([^\n]*\n+)*AutomaticLoginEnable[ ]?=[ ]?'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'

  • pattern must match the pattern '^[ ]*AutomaticLoginEnable[ ]?=[ ]?([^\W]*)[ ]*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not allow an unrestricted logon to the system.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86579r3_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-010450
Identities:CCE-80105-0
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
Description: Failure to restrict system access to authenticated users negatively impacts operating system security. false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to not allow an unrestricted account to log on to the system via a graphical user interface.

Add or edit the line for the "TimedLoginEnable" parameter in the [daemon] section of the "/etc/gdm/custom.conf" file to "false":

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not allow users to override SSH environment variables.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86581r3_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-010460
Identities:CCE-27363-1
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
Description: Failure to restrict system access to authenticated users negatively impacts operating system security. false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to not allow users to override environment variables to the SSH daemon.

Edit the "/etc/ssh/sshd_config" file to uncomment or add the line for "PermitUserEnvironment" keyword and set the value to "no":

PermitUserEnvironment no

The SSH service must be restarted for changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:1385
Result:false
Title:Do Not Allow Users to Set Environment Options
Description:PermitUserEnvironment should be disabled
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false (Check value of PermitUserEnvironment in /etc/ssh/sshd_config)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (package openssh-server is removed)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1386 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:Check value of PermitUserEnvironment in /etc/ssh/sshd_config
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:3066 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*(?i)PermitUserEnvironment(?-i)[\s]+(\w*)[\s]*(?:|(?:#.*))?$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:138600 (textfilecontent54_state)
State Requirements:
  • all subexpression must be equal (case insensitive) to 'no'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1269 (rpminfo_test)
Result:false
Title:package openssh-server is removed
Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2994 (rpminfo_object)
Object Requirements:
  • name must be equal to 'openssh-server'
Collected Item Properties:
  • name equals 'openssh-server'
  • arch equals 'x86_64'
  • epoch equals '(none)'
  • release equals '21.el7'
  • version equals '7.4p1'
  • evr equals '0:7.4p1-21.el7'
  • signature_keyid equals '199e2f91fd431d51'
  • extended_name equals 'openssh-server-(none):7.4p1-21.el7.x86_64'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not allow a non-certificate trusted host SSH logon to the system.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86583r3_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-010470
Identities:CCE-27413-4
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
Description: Failure to restrict system access to authenticated users negatively impacts operating system security. false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to not allow a non-certificate trusted host SSH logon to the system.

Edit the "/etc/ssh/sshd_config" file to uncomment or add the line for "HostbasedAuthentication" keyword and set the value to "no":

HostbasedAuthentication no

The SSH service must be restarted for changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:1011
Result:false
Title:Disable Host-Based Authentication
Description:SSH host-based authentication should be disabled.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false (sshd HostbasedAuthentication)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (package openssh-server is removed)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1012 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:sshd HostbasedAuthentication
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2785 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*(?i)HostbasedAuthentication(?-i)[\s]+(\w+)[\s]*(?:|(?:#.*))?$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:101200 (textfilecontent54_state)
State Requirements:
  • all subexpression must be equal (case insensitive) to 'no'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1269 (rpminfo_test)
Result:false
Title:package openssh-server is removed
Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.

Object Requirements:
  • name must be equal to 'openssh-server'

  • name equals 'openssh-server'
  • arch equals 'x86_64'
  • epoch equals '(none)'
  • release equals '21.el7'
  • version equals '7.4p1'
  • evr equals '0:7.4p1-21.el7'
  • signature_keyid equals '199e2f91fd431d51'
  • extended_name equals 'openssh-server-(none):7.4p1-21.el7.x86_64'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that a file integrity tool verifies the baseline operating system configuration at least weekly.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86597r2_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-020030
Identities:CCE-26952-2
CCI-001744 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-3 (5))
Description: Unauthorized changes to the baseline configuration could make the system vulnerable to various attacks or allow unauthorized access to the operating system. Changes to operating system configurations can have unintended side effects, some of which may be relevant to security.

Detecting such changes and providing an automated response can help avoid unintended, negative consequences that could ultimately affect the security state of the operating system. The operating system's Information Management Officer (IMO)/Information System Security Officer (ISSO) and System Administrators (SAs) must be notified via email and/or monitoring system trap when there is an unauthorized modification of a configuration item. false
Fix Text:Configure the file integrity tool to run automatically on the system at least weekly. The following example output is generic. It will set cron to run AIDE daily, but other file integrity tools may be used:

# more /etc/cron.daily/aide
#!/bin/bash

/usr/sbin/aide --check | /bin/mail -s "$HOSTNAME - Daily aide integrity check run" root@sysname.mil
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:525
Result:false
Title:Configure Periodic Execution of AIDE
Description:By default, AIDE does not install itself for periodic execution. Periodically running AIDE is necessary to reveal unexpected changes in installed files.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (All child checks must be true.)
    • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
      • false (run aide daily with /etc/crontab)
      • false (run aide daily with /etc/cron.d)
      • false (run aide daily with /var/spool/cron/root)
      • false (run aide daily with cron.daily)
      • false (run aide daily with cron.weekly)
      • false (run aide daily with cron.hourly)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (package aide is installed)

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must prevent the installation of software, patches, service packs, device drivers, or operating system components of local packages without verification they have been digitally signed using a certificate that is issued by a Certificate Authority (CA) that is recognized and approved by the organization.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86603r2_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-020060
Identities:CCE-80347-8
CCI-001749 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-5 (3))
Description: Changes to any software components can have significant effects on the overall security of the operating system. This requirement ensures the software has not been tampered with and that it has been provided by a trusted vendor.

Accordingly, patches, service packs, device drivers, or operating system components must be signed with a certificate recognized and approved by the organization.

Verifying the authenticity of the software prior to installation validates the integrity of the patch or upgrade received from a vendor. This verifies the software has not been tampered with and that it has been provided by a trusted vendor. Self-signed certificates are disallowed by this requirement. The operating system should not have to verify the software again. This requirement does not mandate DoD certificates for this purpose; however, the certificate used to verify the software must be from an approved CA. false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to verify the signature of local packages prior to install by setting the following option in the "/etc/yum.conf" file:

localpkg_gpgcheck=1
Severity:high
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:110
Result:false
Title:Ensure gpgcheck Enabled for Local Packages
Description:The localpkg_gpgcheck option should be used to ensure that checking of an RPM package's signature always occurs prior to its installation.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (All child checks must be true.)
    • false (check value of localpkg_gpgcheck in /etc/yum.conf)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:111 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:check value of localpkg_gpgcheck in /etc/yum.conf
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2062 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/etc/yum.conf'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*localpkg_gpgcheck\s*=\s*(\S+)\s*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:11100 (textfilecontent54_state)
State Requirements:
  • all subexpression must match the pattern '^(1|True|yes)$'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured to disable USB mass storage.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86607r4_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-020100
Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
CCI-000778 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-3; NIST SP 800-53A: IA-3.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-3)
CCI-001958 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-3)
Description: USB mass storage permits easy introduction of unknown devices, thereby facilitating malicious activity.

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000114-GPOS-00059, SRG-OS-000378-GPOS-00163, SRG-OS-000480-GPOS-00227 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to disable the ability to use the USB Storage kernel module.

Create a file under "/etc/modprobe.d" with the following command:

# touch /etc/modprobe.d/usb-storage.conf

Add the following line to the created file:

install usb-storage /bin/true

Configure the operating system to disable the ability to use USB mass storage devices.

# vi /etc/modprobe.d/blacklist.conf

Add or update the line:

blacklist usb-storage
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:1141
Result:false
Title:Disable usb-storage Kernel Module
Description:The kernel module usb-storage should be disabled.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (All child checks must be true.)
    • false (kernel module usb-storage disabled)
    • false (kernel module usb-storage blacklisted in /etc/modprobe.d)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1142 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:kernel module usb-storage disabled
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2892 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • path must be equal to '/etc/modprobe.d'
  • filename must match the pattern '^.*\.conf$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*install\s+usb-storage\s+(\S+)\s*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:8660700 (textfilecontent54_state)
State Requirements:
  • all subexpression must be equal to '/bin/true'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8660700 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:kernel module usb-storage blacklisted in /etc/modprobe.d
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:8660700 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • path must be equal to '/etc/modprobe.d'
  • filename must match the pattern '^.*\.conf$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*blacklist\s+usb-storage\s*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must remove all software components after updated versions have been installed.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86611r2_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-020200
Identities:CCE-80346-0
CCI-002617 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SI-2 (6))
Description: Previous versions of software components that are not removed from the information system after updates have been installed may be exploited by adversaries. Some information technology products may remove older versions of software automatically from the information system. false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to remove all software components after updated versions have been installed.

Set the "clean_requirements_on_remove" option to "1" in the "/etc/yum.conf" file:

clean_requirements_on_remove=1

Weight:10.0

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be a vendor supported release.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86621r5_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-020250
Identities:CCE-80349-4
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
Description: An operating system release is considered "supported" if the vendor continues to provide security patches for the product. With an unsupported release, it will not be possible to resolve security issues discovered in the system software. false
Fix Text:Upgrade to a supported version of the operating system.
Severity:high
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:169
Result:false
Title:RHEL7 Supported Operating System Version
Description:The operating system installed on the system is a certified vendor operating system and meets government requirements/certifications such as FIPS, NIAP, etc.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (All child checks must be true.)
    • false (Supported RHEL7 minor version)
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (redhat-release-virtualization-host RPM package is installed)
          • false (RHEVH base RHEL is version 7)
        • false (redhat-release-client is version 7)
        • false (redhat-release-workstation is version 7)
        • true (redhat-release-server is version 7)
        • false (redhat-release-computenode is version 7)
      • true (installed OS part of unix family)
Tests:

Title:RHEVH base RHEL is version 7

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that a separate file system is used for user home directories (such as /home or an equivalent).

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86683r2_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-021310
Identities:CCE-80144-9
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
Description: The use of separate file systems for different paths can protect the system from failures resulting from a file system becoming full or failing. false
Fix Text:Migrate the "/home" directory onto a separate file system/partition.
Severity:low
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:1311
Result:false
Title:Ensure /home Located On Separate Partition
Description:If user home directories will be stored locally, create a separate partition for /home. If /home will be mounted from another system such as an NFS server, then creating a separate partition is not necessary at this time, and the mountpoint can instead be configured later.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (All child checks must be true.)
    • false (/home on own partition)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1312 (partition_test)
Result:false
Title:/home on own partition
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:3017 (partition_object)
Object Requirements:
  • mount_point must be equal to '/home'
Collected Item Properties:
  • mount_point does not exist
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must use a separate file system for /var.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86685r2_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-021320
Identities:CCE-26404-4

Description: The use of separate file systems for different paths can protect the system from failures resulting from a file system becoming full or failing. false
Fix Text:Migrate the "/var" path onto a separate file system.
Severity:low
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:1315
Result:false
Title:Ensure /var Located On Separate Partition
Description:Ensuring that /var is mounted on its own partition enables the setting of more restrictive mount options, which is used as temporary storage by many program, particularly system services such as daemons. It is not uncommon for the /var directory to contain world-writable directories, installed by other software packages.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must use a separate file system for /tmp (or equivalent).

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86689r3_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-021340
Identities:CCE-27173-4
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
Description: The use of separate file systems for different paths can protect the system from failures resulting from a file system becoming full or failing. false
Fix Text:Start the "tmp.mount" service with the following command:

# systemctl enable tmp.mount

OR

Edit the "/etc/fstab" file and ensure the "/tmp" directory is defined in the fstab with a device and mount point.
Severity:low
Weight:10.0
Reference:

Publisher:DISA

Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777

    • false (check for /tmp)

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must implement NIST FIPS-validated cryptography for the following: to provision digital signatures, to generate cryptographic hashes, and to protect data requiring data-at-rest protections in accordance with applicable federal laws, Executive Orders, directives, policies, regulations, and standards.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86691r4_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-021350
Identities:CCE-80359-3
CCI-000068 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-17 (2); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-17 (2).1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-17 (2))
CCI-001199 (NIST SP 800-53: SC-28; NIST SP 800-53A: SC-28.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-28)
CCI-002450 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-13)
CCI-002476 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-28 (1))
Description: Use of weak or untested encryption algorithms undermines the purposes of using encryption to protect data. The operating system must implement cryptographic modules adhering to the higher standards approved by the federal government since this provides assurance they have been tested and validated.

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000033-GPOS-00014, SRG-OS-000185-GPOS-00079, SRG-OS-000396-GPOS-00176, SRG-OS-000405-GPOS-00184, SRG-OS-000478-GPOS-00223 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to implement DoD-approved encryption by installing the dracut-fips package.

To enable strict FIPS compliance, the fips=1 kernel option needs to be added to the kernel command line during system installation so key generation is done with FIPS-approved algorithms and continuous monitoring tests in place.

Configure the operating system to implement DoD-approved encryption by following the steps below:

The fips=1 kernel option needs to be added to the kernel command line during system installation so that key generation is done with FIPS-approved algorithms and continuous monitoring tests in place. Users should also ensure that the system has plenty of entropy during the installation process by moving the mouse around, or if no mouse is available, ensuring that many keystrokes are typed. The recommended amount of keystrokes is 256 and more. Less than 256 keystrokes may generate a non-unique key.

Install the dracut-fips package with the following command:

# yum install dracut-fips

Recreate the "initramfs" file with the following command:

Note: This command will overwrite the existing "initramfs" file.

# dracut -f

Modify the kernel command line of the current kernel in the "grub.cfg" file by adding the following option to the GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX key in the "/etc/default/grub" file and then rebuild the "grub.cfg" file:

fips=1

Changes to "/etc/default/grub" require rebuilding the "grub.cfg" file as follows:

On BIOS-based machines, use the following command:

# grub2-mkconfig -o /boot/grub2/grub.cfg

On UEFI-based machines, use the following command:

# grub2-mkconfig -o /boot/efi/EFI/redhat/grub.cfg

If /boot or /boot/efi reside on separate partitions, the kernel parameter boot= must be added to the kernel command line. You can identify a partition by running the df /boot or df /boot/efi command:

# df /boot
Filesystem 1K-blocks Used Available Use% Mounted on
/dev/sda1 495844 53780 416464 12% /boot

To ensure the "boot=" configuration option will work even if device naming changes occur between boots, identify the universally unique identifier (UUID) of the partition with the following command:

# blkid /dev/sda1
/dev/sda1: UUID="05c000f1-a213-759e-c7a2-f11b7424c797" TYPE="ext4"

For the example above, append the following string to the kernel command line:

boot=UUID=05c000f1-a213-759e-c7a2-f11b7424c797

Reboot the system for the changes to take effect.
Severity:high
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:126
Result:false
Title:Enable FIPS Mode in GRUB2
Description:Look for argument fips=1 in the kernel line in /etc/default/grub.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (All child checks must be true.)
    • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
      • false (check for fips=1 in /etc/default/grub via GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX)
      • false (check for fips=1 in /etc/default/grub via GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX_DEFAULT)
    • false (check for fips=1 in grub.cfg)
    • false (check for 1 in /proc/sys/crypto/fips_enabled)
    • true (check for fips=0 in /etc/default/grub)
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (redhat-release-virtualization-host RPM package is installed)
          • false (RHEVH base RHEL is version 7)
        • false (redhat-release-client is version 7)
        • false (redhat-release-workstation is version 7)
        • true (redhat-release-server is version 7)
        • false (redhat-release-computenode is version 7)
      • true (installed OS part of unix family)
    • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
      • false (Tests whether prelinking is disabled)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (package prelink is removed)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (package dracut-fips is installed)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:129 (textfilecontent54_test)

  • filepath must be equal to '/etc/default/grub'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX="(.*)"$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must shut down upon audit processing failure, unless availability is an overriding concern. If availability is a concern, the system must alert the designated staff (System Administrator [SA] and Information System Security Officer [ISSO] at a minimum) in the event of an audit processing failure.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86705r4_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-030010
Identities:CCE-80381-7
CCI-000139 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-5 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-5.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-5 a)
Description: It is critical for the appropriate personnel to be aware if a system is at risk of failing to process audit logs as required. Without this notification, the security personnel may be unaware of an impending failure of the audit capability, and system operation may be adversely affected.

Audit processing failures include software/hardware errors, failures in the audit capturing mechanisms, and audit storage capacity being reached or exceeded.

This requirement applies to each audit data storage repository (i.e., distinct information system component where audit records are stored), the centralized audit storage capacity of organizations (i.e., all audit data storage repositories combined), or both.

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000046-GPOS-00022, SRG-OS-000047-GPOS-00023 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to shut down in the event of an audit processing failure.

Add or correct the option to shut down the operating system with the following command:

# auditctl -f 2

Edit the "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules" file and add the following line:

-f 2

If availability has been determined to be more important, and this decision is documented with the ISSO, configure the operating system to notify system administration staff and ISSO staff in the event of an audit processing failure with the following command:

# auditctl -f 1

Edit the "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules" file and add the following line:

-f 1

Kernel log monitoring must also be configured to properly alert designated staff.

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:776
Result:false
Title:Shutdown System When Auditing Failures Occur
Description:The system will shutdown when auditing fails.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (audit augenrules configuration shutdown)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (audit augenrules)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (audit auditctl configuration shutdown)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:777 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:audit augenrules configuration shutdown
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2600 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
  • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*\-f\s*2\s*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:545 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:true
Title:audit augenrules

  • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'

  • line equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
  • subexpression does not exist
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:778 (textfilecontent54_test)

Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.

  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must off-load audit records onto a different system or media from the system being audited.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86707r2_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-030300
Identities:CCI-001851 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-4 (1))
Description: Information stored in one location is vulnerable to accidental or incidental deletion or alteration.

Off-loading is a common process in information systems with limited audit storage capacity.

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000342-GPOS-00133, SRG-OS-000479-GPOS-00224 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to off-load audit records onto a different system or media from the system being audited.

Set the remote server option in "/etc/audisp/audisp-remote.conf" with the IP address of the log aggregation server.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777

    • false (/etc/audisp/audisp-remote.conf remote_system is not empty)

Result:false

    • ignore_case = true
  • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audisp/audisp-remote.conf'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[ ]*remote_server[ ]+=[ ]+(.*)'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must encrypt the transfer of audit records off-loaded onto a different system or media from the system being audited.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86709r2_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-030310
Identities:CCI-001851 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-4 (1))
Description: Information stored in one location is vulnerable to accidental or incidental deletion or alteration.

Off-loading is a common process in information systems with limited audit storage capacity.

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000342-GPOS-00133, SRG-OS-000479-GPOS-00224 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to encrypt the transfer of off-loaded audit records onto a different system or media from the system being audited.

Uncomment the "enable_krb5" option in "/etc/audisp/audisp-remote.conf" and set it with the following line:

enable_krb5 = yes

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the audit system takes appropriate action when the audit storage volume is full.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86711r3_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-030320
Identities:CCI-001851 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-4 (1))
Description: Taking appropriate action in case of a filled audit storage volume will minimize the possibility of losing audit records. false
Fix Text:Configure the action the operating system takes if the disk the audit records are written to becomes full.

Uncomment or edit the "disk_full_action" option in "/etc/audisp/audisp-remote.conf" and set it to "syslog", "single", or "halt", such as the following line:

disk_full_action = single
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:

Result:false
Title:The audit system must take appropriate action when the audit storage volume is full.
Description:The audit system must take appropriate action when the audit storage volume is full.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (All child checks must be true.)
    • false (/etc/audisp/audisp-remote.conf disk_full_action = syslog, single, or halt)
Tests:

Result:false

Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).

    • ignore_case = true
  • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audisp/audisp-remote.conf'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*disk_full_action\s+=\s+(\S+)\s*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:8671100 (textfilecontent54_state)
State Requirements:
  • all subexpression must match the pattern '^[Ss][Yy][Ss][Ll][Oo][Gg]$'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:8671101 (textfilecontent54_state)
State Requirements:
  • all subexpression must match the pattern '^[Ss][Ii][Nn][Gg][Ll][Ee]$'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:8671102 (textfilecontent54_state)
State Requirements:
  • all subexpression must match the pattern '^[Hh][Aa][Ll][Tt]$'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must immediately notify the System Administrator (SA) and Information System Security Officer (ISSO) (at a minimum) via email when the threshold for the repository maximum audit record storage capacity is reached.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86715r2_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-030340
Identities:CCI-001855 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-5 (1))
Description: If security personnel are not notified immediately when the threshold for the repository maximum audit record storage capacity is reached, they are unable to expand the audit record storage capacity before records are lost. false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to immediately notify the SA and ISSO (at a minimum) when the threshold for the repository maximum audit record storage capacity is reached.

Uncomment or edit the "space_left_action" keyword in "/etc/audit/auditd.conf" and set it to "email".

space_left_action = email
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all executions of privileged functions.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86719r7_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-030360
Identities:CCI-002234 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-6 (9))
Description: Misuse of privileged functions, either intentionally or unintentionally by authorized users, or by unauthorized external entities that have compromised information system accounts, is a serious and ongoing concern and can have significant adverse impacts on organizations. Auditing the use of privileged functions is one way to detect such misuse and identify the risk from insider threats and the advanced persistent threat. false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to audit the execution of privileged functions.

Add or update the following rules in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S execve -C uid!=euid -F euid=0 -k setuid
-a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S execve -C uid!=euid -F euid=0 -k setuid
-a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S execve -C gid!=egid -F egid=0 -k setgid
-a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S execve -C gid!=egid -F egid=0 -k setgid

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:710
Result:false
Title:The Red Hat EnterpriseLinux Operating system must audit all executions of privileged functions.
Description:Misuse of privileged functions, either intentionally or unintentionally by authorized users, or by unauthorized external entities that have compromised information system accounts, is a serious and ongoing concern and can have a significant adverse impacts on orginizations. Auditing the use of privileged functions is one way to detect such misuse and identify the risk from insider threats and the advanced persistent threat.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (audit augenrules execve uid 64-bit)
          • false (audit augenrules execve gid 64-bit)
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • true (All child checks must be true.)
            • true (64 bit architecture)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
      • false (audit augenrules execve uid 32-bit)
      • false (audit augenrules execve gid 32-bit)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (audit augenrules)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (audit auditctl execve uid 64-bit)
          • false (audit auditctl execve gid 64-bit)
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • true (All child checks must be true.)
            • true (64 bit architecture)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
      • false (audit auditctl execve uid 32-bit)
      • false (audit auditctl execve gid 32-bit)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8671900 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:audit augenrules execve uid 64-bit
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:8671900 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
  • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^\-a\s+always,exit\s+\-F\s+arch=b64\s+\-S\s+execve\s+\-C\s+uid!=euid\s+\-F\s+euid=0\s+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[-\w]+\s*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8671901 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:audit augenrules execve gid 64-bit
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:8671901 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
  • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^\-a\s+always,exit\s+\-F\s+arch=b64\s+\-S\s+execve\s+\-C\s+gid!=egid\s+\-F\s+egid=0\s+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[-\w]+\s*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the chown syscall.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86721r5_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-030370
Identities:CCE-27364-9
CCI-000126 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-2 d; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-2.1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-2 d)
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000064-GPOS-00033, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000458-GPOS-00203, SRG-OS-000474-GPOS-00219 false
Fix Text:Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S chown -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k perm_mod

-a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S chown -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k perm_mod

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:552
Result:false
Title:Audit Discretionary Access Control Modification Events - chown
Description:The changing of file permissions and attributes should be audited.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit augenrules 64-bit chown)
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • true (All child checks must be true.)
            • true (64 bit architecture)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
      • false (audit augenrules 32-bit chown)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (audit augenrules)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl 64-bit chown)
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • true (All child checks must be true.)
            • true (64 bit architecture)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
      • false (audit auditctl 32-bit chown)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:554 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:audit augenrules 64-bit chown
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2433 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
  • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+(?:.*-F[\s]+arch=b64[\s]+)(?:.*(-S[\s]+chown[\s]+|([\s]+|[,])chown([\s]+|[,])))(?:.*-F\s+auid>=1000[\s]+)(?:.*-F\s+auid!=4294967295[\s]+).*(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the fchown syscall.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86723r5_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-030380
Identities:CCE-27356-5
CCI-000126 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-2 d; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-2.1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-2 d)
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)

Title:audit augenrules 32-bit fchown
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2444 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
  • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+(?:.*-F[\s]+arch=b32[\s]+)(?:.*(-S[\s]+fchown[\s]+|([\s]+|[,])fchown([\s]+|[,])))(?:.*-F\s+auid>=1000[\s]+)(?:.*-F\s+auid!=4294967295[\s]+).*(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:545 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:true
Title:audit augenrules
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2427 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'

Result:false
Title:audit auditctl
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.

  • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/auditctl.*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the lchown syscall.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86725r5_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-030390
Identities:CCE-27083-5
CCI-000126 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-2 d; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-2.1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-2 d)
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000064-GPOS-00033, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000458-GPOS-00203, SRG-OS-000474-GPOS-00219 false
Fix Text:Add or update the following rules in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S lchown -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k perm_mod

-a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S lchown -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k perm_mod

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:587
Result:false
Title:Audit Discretionary Access Control Modification Events - lchown
Description:The changing of file permissions and attributes should be audited.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit augenrules 64-bit lchown)
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • true (All child checks must be true.)
            • true (64 bit architecture)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
      • false (audit augenrules 32-bit lchown)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (audit augenrules)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl 64-bit lchown)
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • true (All child checks must be true.)
            • true (64 bit architecture)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
      • false (audit auditctl 32-bit lchown)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl)
Tests:

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the chmod syscall.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86729r5_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-030410
Identities:CCE-27339-1
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000458-GPOS-00203, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000064-GPOS-00033 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "chmod" syscall occur.

Add or update the following rules in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S chmod -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k perm_mod

-a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S chmod -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k perm_mod

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:546
Result:false
Title:Audit Discretionary Access Control Modification Events - chmod
Description:The changing of file permissions and attributes should be audited.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit augenrules 64-bit chmod)
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • true (All child checks must be true.)
            • true (64 bit architecture)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
      • false (audit augenrules 32-bit chmod)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (audit augenrules)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl 64-bit chmod)
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • true (All child checks must be true.)
            • true (64 bit architecture)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
      • false (audit auditctl 32-bit chmod)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:549 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:audit augenrules 64-bit chmod
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2429 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
  • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+(?:.*-F[\s]+arch=b64[\s]+)(?:.*(-S[\s]+chmod[\s]+|([\s]+|[,])chmod([\s]+|[,])))(?:.*-F\s+auid>=1000[\s]+)(?:.*-F\s+auid!=4294967295[\s]+).*(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1432 (uname_test)
Result:true
Title:64 bit architecture
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:3105 (uname_object)
Object Requirements:
  • Collect any available items.
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:3106 (uname_state)
State Requirements:
  • all processor_type must be equal to 'x86_64'
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1429 (uname_test)
Result:false
Title:64 bit architecture
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:3099 (uname_object)
Object Requirements:
  • Collect any available items.
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:3100 (uname_state)
State Requirements:
  • all processor_type must be equal to 'ppc64'
Collected Item Properties:
  • machine_class equals 'x86_64'
  • node_name equals 'ip-10-0-1-28.ec2.internal'
  • os_name equals 'Linux'
  • os_release equals '3.10.0-1127.8.2.el7.x86_64'
  • os_version equals '#1 SMP Thu May 7 19:30:37 EDT 2020'
  • processor_type equals 'x86_64'
Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1430 (uname_test)
Result:false
Title:64 bit architecture
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).

Object Requirements:
  • Collect any available items.
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:3102 (uname_state)
State Requirements:
  • all processor_type must be equal to 'ppc64le'

  • machine_class equals 'x86_64'
  • node_name equals 'ip-10-0-1-28.ec2.internal'
  • os_name equals 'Linux'
  • os_release equals '3.10.0-1127.8.2.el7.x86_64'
  • os_version equals '#1 SMP Thu May 7 19:30:37 EDT 2020'

Title:audit augenrules 32-bit chmod

  • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+(?:.*-F[\s]+arch=b32[\s]+)(?:.*(-S[\s]+chmod[\s]+|([\s]+|[,])chmod([\s]+|[,])))(?:.*-F\s+auid>=1000[\s]+)(?:.*-F\s+auid!=4294967295[\s]+).*(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'

Result:true
Title:audit augenrules
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2427 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
Collected Item Properties:
  • filepath equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
  • path equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system'
  • filename equals 'auditd.service'
  • pattern equals '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
  • instance equals '1'
  • text equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
  • line equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
  • subexpression does not exist

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the fchmod syscall.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86731r5_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-030420
Identities:CCE-27393-8
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000458-GPOS-00203, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000064-GPOS-00033 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "fchmod" syscall occur.

Add or update the following rules in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S fchmod -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k perm_mod

-a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S fchmod -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k perm_mod

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the fchmodat syscall.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86733r5_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-030430
Identities:CCE-27388-8
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000458-GPOS-00203, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000064-GPOS-00033 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "fchmodat" syscall occur.

Add or update the following rules in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S fchmodat -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k perm_mod

-a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S fchmodat -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k perm_mod

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.

Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the setxattr syscall.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86735r5_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-030440
Identities:CCE-27213-8
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000458-GPOS-00203, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000064-GPOS-00033 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "setxattr" syscall occur.

Add or update the following rules in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S setxattr -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k perm_mod

-a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S setxattr -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k perm_mod

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:607
Result:false
Title:Audit Discretionary Access Control Modification Events - setxattr
Description:The changing of file permissions and attributes should be audited.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit augenrules 64-bit setxattr)
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • true (All child checks must be true.)
            • true (64 bit architecture)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
      • false (audit augenrules 32-bit setxattr)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (audit augenrules)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl 64-bit setxattr)
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • true (All child checks must be true.)
            • true (64 bit architecture)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
      • false (audit auditctl 32-bit setxattr)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl)
Tests:

  • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
  • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+(?:.*-F[\s]+arch=b64[\s]+)(?:.*(-S[\s]+setxattr[\s]+|([\s]+|[,])setxattr([\s]+|[,])))(?:.*-F\s+auid>=1000[\s]+)(?:.*-F\s+auid!=4294967295[\s]+).*(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'

Result:false
Title:audit auditctl
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2426 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/auditctl.*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the lsetxattr syscall.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86739r5_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-030460
Identities:CCE-27280-7
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000458-GPOS-00203, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000064-GPOS-00033 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "lsetxattr" syscall occur.

Add or update the following rules in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S lsetxattr -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k perm_mod

-a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S lsetxattr -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k perm_mod

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:597
Result:false
Title:Audit Discretionary Access Control Modification Events - lsetxattr
Description:The changing of file permissions and attributes should be audited.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit augenrules 64-bit lsetxattr)
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • true (All child checks must be true.)
            • true (64 bit architecture)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
      • false (audit augenrules 32-bit lsetxattr)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (audit augenrules)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl 64-bit lsetxattr)
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • true (All child checks must be true.)
            • true (64 bit architecture)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
      • false (audit auditctl 32-bit lsetxattr)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:599 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:audit augenrules 64-bit lsetxattr
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2469 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
  • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+(?:.*-F[\s]+arch=b64[\s]+)(?:.*(-S[\s]+lsetxattr[\s]+|([\s]+|[,])lsetxattr([\s]+|[,])))(?:.*-F\s+auid>=1000[\s]+)(?:.*-F\s+auid!=4294967295[\s]+).*(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

  • all processor_type must be equal to 'x86_64'

Identities:CCE-27367-2
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the lremovexattr syscall.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86745r5_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-030490
Identities:CCE-27410-0
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000458-GPOS-00203, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000064-GPOS-00033 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "lremovexattr" syscall occur.

Add or update the following rules in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S lremovexattr -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k perm_mod

-a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S lremovexattr -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k perm_mod

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:592
Result:false
Title:Audit Discretionary Access Control Modification Events - lremovexattr
Description:The changing of file permissions and attributes should be audited.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit augenrules 64-bit lremovexattr)
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • true (All child checks must be true.)
            • true (64 bit architecture)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
      • false (audit augenrules 32-bit lremovexattr)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (audit augenrules)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl 64-bit lremovexattr)
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • true (All child checks must be true.)
            • true (64 bit architecture)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
      • false (audit auditctl 32-bit lremovexattr)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl)

  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+(?:.*-F[\s]+arch=b64[\s]+)(?:.*(-S[\s]+lremovexattr[\s]+|([\s]+|[,])lremovexattr([\s]+|[,])))(?:.*-F\s+auid>=1000[\s]+)(?:.*-F\s+auid!=4294967295[\s]+).*(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
