The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the creat syscall.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86747r5_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-030500
Identities:CCE-80385-8
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a))
Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000064-GPOS-00033, SRG-OS-000458-GPOS-00203, SRG-OS-000461-GPOS-00205, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "creat" syscall occur.

Add or update the following rules in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules:

-a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S creat -F exit=-EPERM -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k access

-a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S creat -F exit=-EACCES -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k access

-a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S creat -F exit=-EPERM -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k access

-a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S creat -F exit=-EACCES -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k access

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:801
Result:false
Title:Ensure auditd Collects Unauthorized Access Attempts to Files (unsuccessful) - creat
Description:Audit rules about the unauthorized access attempts to files (unsuccessful) are enabled.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (audit augenrules 64-bit file eaccess)
          • false (audit augenrules 64-bit file eperm)
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • true (All child checks must be true.)
            • true (64 bit architecture)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
      • false (audit augenrules 32-bit file eaccess)
      • false (audit augenrules 32-bit file eperm)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (audit augenrules)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (audit auditctl 64-bit file eaccess)
          • false (audit auditctl 64-bit file eperm)
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • true (All child checks must be true.)
            • true (64 bit architecture)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)

        • false (audit auditctl)

Result:false
Title:audit augenrules 32-bit file eperm
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.

Result:false
Title:audit auditctl
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.

  • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/auditctl.*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the open syscall.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86749r5_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-030510
Identities:CCE-80386-6
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a))
Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000064-GPOS-00033, SRG-OS-000458-GPOS-00203, SRG-OS-000461-GPOS-00205, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "open" syscall occur.

Add or update the following rules in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S open -F exit=-EPERM -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k access

-a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S open -F exit=-EACCES -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k access

-a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S open -F exit=-EPERM -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k access

-a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S open -F exit=-EACCES -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k access

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:805
Result:false
Title:Ensure auditd Collects Unauthorized Access Attempts to Files (unsuccessful) - open
Description:Audit rules about the unauthorized access attempts to files (unsuccessful) are enabled.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (audit augenrules 64-bit file eaccess)
          • false (audit augenrules 64-bit file eperm)
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • true (All child checks must be true.)
            • true (64 bit architecture)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
      • false (audit augenrules 32-bit file eaccess)
      • false (audit augenrules 32-bit file eperm)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (audit augenrules)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (audit auditctl 64-bit file eaccess)
          • false (audit auditctl 64-bit file eperm)
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • true (All child checks must be true.)
            • true (64 bit architecture)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
      • false (audit auditctl 32-bit file eaccess)
      • false (audit auditctl 32-bit file eperm)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl)

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the openat syscall.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86751r5_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-030520
Identities:CCE-80387-4
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a))
Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000064-GPOS-00033, SRG-OS-000458-GPOS-00203, SRG-OS-000461-GPOS-00205, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "openat" syscall occur.

Add or update the following rules in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S openat -F exit=-EPERM -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k access

-a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S openat -F exit=-EACCES -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k access

-a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S openat -F exit=-EPERM -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k access

-a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S openat -F exit=-EACCES -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k access

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:

Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777

Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:841 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:audit augenrules 64-bit file eaccess
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2652 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
  • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+(?:.*-F[\s]+arch=b64[\s]+)(?:.*(-S[\s]+openat[\s]+|([\s]+|[,])openat([\s]+|[,])))(?:.*-F\s+exit=\-EACCES[\s]+)(?:.*-F\s+auid>=1000[\s]+)(?:.*-F\s+auid!=4294967295[\s]+).*(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

  • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/auditctl.*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the open_by_handle_at syscall.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86753r5_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-030530
Identities:CCE-80388-2
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a))
Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000064-GPOS-00033, SRG-OS-000458-GPOS-00203, SRG-OS-000461-GPOS-00205, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "open_by_handle_at" syscall occur.

Add or update the following rules in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S open_by_handle_at -F exit=-EPERM -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k access

-a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S open_by_handle_at -F exit=-EACCES -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k access

-a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S open_by_handle_at -F exit=-EPERM -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k access

-a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S open_by_handle_at -F exit=-EACCES -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k access

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:804
Result:false
Title:Ensure auditd Collects Unauthorized Access Attempts to Files (unsuccessful) - open_by_handle_at
Description:Audit rules about the unauthorized access attempts to files (unsuccessful) are enabled.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (audit augenrules 64-bit file eaccess)
          • false (audit augenrules 64-bit file eperm)
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • true (All child checks must be true.)
            • true (64 bit architecture)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
      • false (audit augenrules 32-bit file eaccess)
      • false (audit augenrules 32-bit file eperm)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (audit augenrules)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (audit auditctl 64-bit file eaccess)
          • false (audit auditctl 64-bit file eperm)
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • true (All child checks must be true.)
            • true (64 bit architecture)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
      • false (audit auditctl 32-bit file eaccess)
      • false (audit auditctl 32-bit file eperm)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl)

  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+(?:.*-F[\s]+arch=b32[\s]+)(?:.*(-S[\s]+open_by_handle_at[\s]+|([\s]+|[,])open_by_handle_at([\s]+|[,])))(?:.*-F\s+exit=\-EPERM[\s]+)(?:.*-F\s+auid>=1000[\s]+)(?:.*-F\s+auid!=4294967295[\s]+).*(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:543 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:audit auditctl
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2426 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/auditctl.*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the truncate syscall.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86755r5_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-030540
Identities:CCE-80389-0
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a))
Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000064-GPOS-00033, SRG-OS-000458-GPOS-00203, SRG-OS-000461-GPOS-00205, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "truncate" syscall occur.

Add or update the following rules in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S truncate -F exit=-EPERM -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k access

-a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S truncate -F exit=-EACCES -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k access

-a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S truncate -F exit=-EPERM -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k access

-a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S truncate -F exit=-EACCES -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k access

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:

Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the ftruncate syscall.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86757r5_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-030550
Identities:CCE-80390-8
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a))
Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000064-GPOS-00033, SRG-OS-000458-GPOS-00203, SRG-OS-000461-GPOS-00205, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "ftruncate" syscall occur.

Add or update the following rules in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S ftruncate -F exit=-EPERM -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k access

-a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S ftruncate -F exit=-EACCES -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k access

-a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S ftruncate -F exit=-EPERM -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k access

-a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S ftruncate -F exit=-EACCES -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k access

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.

Weight:10.0

  • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
  • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+(?:.*-F[\s]+arch=b32[\s]+)(?:.*(-S[\s]+ftruncate[\s]+|([\s]+|[,])ftruncate([\s]+|[,])))(?:.*-F\s+exit=\-EPERM[\s]+)(?:.*-F\s+auid>=1000[\s]+)(?:.*-F\s+auid!=4294967295[\s]+).*(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:545 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:true
Title:audit augenrules
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2427 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'

  • filepath equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
  • path equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system'
  • filename equals 'auditd.service'
  • pattern equals '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
  • instance equals '1'

  • line equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'

Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the semanage command.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86759r4_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-030560
Identities:CCE-80391-6
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a))
Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000463-GPOS-00207, SRG-OS-000465-GPOS-00209 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "semanage" command occur.

Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-a always,exit -F path=/usr/sbin/semanage -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k privileged-priv_change

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:618
Result:false
Title:Record Any Attempts to Run semanage
Description:Audit rules about the information on the use of semanage is enabled.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (audit augenrules semanage)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (audit augenrules)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (audit auditctl semanage)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:619 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:audit augenrules semanage
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2484 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
  • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=\/usr\/sbin\/semanage[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*)?x([rwa]*)?[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=4294967295[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:545 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:true
Title:audit augenrules
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2427 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
Collected Item Properties:
  • filepath equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
  • path equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system'
  • filename equals 'auditd.service'
  • pattern equals '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
  • instance equals '1'
  • text equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
  • line equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
  • subexpression does not exist
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:620 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:audit auditctl semanage
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2485 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=\/usr\/sbin\/semanage[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*)?x([rwa]*)?[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=4294967295[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:543 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:audit auditctl
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2426 (textfilecontent54_object)

  • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/auditctl.*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

Result:Fail

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the chcon command.

Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-030580
Identities:CCE-80393-2
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a))

Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the setfiles command.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86765r5_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-030590
Identities:CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a))
Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

  • line equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
  • subexpression does not exist
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8676501 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:audit auditctl restorecon
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:8676501 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=(\/usr)?\/sbin\/setfiles[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=4294967295[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'

Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:543 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:audit auditctl
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.

Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/auditctl.*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must generate audit records for all unsuccessful account access events.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86769r4_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-030610
Identities:CCE-80383-3
CCI-000126 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-2 d; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-2.1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-2 d)
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a))
Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000470-GPOS-00214, SRG-OS-000473-GPOS-00218 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when unsuccessful account access events occur.

Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-w /var/run/faillock -p wa -k logins

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:675
Result:false
Title:Record Attempts to Alter Login and Logout Events - faillock
Description:Audit rules should be configured to log successful and unsuccessful login and logout events.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (audit augenrules faillock)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (audit augenrules)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (audit auditctl faillock)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:677 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:audit augenrules faillock
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2524 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
  • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^\-w\s+/var/run/faillock/?\s+\-p\s+\b([rx]*w[rx]*a[rx]*|[rx]*a[rx]*w[rx]*)\b\s+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[-\w]+\s*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:545 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:true
Title:audit augenrules
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2427 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
Collected Item Properties:
  • filepath equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
  • path equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system'
  • filename equals 'auditd.service'
  • pattern equals '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
  • instance equals '1'
  • text equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
  • line equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
  • subexpression does not exist
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:678 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:audit auditctl faillock
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2525 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^\-w\s+/var/run/faillock/?\s+\-p\s+\b([rx]*w[rx]*a[rx]*|[rx]*a[rx]*w[rx]*)\b\s+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[-\w]+\s*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'

Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:543 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:audit auditctl
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.

  • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/auditctl.*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must generate audit records for all successful account access events.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86771r3_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-030620
Identities:CCE-80384-1
CCI-000126 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-2 d; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-2.1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-2 d)
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a))
Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000470-GPOS-00214, SRG-OS-000473-GPOS-00218 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful account access events occur.

Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-w /var/log/lastlog -p wa -k logins

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.

        • false (audit auditctl)

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the passwd command.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86773r5_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-030630
Identities:CCE-80395-7
CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1))
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a))
Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged password commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise.

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "passwd" command occur.

Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-a always,exit -F path=/usr/bin/passwd -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k privileged-passwd

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:733
Result:false
Title:Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - passwd
Description:Audit rules about the information on the use of passwd is enabled.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (audit augenrules passwd)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (audit augenrules)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (audit auditctl passwd)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:734 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:audit augenrules passwd
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2570 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
  • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=\/usr\/bin\/passwd[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=4294967295[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:545 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:true
Title:audit augenrules
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2427 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
Collected Item Properties:
  • filepath equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
  • path equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system'
  • filename equals 'auditd.service'
  • pattern equals '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
  • instance equals '1'
  • text equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
  • line equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
  • subexpression does not exist
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:735 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:audit auditctl passwd
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2571 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=\/usr\/bin\/passwd[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=4294967295[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'

Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.

  • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/auditctl.*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the unix_chkpwd command.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86775r5_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-030640
Identities:CCE-80396-5
CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1))

At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged password commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise.

-a always,exit -F path=/usr/sbin/unix_chkpwd -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k privileged-passwd

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the gpasswd command.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86777r5_rule
Result:Fail

Identities:CCE-80397-3

  • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
  • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=\/usr\/bin\/gpasswd[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=4294967295[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:545 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:true
Title:audit augenrules
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2427 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
Collected Item Properties:
  • filepath equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
  • path equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system'
  • filename equals 'auditd.service'
  • pattern equals '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
  • instance equals '1'
  • text equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
  • line equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
  • subexpression does not exist
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:726 (textfilecontent54_test)

Check Existence:All collected items must exist.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the chage command.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86779r5_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-030660
Identities:CCE-80398-1
CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1))
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a))
Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged password commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise.

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "chage" command occur.

Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-a always,exit -F path=/usr/bin/chage -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k privileged-passwd

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:715
Result:false
Title:Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - chage
Description:Audit rules about the information on the use of chage is enabled.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (audit augenrules chage)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (audit augenrules)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (audit auditctl chage)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl)
Tests:

Check Existence:All collected items must exist.

  • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
  • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=\/usr\/bin\/chage[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=4294967295[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the su command.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86783r5_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-030680
Identities:CCE-80400-5
CCI-000130 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3)
CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1))
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a))
Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged access commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise.

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215 false

-a always,exit -F path=/usr/bin/su -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k privileged-priv_change

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the sudoers file and all files in the /etc/sudoers.d/ directory.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86787r5_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-030700
Identities:CCE-27461-3
CCI-000130 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3)
CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1))
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a))
Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged access commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise.

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to access the "/etc/sudoers" file and files in the "/etc/sudoers.d/" directory.

Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-w /etc/sudoers -p wa -k privileged-actions

-w /etc/sudoers.d/ -p wa -k privileged-actions

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:773
Result:false
Title:Audit System Administrator Actions
Description:Audit actions taken by system administrators on the system.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (audit augenrules sudoers)
      • false (audit augenrules sudoers.d)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (audit augenrules)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (audit auditctl sudoers)
      • false (audit auditctl sudoers.d)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:774 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:audit augenrules sudoers
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2598 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
  • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^\-w[\s]+/etc/sudoers[\s]+\-p[\s]+\b([rx]*w[rx]*a[rx]*|[rx]*a[rx]*w[rx]*)\b[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[-\w]+[\s]*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the newgrp command.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86789r4_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-030710
Identities:CCE-80403-9
CCI-000130 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3)
CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1))
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a))
Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged access commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise.

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "newgrp" command occur.

Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-a always,exit -F path=/usr/bin/newgrp -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k privileged-priv_change

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:

Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7

Class:compliance

    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (audit augenrules newgrp)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (audit augenrules)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (audit auditctl newgrp)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl)

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the chsh command.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86791r4_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-030720
Identities:CCE-80404-7
CCI-000130 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3)
CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1))
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a))
Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged access commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the mount command and syscall.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86795r7_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-030740
Identities:CCE-27447-2
CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1))
CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a))
Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged mount commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise.

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "mount" command and syscall occur.

Add or update the following rules in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S mount -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k privileged-mount
-a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S mount -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k privileged-mount
-a always,exit -F path=/usr/bin/mount -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k privileged-mount

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:686
Result:false
Title:The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the mount command and syscall.
Description:Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is no possible if audit records do not contain enough information. At a minimum, the orginization must audit the full-text recording of privileged mount commands. The orginization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit augenrules /bin/mount)
        • false (audit augenrules /usr/bin/mount)
      • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit augenrules mount 64-bit)
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • true (All child checks must be true.)
            • true (64 bit architecture)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
      • false (audit augenrules mount 32-bit)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (audit augenrules)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl /bin/mount)
        • false (audit auditctl /usr/bin/mount)
      • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl mount 64-bit)
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • true (All child checks must be true.)
            • true (64 bit architecture)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
      • false (audit auditctl mount 32-bit)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:68600 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:audit augenrules /bin/mount
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:68600 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
  • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^\-a\s+always,exit\s+(?:(\-F[\s]+path=\/bin\/mount[\s]+))(?:-F\s+auid>=1000\s+\-F\s+auid!=4294967295\s+)(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[-\w]+\s*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:68601 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:audit augenrules /usr/bin/mount
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:68601 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
  • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^\-a\s+always,exit\s+(?:(-F[\s]+path=\/usr\/bin\/mount[\s]+))(?:-F\s+auid>=1000\s+\-F\s+auid!=4294967295\s+)(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[-\w]+\s*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:688 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:audit augenrules mount 64-bit
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2533 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
  • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^\-a\s+always,exit\s+(\-F\s+arch=b64\s+)(?:.*(-S[\s]+mount[\s]+|([\s]+|[,])mount([\s]+|[,])))(?:.*-F\s+auid>=1000\s+\-F\s+auid!=4294967295\s+)(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[-\w]+\s*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

  • Collect any available items.

  • all processor_type must be equal to 'x86_64'

Title:64 bit architecture

Object Requirements:
  • Collect any available items.

  • all processor_type must be equal to 'ppc64'

  • node_name equals 'ip-10-0-1-28.ec2.internal'

Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1430 (uname_test)
Result:false
Title:64 bit architecture
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:3101 (uname_object)
Object Requirements:
  • Collect any available items.

State Requirements:
  • all processor_type must be equal to 'ppc64le'

  • machine_class equals 'x86_64'
  • node_name equals 'ip-10-0-1-28.ec2.internal'
  • os_name equals 'Linux'
  • os_release equals '3.10.0-1127.8.2.el7.x86_64'
  • os_version equals '#1 SMP Thu May 7 19:30:37 EDT 2020'
  • processor_type equals 'x86_64'
Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:687 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:audit augenrules mount 32-bit

Check:Result is based on check existence only.

Object Requirements:
  • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
  • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^\-a\s+always,exit\s+(\-F\s+arch=b32\s+)(?:.*(-S[\s]+mount[\s]+|([\s]+|[,])mount([\s]+|[,])))(?:.*-F\s+auid>=1000\s+\-F\s+auid!=4294967295\s+)(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[-\w]+\s*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the umount command.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86797r5_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-030750
Identities:CCE-80405-4
CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1))
CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a))
Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged mount commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise.

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "umount" command occur.

Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-a always,exit -F path=/usr/bin/umount -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k privileged-mount

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:757
Result:false
Title:Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - umount
Description:Audit rules about the information on the use of umount is enabled.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (audit augenrules umount)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (audit augenrules)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (audit auditctl umount)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:758 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:audit augenrules umount
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2586 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
  • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=(\/usr)?\/bin\/umount[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=4294967295[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:545 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:true
Title:audit augenrules
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2427 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
Collected Item Properties:
  • filepath equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
  • path equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system'
  • filename equals 'auditd.service'
  • pattern equals '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
  • instance equals '1'
  • text equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
  • line equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
  • subexpression does not exist
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:759 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:audit auditctl umount
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2587 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=(\/usr)?\/bin\/umount[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=4294967295[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:543 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:audit auditctl
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2426 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/auditctl.*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the postdrop command.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86799r4_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-030760
Identities:CCE-80406-2
CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1))
CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a))
Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged postfix commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise.

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "postdrop" command occur.

Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-a always,exit -F path=/usr/sbin/postdrop -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k privileged-postfix

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:

Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777

    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (audit augenrules postdrop)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (audit augenrules)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (audit auditctl postdrop)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl)

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the postqueue command.

Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-030770
Identities:CCE-80407-0
CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1))
CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a))
Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged postfix commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise.

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172 false

-a always,exit -F path=/usr/sbin/postqueue -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k privileged-postfix

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the ssh-keysign command.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86803r3_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-030780
Identities:CCE-80408-8
CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1))
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a))
Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged ssh commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise.

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "ssh-keysign" command occur.

Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-a always,exit -F path=/usr/libexec/openssh/ssh-keysign -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k privileged-ssh

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:745
Result:false
Title:Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - ssh_keysign
Description:Audit rules about the information on the use of ssh_keysign is enabled.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (audit augenrules ssh_keysign)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (audit augenrules)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (audit auditctl ssh_keysign)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:746 (textfilecontent54_test)

  • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=\/usr\/libexec\/openssh\/ssh-keysign[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=4294967295[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'

Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:545 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:true
Title:audit augenrules
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2427 (textfilecontent54_object)

  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the crontab command.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86807r3_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-030800
Identities:CCE-80410-4
CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1))
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a))
Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise.

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "crontab" command occur.

Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-a always,exit -F path=/usr/bin/crontab -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k privileged-cron

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:721
Result:false
Title:Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - crontab
Description:Audit rules about the information on the use of crontab is enabled.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (audit augenrules crontab)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (audit augenrules)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (audit auditctl crontab)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:722 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:audit augenrules crontab
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2562 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
  • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=\/usr\/bin\/crontab[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=4294967295[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the pam_timestamp_check command.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86809r4_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-030810
Identities:CCE-80411-2
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one. false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "pam_timestamp_check" command occur.

Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-a always,exit -F path=/usr/sbin/pam_timestamp_check -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k privileged-pam

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:

Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7

    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (audit augenrules pam_timestamp_check)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (audit augenrules)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (audit auditctl pam_timestamp_check)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl)

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the init_module syscall.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86811r5_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-030820
Identities:CCE-80414-6
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00216, SRG-OS-000477-GPOS-00222 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "init_module" syscall occur.

Add or update the following rules in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S init_module -k module-change

-a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S init_module -k module-change

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:657
Result:false
Title:Audit Kernel Module Loading and Unloading - init_module
Description:The audit rules should be configured to log information about kernel module loading and unloading.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit augenrules 64-bit init_module)
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • true (All child checks must be true.)
            • true (64 bit architecture)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
      • false (audit augenrules 32-bit init_module)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (audit augenrules)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl 64-bit init_module)
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • true (All child checks must be true.)
            • true (64 bit architecture)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
      • false (audit auditctl 32-bit init_module)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl)
Tests:

  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+(?:.*-F[\s]+arch=b64[\s]+)(?:.*(-S[\s]+init_module[\s]+|([\s]+|[,])init_module([\s]+|[,]))).*(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the delete_module syscall.

Identities:CCE-80415-3

Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

-a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S delete_module -k module-change

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.

Title:audit augenrules 64-bit delete_module
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2511 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
  • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+(?:.*-F[\s]+arch=b64[\s]+)(?:.*(-S[\s]+delete_module[\s]+|([\s]+|[,])delete_module([\s]+|[,]))).*(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1432 (uname_test)
Result:true
Title:64 bit architecture
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the kmod command.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86815r5_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-030840
Identities:CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00216, SRG-OS-000477-GPOS-00222 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "kmod" command occur.

Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-w /usr/bin/kmod -p x -F auid!=4294967295 -k module-change

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:86815
Result:false
Title:Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - kmod
Description:Audit rules about the information on the use of kmod is enabled.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (audit augenrules kmod)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (audit augenrules)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (audit auditctl kmod)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8681500 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:audit augenrules kmod
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:8681500 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
  • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-w\s+\/usr\/bin\/kmod[\s]+((-F[\s]+perm=|-p\s+)([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid!=4294967295[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:545 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:true
Title:audit augenrules
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2427 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'

  • line equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
  • subexpression does not exist
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8681501 (textfilecontent54_test)

Check Existence:All collected items must exist.

  • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-w\s+\/usr\/bin\/kmod[\s]+((-F[\s]+perm=|-p\s+)([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid!=4294967295[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'

  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect /etc/passwd.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86821r5_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-030870
Identities:CCE-80435-1
CCI-000018 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4))
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
CCI-001403 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4))
CCI-002130 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4))
Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000004-GPOS-00004, SRG-OS-000239-GPOS-00089, SRG-OS-000240-GPOS-00090, SRG-OS-000241-GPOS-00091, SRG-OS-000303-GPOS-00120, SRG-OS-000476-GPOS-00221 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect "/etc/passwd".

Add or update the following rule "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-w /etc/passwd -p wa -k identity

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:875
Result:false
Title:Audit User/Group Modification (/etc/passwd)
Description:Audit user/group modification.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (audit augenrules /etc/passwd)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (audit augenrules)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (audit /etc/passwd)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl)
Tests:
