The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the rename syscall.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86823r5_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-030880
Identities:CCE-27206-2
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a))
Description: If the system is not configured to audit certain activities and write them to an audit log, it is more difficult to detect and track system compromises and damages incurred during a system compromise.

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000466-GPOS-00210, SRG-OS-000467-GPOS-00210, SRG-OS-000468-GPOS-00212, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "rename" syscall occur.

Add the following rules in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S rename -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k delete

-a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S rename -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k delete

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:628
Result:false
Title:Audit File Deletion Events - rename
Description:The deletion of files should be audited.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit augenrules 64-bit rename)
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • true (All child checks must be true.)
            • true (64 bit architecture)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
      • false (audit augenrules 32-bit rename)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (audit augenrules)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl 64-bit rename)
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • true (All child checks must be true.)
            • true (64 bit architecture)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
      • false (audit auditctl 32-bit rename)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl)
Tests:

  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+(?:.*-F[\s]+arch=b64[\s]+)(?:.*(-S[\s]+rename[\s]+|([\s]+|[,])rename([\s]+|[,])))(?:.*-F\s+auid>=1000[\s]+)(?:.*-F\s+auid!=4294967295[\s]+).*(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'

  • instance must be equal to '1'

  • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/auditctl.*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the renameat syscall.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86825r5_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-030890
Identities:CCE-80413-8
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a))
Description: If the system is not configured to audit certain activities and write them to an audit log, it is more difficult to detect and track system compromises and damages incurred during a system compromise.

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000466-GPOS-00210, SRG-OS-000467-GPOS-00210, SRG-OS-000468-GPOS-00212, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "renameat" syscall occur.

Add the following rules in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S renameat -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k delete

-a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S renameat -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k delete

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:629
Result:false
Title:Audit File Deletion Events - renameat
Description:The deletion of files should be audited.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit augenrules 64-bit renameat)
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • true (All child checks must be true.)
            • true (64 bit architecture)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
      • false (audit augenrules 32-bit renameat)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (audit augenrules)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl 64-bit renameat)
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • true (All child checks must be true.)
            • true (64 bit architecture)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
      • false (audit auditctl 32-bit renameat)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:635 (textfilecontent54_test)

Check:Result is based on check existence only.

  • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
  • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+(?:.*-F[\s]+arch=b64[\s]+)(?:.*(-S[\s]+renameat[\s]+|([\s]+|[,])renameat([\s]+|[,])))(?:.*-F\s+auid>=1000[\s]+)(?:.*-F\s+auid!=4294967295[\s]+).*(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the rmdir syscall.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86827r5_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-030900
Identities:CCE-80412-0
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a))
Description: If the system is not configured to audit certain activities and write them to an audit log, it is more difficult to detect and track system compromises and damages incurred during a system compromise.

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000466-GPOS-00210, SRG-OS-000467-GPOS-00210, SRG-OS-000468-GPOS-00212, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "rmdir" syscall occur.

Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:643 (textfilecontent54_test)

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the unlinkat syscall.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86831r5_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-030920
Identities:CCE-27206-2
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a))
Description: If the system is not configured to audit certain activities and write them to an audit log, it is more difficult to detect and track system compromises and damages incurred during a system compromise.

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000466-GPOS-00210, SRG-OS-000467-GPOS-00210, SRG-OS-000468-GPOS-00212, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "unlinkat" syscall occur.

Add the following rules in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S unlinkat -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k delete

-a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S unlinkat -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k delete

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:627
Result:false
Title:Audit File Deletion Events - unlinkat
Description:The deletion of files should be audited.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit augenrules 64-bit unlinkat)
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • true (All child checks must be true.)
            • true (64 bit architecture)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
      • false (audit augenrules 32-bit unlinkat)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (audit augenrules)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl 64-bit unlinkat)
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • true (All child checks must be true.)
            • true (64 bit architecture)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
      • false (audit auditctl 32-bit unlinkat)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl)
Tests:

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must limit the number of concurrent sessions to 10 for all accounts and/or account types.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86841r3_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-040000
Identities:CCE-27081-9
CCI-000054 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-10; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-10.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-10)
Description: Operating system management includes the ability to control the number of users and user sessions that utilize an operating system. Limiting the number of allowed users and sessions per user is helpful in reducing the risks related to DoS attacks.

This requirement addresses concurrent sessions for information system accounts and does not address concurrent sessions by single users via multiple system accounts. The maximum number of concurrent sessions should be defined based on mission needs and the operational environment for each system. false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to limit the number of concurrent sessions to "10" for all accounts and/or account types.

Add the following line to the top of the /etc/security/limits.conf or in a ".conf" file defined in /etc/security/limits.d/ :

* hard maxlogins 10
Severity:low
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:449
Result:false
Title:Set Maximum Number of Concurrent Login Sessions Per User
Description:The maximum number of concurrent login sessions per user should meet minimum requirements.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (All child checks must be true.)
    • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (the value maxlogins should be set appropriately in /etc/security/limits.d/*.conf) (negated)
        • false (the value maxlogins should be set appropriately in /etc/security/limits.conf)
      • false (the value maxlogins should be set appropriately in /etc/security/limits.d/*.conf)
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (limits.d maxlogins in all domains configured correctly)
      • true (limits.conf maxlogins in all domains configured correctly)
    • false (all values are integers)
Tests:

  • path must be equal to '/etc/security/limits.d'
  • filename must match the pattern '^.*\.conf$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*\*[\s]+(?:(?:hard)|(?:-))[\s]+maxlogins'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must use a FIPS 140-2 approved cryptographic algorithm for SSH communications.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86845r3_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-040110
Identities:CCE-27295-5
CCI-000068 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-17 (2); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-17 (2).1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-17 (2))
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
CCI-000803 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-7; NIST SP 800-53A: IA-7.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-7)
Description: Unapproved mechanisms that are used for authentication to the cryptographic module are not verified and therefore cannot be relied upon to provide confidentiality or integrity, and DoD data may be compromised.

Operating systems utilizing encryption are required to use FIPS-compliant mechanisms for authenticating to cryptographic modules.

FIPS 140-2 is the current standard for validating that mechanisms used to access cryptographic modules utilize authentication that meets DoD requirements. This allows for Security Levels 1, 2, 3, or 4 for use on a general purpose computing system.

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000033-GPOS-00014, SRG-OS-000120-GPOS-00061, SRG-OS-000125-GPOS-00065, SRG-OS-000250-GPOS-00093, SRG-OS-000393-GPOS-00173 false
Fix Text:Configure SSH to use FIPS 140-2 approved cryptographic algorithms.

Add the following line (or modify the line to have the required value) to the "/etc/ssh/sshd_config" file (this file may be named differently or be in a different location if using a version of SSH that is provided by a third-party vendor).

Ciphers aes128-ctr,aes192-ctr,aes256-ctr

The SSH service must be restarted for changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:1399
Result:false
Title:Use Only Approved Ciphers for SSH
Description:Limit the SSH ciphers to those which are FIPS-approved.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)

        • false (check for fips=1 in grub.cfg)
        • false (check for 1 in /proc/sys/crypto/fips_enabled)
        • true (check for fips=0 in /etc/default/grub)

Result:false
Title:package openssh-server is removed
Check Existence:No collected items may exist.

Collected Item Properties:
  • name equals 'openssh-server'
  • arch equals 'x86_64'
  • epoch equals '(none)'
  • release equals '21.el7'
  • version equals '7.4p1'
  • evr equals '0:7.4p1-21.el7'
  • signature_keyid equals '199e2f91fd431d51'
  • extended_name equals 'openssh-server-(none):7.4p1-21.el7.x86_64'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must display the Standard Mandatory DoD Notice and Consent Banner immediately prior to, or as part of, remote access logon prompts.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86849r4_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-040170
Identities:CCE-27314-4
CCI-000048 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-8 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-8.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-8 a)
CCI-000050 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-8 b; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-8.1 (iii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-8 b)
CCI-001384 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-8 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-8.2 (i); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-8 c 1)
CCI-001385 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-8 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-8.2 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-8 c 2)
CCI-001386 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-8 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-8.2 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-8 c 2)
CCI-001387 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-8 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-8.2 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-8 c 2)
CCI-001388 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-8 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-8.2 (iii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-8 c 3)
Description: Display of a standardized and approved use notification before granting access to the publicly accessible operating system ensures privacy and security notification verbiage used is consistent with applicable federal laws, Executive Orders, directives, policies, regulations, standards, and guidance.

System use notifications are required only for access via logon interfaces with human users and are not required when such human interfaces do not exist.

The banner must be formatted in accordance with applicable DoD policy. Use the following verbiage for operating systems that can accommodate banners of 1300 characters:

"You are accessing a U.S. Government (USG) Information System (IS) that is provided for USG-authorized use only.

By using this IS (which includes any device attached to this IS), you consent to the following conditions:

-The USG routinely intercepts and monitors communications on this IS for purposes including, but not limited to, penetration testing, COMSEC monitoring, network operations and defense, personnel misconduct (PM), law enforcement (LE), and counterintelligence (CI) investigations.

-At any time, the USG may inspect and seize data stored on this IS.

-Communications using, or data stored on, this IS are not private, are subject to routine monitoring, interception, and search, and may be disclosed or used for any USG-authorized purpose.

-This IS includes security measures (e.g., authentication and access controls) to protect USG interests--not for your personal benefit or privacy.

-Notwithstanding the above, using this IS does not constitute consent to PM, LE or CI investigative searching or monitoring of the content of privileged communications, or work product, related to personal representation or services by attorneys, psychotherapists, or clergy, and their assistants. Such communications and work product are private and confidential. See User Agreement for details."

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000023-GPOS-00006, SRG-OS-000024-GPOS-00007 , SRG-OS-000228-GPOS-00088 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to display the Standard Mandatory DoD Notice and Consent Banner before granting access to the system via the ssh.

Edit the "/etc/ssh/sshd_config" file to uncomment the banner keyword and configure it to point to a file that will contain the logon banner (this file may be named differently or be in a different location if using a version of SSH that is provided by a third-party vendor). An example configuration line is:

banner /etc/issue

Either create the file containing the banner or replace the text in the file with the Standard Mandatory DoD Notice and Consent Banner. The DoD required text is:

"You are accessing a U.S. Government (USG) Information System (IS) that is provided for USG-authorized use only. By using this IS (which includes any device attached to this IS), you consent to the following conditions:

-The USG routinely intercepts and monitors communications on this IS for purposes including, but not limited to, penetration testing, COMSEC monitoring, network operations and defense, personnel misconduct (PM), law enforcement (LE), and counterintelligence (CI) investigations.

-At any time, the USG may inspect and seize data stored on this IS.

-Communications using, or data stored on, this IS are not private, are subject to routine monitoring, interception, and search, and may be disclosed or used for any USG-authorized purpose.

-This IS includes security measures (e.g., authentication and access controls) to protect USG interests--not for your personal benefit or privacy.

-Notwithstanding the above, using this IS does not constitute consent to PM, LE or CI investigative searching or monitoring of the content of privileged communications, or work product, related to personal representation or services by attorneys, psychotherapists, or clergy, and their assistants. Such communications and work product are private and confidential. See User Agreement for details."

The SSH service must be restarted for changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat 7
Identifier:2777
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:1387
Result:false
Title:Enable a Warning Banner
Description:SSH warning banner should be enabled (and dependencies are met)
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (The file specified in the Banner setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file)
      • false (The file specified in the Banner setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file exists)
      • false (The file specified in the Banner setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file contains a valid banner)
      • true (The file specified in the Banner setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file does not contain any extra text)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (package openssh-server is removed)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1388 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:The file specified in the Banner setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:3067 (textfilecontent54_object)

  • filepath must be equal to '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*(?i)Banner(?-i)[\s]+(\S+)[\s]*(?:|(?:#.*))?$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'

        Title:package openssh-server is removed

        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

        The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that all network connections associated with SSH traffic are terminated at the end of the session or after 10 minutes of inactivity, except to fulfill documented and validated mission requirements.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86861r4_rule
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-040320
        Identities:CCE-27433-2
        CCI-001133 (NIST SP 800-53: SC-10; NIST SP 800-53A: SC-10.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-10)
        CCI-002361 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-12)
        Description: Terminating an idle SSH session within a short time period reduces the window of opportunity for unauthorized personnel to take control of a management session enabled on the console or console port that has been left unattended. In addition, quickly terminating an idle SSH session will also free up resources committed by the managed network element.

        Terminating network connections associated with communications sessions includes, for example, de-allocating associated TCP/IP address/port pairs at the operating system level and de-allocating networking assignments at the application level if multiple application sessions are using a single operating system-level network connection. This does not mean that the operating system terminates all sessions or network access; it only ends the inactive session and releases the resources associated with that session.

        Satisfies: SRG-OS-000163-GPOS-00072, SRG-OS-000279-GPOS-00109 false
        Fix Text:Configure the operating system to automatically terminate a user session after inactivity time-outs have expired or at shutdown.

        Add the following line (or modify the line to have the required value) to the "/etc/ssh/sshd_config" file (this file may be named differently or be in a different location if using a version of SSH that is provided by a third-party vendor):

        ClientAliveInterval 600

        The SSH service must be restarted for changes to take effect.
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat 7
        Identifier:2777
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:1391
        Result:false
        Title:Set OpenSSH Idle Timeout Interval
        Description:The SSH idle timeout interval should be set to an appropriate value.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (timeout is configured)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (package openssh-server is removed)
        Tests:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1392 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:timeout is configured
        Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
        Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
        State Operator:All item-state comparisons must be true.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:3069 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*(?i)ClientAliveInterval[\s]+(\d+)[\s]*(?:|(?:#.*))?$'
        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
        State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:3070 (textfilecontent54_state)
        State Requirements:
        • for all subexpression, all of the following must be true:
          • subexpression must be less than or equal to '600'
        State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:3071 (textfilecontent54_state)
        State Requirements:
        • all subexpression must be greater than '0'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1269 (rpminfo_test)
        Result:false
        Title:package openssh-server is removed
        Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2994 (rpminfo_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • name must be equal to 'openssh-server'
        Collected Item Properties:
        • name equals 'openssh-server'
        • arch equals 'x86_64'
        • epoch equals '(none)'
        • release equals '21.el7'
        • version equals '7.4p1'
        • evr equals '0:7.4p1-21.el7'
        • signature_keyid equals '199e2f91fd431d51'
        • extended_name equals 'openssh-server-(none):7.4p1-21.el7.x86_64'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

        The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that all network connections associated with SSH traffic terminate after a period of inactivity.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86865r4_rule
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-040340
        Identities:CCE-27082-7
        CCI-001133 (NIST SP 800-53: SC-10; NIST SP 800-53A: SC-10.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-10)
        CCI-002361 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-12)
        Description: Terminating an idle SSH session within a short time period reduces the window of opportunity for unauthorized personnel to take control of a management session enabled on the console or console port that has been left unattended. In addition, quickly terminating an idle SSH session will also free up resources committed by the managed network element.

        Terminating network connections associated with communications sessions includes, for example, de-allocating associated TCP/IP address/port pairs at the operating system level and de-allocating networking assignments at the application level if multiple application sessions are using a single operating system-level network connection. This does not mean that the operating system terminates all sessions or network access; it only ends the inactive session and releases the resources associated with that session.

        Satisfies: SRG-OS-000163-GPOS-00072, SRG-OS-000279-GPOS-00109 false
        Fix Text:Configure the operating system to terminate automatically a user session after inactivity time-outs have expired or at shutdown.

        Add the following line (or modify the line to have the required value) to the "/etc/ssh/sshd_config" file (this file may be named differently or be in a different location if using a version of SSH that is provided by a third-party vendor):

        ClientAliveCountMax 0

        The SSH service must be restarted for changes to take effect.
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0

        The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the SSH daemon does not allow authentication using rhosts authentication.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86867r3_rule
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-040350
        Identities:CCE-27377-1
        CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
        Description: Configuring this setting for the SSH daemon provides additional assurance that remote logon via SSH will require a password, even in the event of misconfiguration elsewhere. false
        Fix Text:Configure the SSH daemon to not allow authentication using known hosts authentication.

        Add the following line in "/etc/ssh/sshd_config", or uncomment the line and set the value to "yes":

        IgnoreRhosts yes
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat 7
        Identifier:2777
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:1377
        Result:false
        Title:Disable .rhosts Files
        Description:Emulation of the rsh command through the ssh server should be disabled (and dependencies are met)
        Class:compliance
        Tests:

          • false (Tests the value of the IgnoreRhosts[\s]*(<:nocomment:>*) setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file)

            • false (package openssh-server is removed)
        Tests:

        Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
        Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:3062 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*(?i)IgnoreRhosts(?-i)[\s]+(\w+)[\s]*(?:|(?:#.*))?$'
        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
        State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:8686700 (textfilecontent54_state)
        State Requirements:
        • all subexpression must be equal to 'yes'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1269 (rpminfo_test)
        Result:false
        Title:package openssh-server is removed
        Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2994 (rpminfo_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • name must be equal to 'openssh-server'
        Collected Item Properties:
        • name equals 'openssh-server'
        • arch equals 'x86_64'
        • epoch equals '(none)'

        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

        The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must display the date and time of the last successful account logon upon an SSH logon.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86869r3_rule
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-040360
        Identities:CCE-80225-6
        CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
        Description: Providing users with feedback on when account accesses via SSH last occurred facilitates user recognition and reporting of unauthorized account use. false
        Fix Text:Configure SSH to provide users with feedback on when account accesses last occurred by setting the required configuration options in "/etc/pam.d/sshd" or in the "sshd_config" file used by the system ("/etc/ssh/sshd_config" will be used in the example) (this file may be named differently or be in a different location if using a version of SSH that is provided by a third-party vendor).

        Modify the "PrintLastLog" line in "/etc/ssh/sshd_config" to match the following:

        PrintLastLog yes

        The SSH service must be restarted for changes to "sshd_config" to take effect.
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat 7
        Identifier:2777
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:166
        Result:false
        Title:The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must display the date and time of the last successful account logon upon SSH logon.
        Description:Providing users with feedback on when account accesses via SSH last occurred facilitates user recognition and reporting of unauthorized account use.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (tests the value of PrintLastLog setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (package openssh-server is removed)
        Tests:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:167 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:tests the value of PrintLastLog setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file
        Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
        Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2102 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*(?i)PrintLastLog(?-i)[ \t]+([\w\"]+)[\s]*(?:|(?:#.*))?$'
        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
        State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:8686900 (textfilecontent54_state)
        State Requirements:
        • all subexpression must match the pattern '^yes$|^"yes"$'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1269 (rpminfo_test)
        Result:false
        Title:package openssh-server is removed
        Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2994 (rpminfo_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • name must be equal to 'openssh-server'
        Collected Item Properties:
        • name equals 'openssh-server'
        • arch equals 'x86_64'
        • epoch equals '(none)'

        The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not permit direct logons to the root account using remote access via SSH.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86871r3_rule
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-040370
        Identities:CCE-27445-6
        CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
        Description: Even though the communications channel may be encrypted, an additional layer of security is gained by extending the policy of not logging on directly as root. In addition, logging on with a user-specific account provides individual accountability of actions performed on the system. false
        Fix Text:Configure SSH to stop users from logging on remotely as the root user.

        Edit the appropriate "/etc/ssh/sshd_config" file to uncomment or add the line for the "PermitRootLogin" keyword and set its value to "no" (this file may be named differently or be in a different location if using a version of SSH that is provided by a third-party vendor):

        PermitRootLogin no

        The SSH service must be restarted for changes to take effect.
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat 7
        Identifier:2777
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:1381
        Result:false
        Title:Disable root Login via SSH
        Description:Root login via SSH should be disabled (and dependencies are met)
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (Tests the value of the PermitRootLogin[\s]*(<:nocomment:>*) setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (package openssh-server is removed)
        Tests:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1382 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:Tests the value of the PermitRootLogin[\s]*(<:nocomment:>*) setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file
        Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
        Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:3064 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*(?i)PermitRootLogin(?-i)[\s]+(\w+)[\s]*(?:|(?:#.*))?$'
        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
        State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:8687100 (textfilecontent54_state)
        State Requirements:
        • all subexpression must be equal to 'no'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1269 (rpminfo_test)
        Result:false
        Title:package openssh-server is removed
        Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2994 (rpminfo_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • name must be equal to 'openssh-server'
        Collected Item Properties:
        • name equals 'openssh-server'
        • arch equals 'x86_64'
        • epoch equals '(none)'
        • release equals '21.el7'
        • version equals '7.4p1'
        • evr equals '0:7.4p1-21.el7'
        • signature_keyid equals '199e2f91fd431d51'
        • extended_name equals 'openssh-server-(none):7.4p1-21.el7.x86_64'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

        The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the SSH daemon does not allow authentication using known hosts authentication.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86873r3_rule
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-040380
        Identities:CCE-80372-6
        CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
        Description: Configuring this setting for the SSH daemon provides additional assurance that remote logon via SSH will require a password, even in the event of misconfiguration elsewhere. false
        Fix Text:Configure the SSH daemon to not allow authentication using known hosts authentication.

        Add the following line in "/etc/ssh/sshd_config", or uncomment the line and set the value to "yes":

        IgnoreUserKnownHosts yes

        The SSH service must be restarted for changes to take effect.
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat 7
        Identifier:2777
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:1383
        Result:false
        Title:Disable SSH Support for User Known Hosts
        Description:SSH can allow system users host-based authentication to connect to systems if a cache of the remote systems public keys are available. This should be disabled.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (Tests the value of the IgnoreUserKnownHosts[\s]*(<:nocomment:>*) setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (package openssh-server is removed)
        Tests:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1384 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:Tests the value of the IgnoreUserKnownHosts[\s]*(<:nocomment:>*) setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file
        Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
        Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:3065 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*(?i)IgnoreUserKnownHosts(?-i)[\s]+(\w+)[\s]*(?:|(?:#.*))?$'
        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
        State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:8687300 (textfilecontent54_state)
        State Requirements:
        • all subexpression must be equal to 'yes'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1269 (rpminfo_test)
        Result:false
        Title:package openssh-server is removed
        Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2994 (rpminfo_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • name must be equal to 'openssh-server'
        Collected Item Properties:
        • name equals 'openssh-server'
        • arch equals 'x86_64'
        • epoch equals '(none)'

        • version equals '7.4p1'

        The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the SSH daemon is configured to only use Message Authentication Codes (MACs) employing FIPS 140-2 approved cryptographic hash algorithms.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86877r3_rule
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-040400
        Identities:CCE-27455-5
        CCI-001453 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-17 (2); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-17 (2).1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-17 (2))
        Description: DoD information systems are required to use FIPS 140-2 approved cryptographic hash functions. The only SSHv2 hash algorithm meeting this requirement is SHA. false
        Fix Text:Edit the "/etc/ssh/sshd_config" file to uncomment or add the line for the "MACs" keyword and set its value to "hmac-sha2-256" and/or "hmac-sha2-512" (this file may be named differently or be in a different location if using a version of SSH that is provided by a third-party vendor):

        MACs hmac-sha2-256,hmac-sha2-512

        The SSH service must be restarted for changes to take effect.
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat 7
        Identifier:2777
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:168
        Result:false
        Title:Use Only FIPS MACs
        Description:Limit the Message Authentication Codes (MACs) to those which are FIPS-approved.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (tests the value of MACs setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file)
            • false (MACs setting exists in /etc/ssh/sshd_config)
            • false (All child checks must be true.)
              • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
                • false (check for fips=1 in /etc/default/grub via GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX)
                • false (check for fips=1 in /etc/default/grub via GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX_DEFAULT)
              • false (check for fips=1 in grub.cfg)
              • false (check for 1 in /proc/sys/crypto/fips_enabled)
              • true (check for fips=0 in /etc/default/grub)
              • true (All child checks must be true.)
                • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
                  • false (All child checks must be true.)
                    • false (redhat-release-virtualization-host RPM package is installed)
                    • false (RHEVH base RHEL is version 7)
                  • false (redhat-release-client is version 7)
                  • false (redhat-release-workstation is version 7)
                  • true (redhat-release-server is version 7)
                  • false (redhat-release-computenode is version 7)
                • true (installed OS part of unix family)
              • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
                • false (Tests whether prelinking is disabled)
                • true (All child checks must be true.)
                  • true (package prelink is removed)
              • false (All child checks must be true.)
                • false (package dracut-fips is installed)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (package openssh-server is removed)
        Tests:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:170 (variable_test)
        Result:false
        Title:tests the value of MACs setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:At least one collected item must match the given state(s).
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2103 (variable_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • var_ref must be equal to 'oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:var:4174'
        State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:2104 (variable_state)
        State Requirements:
        • for all value, at least one of the following must be true:
          • value must be equal to 'hmac-sha2-512'
          • value must be equal to 'hmac-sha2-256'

        • value equals ''

        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:168 (textfilecontent54_test)

        Title:MACs setting exists in /etc/ssh/sshd_config
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.

        • name must be equal to 'redhat-release-workstation'

        • all version must match the pattern '^7.*$'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

        The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the SSH daemon does not permit Generic Security Service Application Program Interface (GSSAPI) authentication unless needed.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86883r3_rule
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-040430
        Identities:CCI-000318 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-3 e; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-3.1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-3 f)
        CCI-000368 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 c; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 c)
        CCI-001812 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-11 (2))
        CCI-001813 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-5 (1))
        CCI-001814 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-5 (1))
        Description: GSSAPI authentication is used to provide additional authentication mechanisms to applications. Allowing GSSAPI authentication through SSH exposes the system's GSSAPI to remote hosts, increasing the attack surface of the system. GSSAPI authentication must be disabled unless needed. false
        Fix Text:Uncomment the "GSSAPIAuthentication" keyword in "/etc/ssh/sshd_config" (this file may be named differently or be in a different location if using a version of SSH that is provided by a third-party vendor) and set the value to "no":

        GSSAPIAuthentication no

        The SSH service must be restarted for changes to take effect.

        If GSSAPI authentication is required, it must be documented, to include the location of the configuration file, with the ISSO.
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat 7
        Identifier:2777
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:160
        Result:false
        Title:Disable GSSAPI Authentication
        Description:Unless needed, disable the GSSAPI authentication option for the SSH Server.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (tests the value of GSSAPIAuthentication setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (package openssh-server is removed)
        Tests:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:161 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:tests the value of GSSAPIAuthentication setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file
        Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
        Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2099 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*(?i)GSSAPIAuthentication(?-i)[\s]+(\w+)[\s]*(?:|(?:#.*))?$'
        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
        State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:8688300 (textfilecontent54_state)
        State Requirements:
        • all subexpression must be equal to 'no'
        Collected Item Properties:
        • filepath equals '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
        • path equals '/etc/ssh'
        • filename equals 'sshd_config'
        • pattern equals '^[\s]*(?i)GSSAPIAuthentication(?-i)[\s]+(\w+)[\s]*(?:|(?:#.*))?$'
        • instance equals '1'
        • text equals 'GSSAPIAuthentication yes'
        • line equals 'GSSAPIAuthentication yes'
        • subexpression equals 'yes'
        Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1269 (rpminfo_test)
        Result:false
        Title:package openssh-server is removed
        Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2994 (rpminfo_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • name must be equal to 'openssh-server'
        Collected Item Properties:
        • name equals 'openssh-server'
        • arch equals 'x86_64'
        • epoch equals '(none)'
        • release equals '21.el7'
        • version equals '7.4p1'
        • evr equals '0:7.4p1-21.el7'
        • signature_keyid equals '199e2f91fd431d51'
        • extended_name equals 'openssh-server-(none):7.4p1-21.el7.x86_64'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

        The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the SSH daemon does not permit Kerberos authentication unless needed.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86885r3_rule
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-040440
        Identities:CCE-80221-5
        CCI-000318 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-3 e; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-3.1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-3 f)
        CCI-000368 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 c; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 c)
        CCI-001812 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-11 (2))
        CCI-001813 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-5 (1))
        CCI-001814 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-5 (1))
        Description: Kerberos authentication for SSH is often implemented using Generic Security Service Application Program Interface (GSSAPI). If Kerberos is enabled through SSH, the SSH daemon provides a means of access to the system's Kerberos implementation. Vulnerabilities in the system's Kerberos implementation may then be subject to exploitation. To reduce the attack surface of the system, the Kerberos authentication mechanism within SSH must be disabled for systems not using this capability. false
        Fix Text:Uncomment the "KerberosAuthentication" keyword in "/etc/ssh/sshd_config" (this file may be named differently or be in a different location if using a version of SSH that is provided by a third-party vendor) and set the value to "no":

        KerberosAuthentication no

        The SSH service must be restarted for changes to take effect.

        If Kerberos authentication is required, it must be documented, to include the location of the configuration file, with the ISSO.
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat 7
        Identifier:2777
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:162
        Result:false
        Title:Disable Kerberos Authentication
        Description:Unless needed, disable the Kerberos authentication option for the SSH Server.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (tests the value of KerberosAuthentication setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (package openssh-server is removed)
        Tests:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:163 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:tests the value of KerberosAuthentication setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file
        Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
        Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2100 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*(?i)KerberosAuthentication(?-i)[\s]+(\w+)[\s]*(?:|(?:#.*))?$'
        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
        State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:8688500 (textfilecontent54_state)
        State Requirements:
        • all subexpression must be equal to 'no'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1269 (rpminfo_test)
        Result:false
        Title:package openssh-server is removed
        Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2994 (rpminfo_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • name must be equal to 'openssh-server'
        Collected Item Properties:
        • name equals 'openssh-server'
        • arch equals 'x86_64'
        • epoch equals '(none)'
        • release equals '21.el7'
        • version equals '7.4p1'
        • evr equals '0:7.4p1-21.el7'
        • signature_keyid equals '199e2f91fd431d51'
        • extended_name equals 'openssh-server-(none):7.4p1-21.el7.x86_64'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

        The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the SSH daemon performs strict mode checking of home directory configuration files.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86887r3_rule
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-040450
        Identities:CCE-80222-3
        CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
        Description: If other users have access to modify user-specific SSH configuration files, they may be able to log on to the system as another user. false
        Fix Text:Uncomment the "StrictModes" keyword in "/etc/ssh/sshd_config" (this file may be named differently or be in a different location if using a version of SSH that is provided by a third-party vendor) and set the value to "yes":

        StrictModes yes

        The SSH service must be restarted for changes to take effect.
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat 7
        Identifier:2777
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:164
        Result:false
        Title:Enable SSH Server's Strict Mode
        Description:Enable StrictMode to check users home directory permissions and configurations.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (tests the value of StrictModes setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (package openssh-server is removed)
        Tests:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:165 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:tests the value of StrictModes setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file
        Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
        Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2101 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*(?i)StrictModes(?-i)[\s]+(\w+)[\s]*(?:|(?:#.*))?$'
        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
        State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:8688700 (textfilecontent54_state)
        State Requirements:
        • all subexpression must be equal to 'yes'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1269 (rpminfo_test)
        Result:false
        Title:package openssh-server is removed
        Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2994 (rpminfo_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • name must be equal to 'openssh-server'
        Collected Item Properties:
        • name equals 'openssh-server'
        • arch equals 'x86_64'
        • epoch equals '(none)'
        • release equals '21.el7'
        • version equals '7.4p1'
        • evr equals '0:7.4p1-21.el7'
        • signature_keyid equals '199e2f91fd431d51'
        • extended_name equals 'openssh-server-(none):7.4p1-21.el7.x86_64'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

        The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the SSH daemon uses privilege separation.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86889r3_rule
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-040460
        Identities:CCE-80223-1
        CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
        Description: SSH daemon privilege separation causes the SSH process to drop root privileges when not needed, which would decrease the impact of software vulnerabilities in the unprivileged section. false
        Fix Text:Uncomment the "UsePrivilegeSeparation" keyword in "/etc/ssh/sshd_config" (this file may be named differently or be in a different location if using a version of SSH that is provided by a third-party vendor) and set the value to "sandbox" or "yes":

        UsePrivilegeSeparation sandbox

        The SSH service must be restarted for changes to take effect.
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat 7
        Identifier:2777
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:171
        Result:false
        Title:Use Privilege Separation
        Description:Use privilege separation to cause the SSH process to drop root privileges when not needed.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (tests the value of UsePrivilegeSeparation setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (package openssh-server is removed)
        Tests:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:172 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:tests the value of UsePrivilegeSeparation setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file
        Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
        Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
        State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2105 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*(?i)UsePrivilegeSeparation(?-i)[\s]+(\w+)[\s]*(?:|(?:#.*))?$'
        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
        State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:8688900 (textfilecontent54_state)
        State Requirements:
        • all subexpression must be equal to 'sandbox'
        State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:8688901 (textfilecontent54_state)
        State Requirements:
        • all subexpression must be equal to 'yes'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1269 (rpminfo_test)
        Result:false
        Title:package openssh-server is removed
        Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2994 (rpminfo_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • name must be equal to 'openssh-server'
        Collected Item Properties:
        • name equals 'openssh-server'
        • arch equals 'x86_64'
        • epoch equals '(none)'
        • release equals '21.el7'
        • version equals '7.4p1'
        • evr equals '0:7.4p1-21.el7'
        • signature_keyid equals '199e2f91fd431d51'
        • extended_name equals 'openssh-server-(none):7.4p1-21.el7.x86_64'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

        The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the SSH daemon does not allow compression or only allows compression after successful authentication.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86891r3_rule
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-040470
        Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
        Description: If compression is allowed in an SSH connection prior to authentication, vulnerabilities in the compression software could result in compromise of the system from an unauthenticated connection, potentially with root privileges. false
        Fix Text:Uncomment the "Compression" keyword in "/etc/ssh/sshd_config" (this file may be named differently or be in a different location if using a version of SSH that is provided by a third-party vendor) on the system and set the value to "delayed" or "no":

        Compression no

        The SSH service must be restarted for changes to take effect.
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat 7
        Identifier:2777
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:158
        Result:false
        Title:Disable Compression Or Set Compression to delayed
        Description:SSH should either have compression disabled or set to delayed.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (tests the value of Compression setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (package openssh-server is removed)
        Tests:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:159 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:tests the value of Compression setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file
        Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
        Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2098 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*(?i)Compression(?-i)[\s]+(\w+)[\s]*(?:|(?:#.*))?$'
        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
        State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:8689100 (textfilecontent54_state)
        State Requirements:
        • all subexpression must match the pattern '^(no|delayed)$'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1269 (rpminfo_test)
        Result:false
        Title:package openssh-server is removed
        Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2994 (rpminfo_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • name must be equal to 'openssh-server'
        Collected Item Properties:
        • name equals 'openssh-server'
        • arch equals 'x86_64'
        • epoch equals '(none)'
        • release equals '21.el7'
        • version equals '7.4p1'
        • evr equals '0:7.4p1-21.el7'
        • signature_keyid equals '199e2f91fd431d51'
        • extended_name equals 'openssh-server-(none):7.4p1-21.el7.x86_64'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

        The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must display the date and time of the last successful account logon upon logon.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86899r4_rule
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-040530
        Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
        Description: Providing users with feedback on when account accesses last occurred facilitates user recognition and reporting of unauthorized account use. false
        Fix Text:Configure the operating system to provide users with feedback on when account accesses last occurred by setting the required configuration options in "/etc/pam.d/postlogin".

        Add the following line to the top of "/etc/pam.d/postlogin":

        session required pam_lastlog.so showfailed
        Severity:low
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat 7
        Identifier:2777
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:1020
        Result:false
        Title:The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must display the date and time of the last successful account logon upon logon.
        Description:Providing users with feedback on when account accesses last occurred facilitates user recognition and reporting of unauthorized account use.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (Check the pam_lastlog configuration of /etc/pam.d/postlogin for the silent option)
          • false (Check the pam_lastlog configuration of /etc/pam.d/postlogin for the showfailed option)
        Tests:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1021 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:Check the pam_lastlog configuration of /etc/pam.d/postlogin for the silent option
        Check Existence:Zero or more collected items may exist.
        Check:No collected item may match the given state(s).
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2791 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • path must be equal to '/etc/pam.d'
        • filename must be equal to 'postlogin'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*[^\s#]+[ \t]+[\[\]\w=]+[ \t]+pam_lastlog\.so[ \t]+([\S \t]+)\s*$'
        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
        State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:8689900 (textfilecontent54_state)
        State Requirements:
        • all subexpression must match the pattern '^silent[\s]|[\s]silent[\s]|[\s]silent$|^silent$'
        Collected Item Properties:
        • filepath equals '/etc/pam.d/postlogin'
        • path equals '/etc/pam.d'
        • filename equals 'postlogin'
        • pattern equals '^[\s]*[^\s#]+[ \t]+[\[\]\w=]+[ \t]+pam_lastlog\.so[ \t]+([\S \t]+)\s*$'
        • instance equals '1'
        • text equals 'session [default=1] pam_lastlog.so nowtmp showfailed'
        • line equals 'session [default=1] pam_lastlog.so nowtmp showfailed'
        • subexpression equals 'nowtmp showfailed'
        Collected Item Properties:
        • filepath equals '/etc/pam.d/postlogin'
        • path equals '/etc/pam.d'
        • filename equals 'postlogin'
        • pattern equals '^[\s]*[^\s#]+[ \t]+[\[\]\w=]+[ \t]+pam_lastlog\.so[ \t]+([\S \t]+)\s*$'
        • instance equals '2'
        • text equals 'session optional pam_lastlog.so silent noupdate showfailed '
        • line equals 'session optional pam_lastlog.so silent noupdate showfailed '
        • subexpression equals 'silent noupdate showfailed'
        Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8689900 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:Check the pam_lastlog configuration of /etc/pam.d/postlogin for the showfailed option
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:8689900 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • path must be equal to '/etc/pam.d'
        • filename must be equal to 'postlogin'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*session[ \t]+required[ \t]+pam_lastlog\.so[ \t]+([\S \t]+)\s*$'
        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
        State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:8689901 (textfilecontent54_state)
        State Requirements:
        • all subexpression must match the pattern '^showfailed[\s]|[\s]showfailed[\s]|[\s]showfailed$|^showfailed$'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

        For Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating systems using DNS resolution, at least two name servers must be configured.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86905r2_rule
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-040600
        Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
        Description: To provide availability for name resolution services, multiple redundant name servers are mandated. A failure in name resolution could lead to the failure of security functions requiring name resolution, which may include time synchronization, centralized authentication, and remote system logging. false
        Fix Text:Configure the operating system to use two or more name servers for DNS resolution.

        Edit the "/etc/resolv.conf" file to uncomment or add the two or more "nameserver" option lines with the IP address of local authoritative name servers. If local host resolution is being performed, the "/etc/resolv.conf" file must be empty. An empty "/etc/resolv.conf" file can be created as follows:

        # echo -n > /etc/resolv.conf

        And then make the file immutable with the following command:

        # chattr +i /etc/resolv.conf

        If the "/etc/resolv.conf" file must be mutable, the required configuration must be documented with the Information System Security Officer (ISSO) and the file must be verified by the system file integrity tool.
        Severity:low
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat 7
        Identifier:2777
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:86905
        Result:false
        Title:For systems using DNS resolution, at least two name servers must be configured.
        Description:To provide availability for name resolution services, multiple redundant name servers are mandated. A failure in name resolution could lead to the failure of security functions requiring name resolution, which may include time synchronization, centralized authentication, and remote system logging.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (host resolution uses DNS) (negated)
            • false (/etc/resolv.conf is empty or nonexistent)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • true (host resolution uses DNS)
            • false (/etc/resolv.conf has 2 or more nameservers)
        Tests:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8690500 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:true
        Title:host resolution uses DNS
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:8690500 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/etc/nsswitch.conf'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*hosts:\s(.*)$'
        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
        State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:8690500 (textfilecontent54_state)
        State Requirements:
        • all subexpression must match the pattern '(^|\s)dns(\s|$)'
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8690501 (file_test)
        Result:false
        Title:/etc/resolv.conf is empty or nonexistent
        Check Existence:Zero or more collected items may exist.
        Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:8690501 (file_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/etc/resolv.conf'
        State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:8690501 (file_state)
        State Requirements:
        • all size must be equal to '0'
        Collected Item Properties:
        • filepath equals '/etc/resolv.conf'
        • path equals '/etc'
        • filename equals 'resolv.conf'
        • type equals 'regular'
        • group_id equals '0'
        • user_id equals '0'
        • a_time equals '1591036081'
        • c_time equals '1591036081'
        • m_time equals '1591036081'
        • size equals '70'
        • suid equals '0'
        • sgid equals '0'
        • sticky equals '0'
        • uread equals '1'
        • uwrite equals '1'
        • uexec equals '0'
        • gread equals '1'
        • gwrite equals '0'
        • gexec equals '0'
        • oread equals '1'
        • owrite equals '0'
        • oexec equals '0'
        Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8690502 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:/etc/resolv.conf has 2 or more nameservers
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:At least one collected item must match the given state(s).
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:8690502 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/etc/resolv.conf'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*nameserver\s(.*)$'
        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
        State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:8690502 (textfilecontent54_state)
        State Requirements:
        • all instance must be greater than or equal to '2'
        Collected Item Properties:
        • filepath equals '/etc/resolv.conf'
        • path equals '/etc'
        • filename equals 'resolv.conf'
        • pattern equals '^\s*nameserver\s(.*)$'
        • instance equals '1'
        • text equals 'nameserver 10.0.0.2'
        • line equals 'nameserver 10.0.0.2'
        • subexpression equals '10.0.0.2'
        Additional Information:Check requirement not met.

        The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not forward Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) source-routed packets.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86907r2_rule
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-040610
        Identities:CCE-27434-0
        CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
        Description: Source-routed packets allow the source of the packet to suggest that routers forward the packet along a different path than configured on the router, which can be used to bypass network security measures. This requirement applies only to the forwarding of source-routed traffic, such as when IPv4 forwarding is enabled and the system is functioning as a router. false
        Fix Text:Set the system to the required kernel parameter by adding the following line to "/etc/sysctl.conf" or a configuration file in the /etc/sysctl.d/ directory (or modify the line to have the required value):

        net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route = 0

        Issue the following command to make the changes take effect:

        # sysctl -system
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat 7
        Identifier:2777
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:251
        Result:false
        Title:Kernel "net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route" Parameter Configuration and Runtime Check
        Description:The "net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route" kernel parameter should be set to the appropriate value in both system configuration and system runtime.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route static configuration)
            • false (net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
            • false (net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route static configuration in /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf)
            • false (net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route static configuration in /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf)
          • true (All child checks must be true.)
            • true (kernel runtime parameter net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route set to the appropriate value)

        The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not forward Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) source-routed packets by default.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86909r2_rule
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-040620
        Identities:CCE-80162-1
        CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
        Description: Source-routed packets allow the source of the packet to suggest that routers forward the packet along a different path than configured on the router, which can be used to bypass network security measures. This requirement applies only to the forwarding of source-routed traffic, such as when IPv4 forwarding is enabled and the system is functioning as a router. false
        Fix Text:Set the system to the required kernel parameter by adding the following line to "/etc/sysctl.conf" or a configuration file in the /etc/sysctl.d/ directory (or modify the line to have the required value):

        net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_source_route = 0

        Issue the following command to make the changes take effect:

        # sysctl --system
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
