        The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not respond to Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) echoes sent to a broadcast address.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86911r2_rule
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-040630
        Identities:CCE-80165-4
        CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
        Description: Responding to broadcast (ICMP) echoes facilitates network mapping and provides a vector for amplification attacks. false
        Fix Text:Set the system to the required kernel parameter by adding the following line to "/etc/sysctl.conf" or a configuration file in the /etc/sysctl.d/ directory (or modify the line to have the required value):

        net.ipv4.icmp_echo_ignore_broadcasts = 1

        Issue the following command to make the changes take effect:

        # sysctl --system
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat 7
        Identifier:2777
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:284
        Result:false
        Title:Kernel "net.ipv4.icmp_echo_ignore_broadcasts" Parameter Configuration and Runtime Check
        Description:The "net.ipv4.icmp_echo_ignore_broadcasts" kernel parameter should be set to the appropriate value in both system configuration and system runtime.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (net.ipv4.icmp_echo_ignore_broadcasts static configuration)
            • false (net.ipv4.icmp_echo_ignore_broadcasts static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
            • false (net.ipv4.icmp_echo_ignore_broadcasts static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
            • false (net.ipv4.icmp_echo_ignore_broadcasts static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
          • true (All child checks must be true.)
            • true (kernel runtime parameter net.ipv4.icmp_echo_ignore_broadcasts set to the appropriate value)
        Tests:

        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:402 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:net.ipv4.icmp_echo_ignore_broadcasts static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2283 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • path must be equal to '/usr/lib/sysctl.d'
        • filename must match the pattern '^.*\.conf$'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*net\.ipv4\.icmp_echo_ignore_broadcasts[\s]*=[\s]*(\d+)\s*$'
        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
        State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:2280 (textfilecontent54_state)
        State Requirements:
        • for all subexpression, the following must be true:
          • subexpression must be equal to '1'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:332 (sysctl_test)

        Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
        Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).

        State Requirements:
        • for all value, the following must be true:
          • value must be equal to '1'

        The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must prevent Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) redirect messages from being accepted.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86913r3_rule
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-040640
        Identities:CCE-80163-9
        CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
        Description: ICMP redirect messages are used by routers to inform hosts that a more direct route exists for a particular destination. These messages modify the host's route table and are unauthenticated. An illicit ICMP redirect message could result in a man-in-the-middle attack. false
        Fix Text:Set the system to not accept IPv4 ICMP redirect messages by adding the following line to "/etc/sysctl.conf" or a configuration file in the /etc/sysctl.d/ directory (or modify the line to have the required value):

        net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_redirects = 0

        Issue the following command to make the changes take effect:

        # sysctl --system
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat 7
        Identifier:2777
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:266
        Result:false
        Title:Kernel "net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_redirects" Parameter Configuration and Runtime Check
        Description:The "net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_redirects" kernel parameter should be set to the appropriate value in both system configuration and system runtime.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_redirects static configuration)
            • false (net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_redirects static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
            • false (net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_redirects static configuration in /run/sysctl.d/*.conf)
            • false (net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_redirects static configuration in /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (kernel runtime parameter net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_redirects set to the appropriate value)
        Tests:

        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
        State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:2251 (textfilecontent54_state)

        • for all subexpression, the following must be true:
          • subexpression must be equal to '0'

        • value equals '1'
        Additional Information:Check requirement not met.

        The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not allow interfaces to perform Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) redirects by default.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86915r4_rule
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-040650
        Identities:CCE-80156-3
        CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
        Description: ICMP redirect messages are used by routers to inform hosts that a more direct route exists for a particular destination. These messages contain information from the system's route table, possibly revealing portions of the network topology. false
        Fix Text:Configure the system to not allow interfaces to perform IPv4 ICMP redirects by default.

        Set the system to the required kernel parameter by adding the following line to "/etc/sysctl.conf" or a configuration file in the /etc/sysctl.d/ directory (or modify the line to have the required value):

        net.ipv4.conf.default.send_redirects = 0

        Issue the following command to make the changes take effect:

        # sysctl --system
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat 7
        Identifier:2777
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:281
        Result:false
        Title:Kernel "net.ipv4.conf.default.send_redirects" Parameter Configuration and Runtime Check
        Description:The "net.ipv4.conf.default.send_redirects" kernel parameter should be set to the appropriate value in both system configuration and system runtime.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (net.ipv4.conf.default.send_redirects static configuration)
            • false (net.ipv4.conf.default.send_redirects static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
            • false (net.ipv4.conf.default.send_redirects static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
            • false (net.ipv4.conf.default.send_redirects static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (kernel runtime parameter net.ipv4.conf.default.send_redirects set to 0)
        Tests:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:395 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:net.ipv4.conf.default.send_redirects static configuration
        Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2275 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/etc/sysctl.conf'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*net\.ipv4\.conf\.default\.send_redirects[\s]*=[\s]*0[\s]*$'
        • instance must be equal to '1'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:396 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:net.ipv4.conf.default.send_redirects static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2276 (textfilecontent54_object)

        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

        Result:false
        Title:net.ipv4.conf.default.send_redirects static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.

        • filename must match the pattern '^.*\.conf$'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*net\.ipv4\.conf\.default\.send_redirects[\s]*=[\s]*0[\s]*$'

        The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not send Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) redirects.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86917r3_rule
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-040660
        Identities:CCE-80156-3
        CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
        Description: ICMP redirect messages are used by routers to inform hosts that a more direct route exists for a particular destination. These messages contain information from the system's route table, possibly revealing portions of the network topology. false
        Fix Text:Configure the system to not allow interfaces to perform IPv4 ICMP redirects.

        Set the system to the required kernel parameter by adding the following line to "/etc/sysctl.conf" or a configuration file in the /etc/sysctl.d/ directory (or modify the line to have the required value):

        net.ipv4.conf.all.send_redirects = 0

        Issue the following command to make the changes take effect:

        # sysctl --system
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:

        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat 7

        The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not have an X Windows display manager installed unless approved.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86931r4_rule
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-040730
        Identities:CCE-27218-7
        CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
        Description: Internet services that are not required for system or application processes must not be active to decrease the attack surface of the system. X Windows has a long history of security vulnerabilities and will not be used unless approved and documented. false
        Fix Text:Document the requirement for an X Windows server with the ISSO or remove the related packages with the following commands:

        # rpm -e xorg-x11-server-common
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat 7
        Identifier:2777
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:1305
        Result:false
        Title:Package xorg-x11-server-common Removed
        Description:The RPM package xorg-x11-server-common should be removed.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (package xorg-x11-server-common is removed)
        Tests:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1306 (rpminfo_test)
        Result:false
        Title:package xorg-x11-server-common is removed
        Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:3014 (rpminfo_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • name must be equal to 'xorg-x11-server-common'
        Collected Item Properties:
        • name equals 'xorg-x11-server-common'
        • arch equals 'x86_64'
        • epoch equals '(none)'
        • release equals '10.el7'
        • version equals '1.20.4'
        • evr equals '0:1.20.4-10.el7'
        • signature_keyid equals '199e2f91fd431d51'
        • extended_name equals 'xorg-x11-server-common-(none):1.20.4-10.el7.x86_64'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

        The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not be performing packet forwarding unless the system is a router.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86933r2_rule
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-040740
        Identities:CCE-80157-1
        CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
        Description: Routing protocol daemons are typically used on routers to exchange network topology information with other routers. If this software is used when not required, system network information may be unnecessarily transmitted across the network. false
        Fix Text:Set the system to the required kernel parameter by adding the following line to "/etc/sysctl.conf" or a configuration file in the /etc/sysctl.d/ directory (or modify the line to have the required value):

        net.ipv4.ip_forward = 0

        Issue the following command to make the changes take effect:

        # sysctl --system
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat 7
        Identifier:2777
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:290
        Result:false
        Title:Kernel "net.ipv4.ip_forward" Parameter Configuration and Runtime Check
        Description:The "net.ipv4.ip_forward" kernel parameter should be set to the appropriate value in both system configuration and system runtime.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (net.ipv4.ip_forward static configuration)
            • false (net.ipv4.ip_forward static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
            • false (net.ipv4.ip_forward static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
            • false (net.ipv4.ip_forward static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (kernel runtime parameter net.ipv4.ip_forward set to 0)
        Tests:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:407 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:net.ipv4.ip_forward static configuration
        Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2289 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/etc/sysctl.conf'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*net\.ipv4\.ip_forward[\s]*=[\s]*0[\s]*$'
        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:408 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:net.ipv4.ip_forward static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2290 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • path must be equal to '/etc/sysctl.d'
        • filename must match the pattern '^.*\.conf$'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*net\.ipv4\.ip_forward[\s]*=[\s]*0[\s]*$'
        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:409 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false

        Additional Information:Check requirement not met.

        The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not forward IPv6 source-routed packets.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-86943r2_rule
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-040830
        Identities:CCE-80179-5
        CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
        Description: Source-routed packets allow the source of the packet to suggest that routers forward the packet along a different path than configured on the router, which can be used to bypass network security measures. This requirement applies only to the forwarding of source-routed traffic, such as when IPv6 forwarding is enabled and the system is functioning as a router. false
        Fix Text:Set the system to the required kernel parameter, if IPv6 is enabled, by adding the following line to "/etc/sysctl.conf" or a configuration file in the /etc/sysctl.d/ directory (or modify the line to have the required value):

        net.ipv6.conf.all.accept_source_route = 0

        Issue the following command to make the changes take effect:

        # sysctl --system
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat 7
        Identifier:2777
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:303
        Result:false
        Title:Kernel "net.ipv6.conf.all.accept_source_route" Parameter Configuration and Runtime Check
        Description:The "net.ipv6.conf.all.accept_source_route" kernel parameter should be set to the appropriate value in both system configuration and system runtime.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (One or more child checks must be true.)

              • false (net.ipv6.conf.all.accept_source_route static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
              • false (net.ipv6.conf.all.accept_source_route static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
              • false (net.ipv6.conf.all.accept_source_route static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
            • true (All child checks must be true.)
              • true (kernel runtime parameter net.ipv6.conf.all.accept_source_route set to the appropriate value)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (All child checks must be true.)
              • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
                • false (net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6 static configuration)
                • false (net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6 static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
                • false (net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6 static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)

              • false (All child checks must be true.)
                • false (kernel runtime parameter net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6 set to 1)
            • false (All child checks must be true.)
              • false (ipv6.disable=1 in /proc/cmdline)
              • false (ipv6.disable=1 in grub.cfg)

        The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must have the required packages for multifactor authentication installed.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-87041r4_rule
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-041001
        Identities:CCI-001948 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-2 (11))
        CCI-001953 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-2 (12))
        CCI-001954 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-2 (12))
        Description: Using an authentication device, such as a CAC or token that is separate from the information system, ensures that even if the information system is compromised, that compromise will not affect credentials stored on the authentication device.

        Multifactor solutions that require devices separate from information systems gaining access include, for example, hardware tokens providing time-based or challenge-response authenticators and smart cards such as the U.S. Government Personal Identity Verification card and the DoD Common Access Card.

        A privileged account is defined as an information system account with authorizations of a privileged user.

        Remote access is access to DoD nonpublic information systems by an authorized user (or an information system) communicating through an external, non-organization-controlled network. Remote access methods include, for example, dial-up, broadband, and wireless.

        This requirement only applies to components where this is specific to the function of the device or has the concept of an organizational user (e.g., VPN, proxy capability). This does not apply to authentication for the purpose of configuring the device itself (management).

        Satisfies: SRG-OS-000375-GPOS-00160, SRG-OS-000375-GPOS-00161, SRG-OS-000375-GPOS-00162 false
        Fix Text:Configure the operating system to implement multifactor authentication by installing the required packages.

        Install the "esc" and "pam_pkcs11" packages on the system with the following command:

        # yum install esc pam_pkcs11
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat 7
        Identifier:2777
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:87041
        Result:false
        Title:The operating system must have the required packages for multifactor authentication installed.
        Description:The operating system must have the required packages for multifactor authentication installed.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (package 'esc' is installed)
          • false (package 'pam_pkcs11' is installed)
        Tests:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8704100 (rpminfo_test)
        Result:false
        Title:package 'esc' is installed
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:8704100 (rpminfo_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • name must be equal to 'esc'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8704101 (rpminfo_test)
        Result:false
        Title:package 'pam_pkcs11' is installed
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:8704101 (rpminfo_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • name must be equal to 'pam_pkcs11'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

        The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must implement multifactor authentication for access to privileged accounts via pluggable authentication modules (PAM).

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-87051r4_rule
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-041002
        Identities:CCE-80437-7
        CCI-001948 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-2 (11))
        CCI-001953 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-2 (12))
        CCI-001954 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-2 (12))
        Description: Using an authentication device, such as a CAC or token that is separate from the information system, ensures that even if the information system is compromised, that compromise will not affect credentials stored on the authentication device.

        Multifactor solutions that require devices separate from information systems gaining access include, for example, hardware tokens providing time-based or challenge-response authenticators and smart cards such as the U.S. Government Personal Identity Verification card and the DoD Common Access Card.

        A privileged account is defined as an information system account with authorizations of a privileged user.

        Remote access is access to DoD nonpublic information systems by an authorized user (or an information system) communicating through an external, non-organization-controlled network. Remote access methods include, for example, dial-up, broadband, and wireless.

        This requirement only applies to components where this is specific to the function of the device or has the concept of an organizational user (e.g., VPN, proxy capability). This does not apply to authentication for the purpose of configuring the device itself (management).

        Satisfies: SRG-OS-000375-GPOS-00160, SRG-OS-000375-GPOS-00161, SRG-OS-000375-GPOS-00162 false
        Fix Text:Configure the operating system to implement multifactor authentication for remote access to privileged accounts via pluggable authentication modules (PAM).

        Modify all of the services lines in "/etc/sssd/sssd.conf" or in configuration files found under "/etc/sssd/conf.d" to include pam.
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat 7
        Identifier:2777
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:1405
        Result:false
        Title:Configure PAM in SSSD Services
        Description:SSSD should be configured to run SSSD PAM services.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (check if pam is configured in the services setting of the sssd section)
          • false (check if pam is configured in the services setting of a conf file in the sssd conf.d directory)
        Tests:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1406 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:check if pam is configured in the services setting of the sssd section
        Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:3081 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/etc/sssd/sssd.conf'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*\[sssd\]([^\n]*\n+)+?[\s]*services.*pam.*$'
        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:140601 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:check if pam is configured in the services setting of a conf file in the sssd conf.d directory
        Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:140601 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • path must be equal to '/etc/sssd/conf.d'
        • filename must match the pattern '^.*\.conf$'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*\[sssd\]([^\n]*\n+)+?[\s]*services.*pam.*$'
        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

        The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must implement certificate status checking for PKI authentication.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-87057r5_rule
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-041003
        Identities:CCI-001948 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-2 (11))
        CCI-001953 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-2 (12))
        CCI-001954 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-2 (12))
        Description: Using an authentication device, such as a CAC or token that is separate from the information system, ensures that even if the information system is compromised, that compromise will not affect credentials stored on the authentication device.

        Multifactor solutions that require devices separate from information systems gaining access include, for example, hardware tokens providing time-based or challenge-response authenticators and smart cards such as the U.S. Government Personal Identity Verification card and the DoD Common Access Card.

        A privileged account is defined as an information system account with authorizations of a privileged user.

        Remote access is access to DoD nonpublic information systems by an authorized user (or an information system) communicating through an external, non-organization-controlled network. Remote access methods include, for example, dial-up, broadband, and wireless.

        This requirement only applies to components where this is specific to the function of the device or has the concept of an organizational user (e.g., VPN, proxy capability). This does not apply to authentication for the purpose of configuring the device itself (management).

        Satisfies: SRG-OS-000375-GPOS-00160, SRG-OS-000375-GPOS-00161, SRG-OS-000375-GPOS-00162 false
        Fix Text:Configure the operating system to do certificate status checking for PKI authentication.

        Modify all of the "cert_policy" lines in "/etc/pam_pkcs11/pam_pkcs11.conf" to include "ocsp_on".
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat 7
        Identifier:2777
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:87057
        Result:false
        Title:The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must implement certificate status checking for PKI authentication.
        Description:Using an authentication device, such as a CAC or token that is separate from the information system, ensures that even if the information system is compromised, that compromise will not affect credentials stored on the authentication device. Multifactor solutions that require devices separate from information systems gaining access include, for example, hardware tokens providing time-based or challenge-response authenticators and smart cards such as the U.S. Government Personal Identity Verification card and the DoD Common Access Card. A privileged account is defined as an information system account with authorizations of a privileged user. Remote access is access to DoD nonpublic information systems by an authorized user (or an information system) communicating through an external, non-organization-controlled network. Remote access methods include, for example, dial-up, broadband, and wireless. This requirement only applies to components where this is specific to the function of the device or has the concept of an organizational user (e.g., VPN, proxy capability). This does not apply to authentication for the purpose of configuring the device itself (management).
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (Check all cert_policy entries are set with the ocsp_on option in /etc/pam_pkcs11/pam_pkcs11.conf)
          • false (Check cert_policy is set with the ocsp_on option 3 or more times in /etc/pam_pkcs11/pam_pkcs11.conf)
        Tests:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8705700 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:Check all cert_policy entries are set with the ocsp_on option in /etc/pam_pkcs11/pam_pkcs11.conf
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:8705700 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/etc/pam_pkcs11/pam_pkcs11.conf'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*cert_policy[ \t]+=[ \t]+([\w\,"' ]+);\s*$'
        • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
        State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:8705700 (textfilecontent54_state)
        State Requirements:
        • all subexpression must match the pattern '^["']*ocsp_on["']*$|^["']*ocsp_on["',\s]|["',\s]ocsp_on["',\s]|["',\s]ocsp_on["']*$'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8705701 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:Check cert_policy is set with the ocsp_on option 3 or more times in /etc/pam_pkcs11/pam_pkcs11.conf
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:8705701 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • filepath must be equal to '/etc/pam_pkcs11/pam_pkcs11.conf'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*cert_policy[ \t]+=[ \t]+([\w\,"' ]*ocsp_on[\w\,"' ]*);\s*$'
        • instance must be greater than or equal to '3'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

        The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must prevent a user from overriding the screensaver lock-delay setting for the graphical user interface.

        Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-87807r4_rule
        Result:Fail
        Version:RHEL-07-010081
        Identities:CCE-80371-8
        CCI-000057 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-11 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-11.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-11 a)
        Description: A session time-out lock is a temporary action taken when a user stops work and moves away from the immediate physical vicinity of the information system but does not log out because of the temporary nature of the absence. Rather than relying on the user to manually lock their operating system session prior to vacating the vicinity, operating systems need to be able to identify when a user's session has idled and take action to initiate the session lock.

        The session lock is implemented at the point where session activity can be determined and/or controlled. false
        Fix Text:Configure the operating system to prevent a user from overriding a screensaver lock after a 15-minute period of inactivity for graphical user interfaces.

        Create a database to contain the system-wide screensaver settings (if it does not already exist) with the following command:

        Note: The example below is using the database "local" for the system, so if the system is using another database in "/etc/dconf/profile/user", the file should be created under the appropriate subdirectory.

        # touch /etc/dconf/db/local.d/locks/session

        Add the setting to lock the screensaver lock delay:

        /org/gnome/desktop/screensaver/lock-delay
        Severity:medium
        Weight:10.0
        Reference:
        Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
        Publisher:DISA
        Type:DPMS Target
        Subject:Red Hat 7
        Identifier:2777
        Definitions:
        Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:999
        Result:false
        Title:Gnome lock-delay setting lock
        Description:Determines if the databases containing the lock-delay setting also have the setting locked.
        Class:compliance
        Tests:
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (lock-delay configuration is present)
            • false (lock-delay lock exists)
            • true (all lock-delay entries are locked)
          • false (All child checks must be true.) (negated)
            • true (package dconf is installed)
        Tests:
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8780700 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:lock-delay configuration is present
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2765 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • behavior requirements:
          • max_depth = 1
          • recurse_direction = down
        • path must be equal to '/etc/dconf/db/'
        • filename must match the pattern '^[0-9].*$'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^\[org/gnome/desktop/screensaver\]([^\n]*\n+)+?lock-delay\s*=\s*uint32\s+[0-5]\s*$'
        • instance must be equal to '1'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8780702 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:false
        Title:lock-delay lock exists
        Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:8780700 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • behavior requirements:
          • max_depth = 1
          • recurse_direction = down
        • for path, at least one of the following must be true:
          • path must be equal to '/locks'
        • filename must match the pattern '^.*$'
        • pattern must match the pattern '^/org/gnome/desktop/screensaver/lock-delay$'
        • instance must be equal to '1'
        Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
        Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8780701 (textfilecontent54_test)
        Result:true
        Title:all lock-delay entries are locked
        Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
        Check:Result is based on check existence only.
        Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:8780701 (textfilecontent54_object)
        Object Requirements:
        • Collect any available items.
        Exclude Items If:
        • for all path, at least one of the following must be true:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1252 (rpminfo_test)
          Result:true
          Title:package dconf is installed
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2983 (rpminfo_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • name must be equal to 'dconf'
          Collected Item Properties:
          • name equals 'dconf'
          • arch equals 'x86_64'
          • epoch equals '(none)'
          • release equals '4.el7'
          • version equals '0.28.0'
          • evr equals '0:0.28.0-4.el7'
          • signature_keyid equals '199e2f91fd431d51'
          • extended_name equals 'dconf-(none):0.28.0-4.el7.x86_64'

          The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the audit system takes appropriate action when there is an error sending audit records to a remote system.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-87815r3_rule
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-07-030321
          Identities:CCI-001851 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-4 (1))
          Description: Taking appropriate action when there is an error sending audit records to a remote system will minimize the possibility of losing audit records. false
          Fix Text:Configure the action the operating system takes if there is an error sending audit records to a remote system.

          Uncomment the "network_failure_action" option in "/etc/audisp/audisp-remote.conf" and set it to "syslog", "single", or "halt".

          network_failure_action = syslog
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat 7
          Identifier:2777
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:87815
          Result:false
          Title:The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the audit system takes appropriate action when there is an error sending audit records to a remote system.
          Description:The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the audit system takes appropriate action when there is an error sending audit records to a remote system.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (Check the value assigned to network_failure_action in /etc/audisp/audisp-remote.conf)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8781500 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:Check the value assigned to network_failure_action in /etc/audisp/audisp-remote.conf
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:8781500 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audisp/audisp-remote.conf'
          • pattern must match the pattern '(?i)^\s*network_failure_action[ ]*=[ ]*([\w]+)\s*'
          • instance must be equal to '1'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:8781500 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • all subexpression must match the pattern '(?i)^syslog|single|halt$'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

          The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect /etc/group.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-87817r3_rule
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-07-030871
          Identities:CCE-80433-6
          CCI-000018 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4))
          CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
          CCI-001403 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4))
          CCI-002130 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4))
          Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

          Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter). false
          Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect "/etc/group".

          Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

          -w /etc/group -p wa -k identity

          The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat 7
          Identifier:2777
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:866
          Result:false
          Title:Audit User/Group Modification (/etc/group)
          Description:Audit user/group modification.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (All child checks must be true.)
              • false (audit augenrules /etc/group)
              • true (All child checks must be true.)
                • true (audit augenrules)
            • false (All child checks must be true.)
              • false (audit /etc/group)
              • false (All child checks must be true.)
                • false (audit auditctl)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:867 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:audit augenrules /etc/group
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2676 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
          • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\-w[\s]+/etc/group[\s]+\-p[\s]+\b([rx]*w[rx]*a[rx]*|[rx]*a[rx]*w[rx]*)\b[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)\w+[\s]*$'
          • instance must be equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:545 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:true
          Title:audit augenrules
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2427 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Collected Item Properties:
          • filepath equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
          • path equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system'
          • filename equals 'auditd.service'
          • pattern equals '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
          • instance equals '1'
          • text equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
          • line equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
          • subexpression does not exist
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:868 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:audit /etc/group
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2677 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\-w[\s]+/etc/group[\s]+\-p[\s]+\b([rx]*w[rx]*a[rx]*|[rx]*a[rx]*w[rx]*)\b[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)\w+[\s]*$'
          • instance must be equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:543 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:audit auditctl
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2426 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/auditctl.*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

          The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect /etc/gshadow.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-87819r4_rule
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-07-030872
          Identities:CCE-80432-8
          CCI-000018 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4))
          CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
          CCI-001403 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4))
          CCI-002130 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4))
          Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

          Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter). false
          Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect "/etc/gshadow".

          Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

          -w /etc/gshadow -p wa -k identity

          The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat 7

          The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect /etc/shadow.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-87823r4_rule
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-07-030873
          Identities:CCE-80431-0
          CCI-000018 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4))
          CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
          CCI-001403 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4))
          CCI-002130 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4))
          Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

          Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter). false
          Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect /etc/shadow.

          Add or update the following file system rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

          -w /etc/shadow -p wa -k identity

          The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0

          The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect /etc/opasswd.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-87825r5_rule
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-07-030874
          Identities:CCE-80430-2
          CCI-000018 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4))

          The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must ignore Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) redirect messages.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-87827r4_rule
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-07-040641
          Identities:CCE-80158-9
          CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
          Description: ICMP redirect messages are used by routers to inform hosts that a more direct route exists for a particular destination. These messages modify the host's route table and are unauthenticated. An illicit ICMP redirect message could result in a man-in-the-middle attack. false
          Fix Text:Set the system to ignore IPv4 ICMP redirect messages by adding the following line to "/etc/sysctl.conf" or a configuration file in the /etc/sysctl.d/ directory (or modify the line to have the required value):

          net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_redirects = 0

          Issue the following command to make the changes take effect:

          # sysctl --system
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat 7
          Identifier:2777
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:248
          Result:false
          Title:Kernel "net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_redirects" Parameter Configuration and Runtime Check
          Description:The "net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_redirects" kernel parameter should be set to the appropriate value in both system configuration and system runtime.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
              • false (net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_redirects static configuration)
              • false (net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_redirects static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
              • false (net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_redirects static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
              • false (net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_redirects static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
            • true (All child checks must be true.)
              • true (kernel runtime parameter net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_redirects set to the appropriate value)

            • subexpression must be equal to '0'

          The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must uniquely identify and must authenticate users using multifactor authentication via a graphical user logon.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-92515r2_rule
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-07-010061
          Identities:CCI-001948 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-2 (11))
          CCI-001953 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-2 (12))
          CCI-001954 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-2 (12))
          Description: To assure accountability and prevent unauthenticated access, users must be identified and authenticated to prevent potential misuse and compromise of the system.

          Multifactor solutions that require devices separate from information systems gaining access include, for example, hardware tokens providing time-based or challenge-response authenticators and smart cards such as the U.S. Government Personal Identity Verification card and the DoD Common Access Card.

          Satisfies: SRG-OS-000375-GPOS-00161,SRG-OS-000375-GPOS-00162 false
          Fix Text:Configure the operating system to uniquely identify and authenticate users using multifactor authentication via a graphical user logon.

          Note: If the system does not have GNOME installed, this requirement is Not Applicable.

          Create a database to contain the system-wide screensaver settings (if it does not already exist) with the following command:

          Note: The example is using the database local for the system, so if the system is using another database in "/etc/dconf/profile/user", the file should be created under the appropriate subdirectory.

          # touch /etc/dconf/db/local.d/00-defaults

          Edit "[org/gnome/login-screen]" and add or update the following line:
          enable-smartcard-authentication=true

          Update the system databases:
          # dconf update
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat 7
          Identifier:2777
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:92515
          Result:false
          Title:Smartcard authentication enabled for graphical user logon.
          Description:The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must uniquely identify and must authenticate users using multifactor authentication via a graphical user logon.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (All child checks must be true.)
              • false (check for enable-smartcard-authentication set to true)
              • true (check for enable-smartcard-authentication set to false) (negated)
              • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
                • true (dconf user profile exists)
                • false (All child checks must be true.) (negated)
                  • true (package dconf is installed)
            • false (All child checks must be true.) (negated)
              • true (package dconf is installed)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:9251500 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:check for enable-smartcard-authentication set to true
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:9251500 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • behavior requirements:
            • recurse_direction = down
          • path must be equal to '/etc/dconf/db/'
          • filename must match the pattern '^[0-9].*$'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*\[org/gnome/login-screen\](?:[^\n]*\n+)+?enable-smartcard-authentication\s*=\s*(\w+)\s*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:9251500 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • all subexpression must match the pattern '^true$'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:9251501 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:check for enable-smartcard-authentication set to false
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:9251500 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • behavior requirements:
            • recurse_direction = down
          • path must be equal to '/etc/dconf/db/'
          • filename must match the pattern '^[0-9].*$'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*\[org/gnome/login-screen\](?:[^\n]*\n+)+?enable-smartcard-authentication\s*=\s*(\w+)\s*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:9251501 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • all subexpression must match the pattern '^false$'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1022 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:true
          Title:dconf user profile exists
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2792 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:

          • pattern must match the pattern '^user-db:user\nsystem-db:local$'
          • instance must be equal to '1'

          • filepath equals '/etc/dconf/profile/user'
          • path equals '/etc/dconf/profile'
          • filename equals 'user'
          • pattern equals '^user-db:user\nsystem-db:local$'
          • instance equals '1'
          • text equals 'user-db:user system-db:local'
          • line equals 'user-db:user system-db:local'

          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1252 (rpminfo_test)

          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2983 (rpminfo_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • name must be equal to 'dconf'
          Collected Item Properties:
          • name equals 'dconf'
          • arch equals 'x86_64'
          • epoch equals '(none)'
          • release equals '4.el7'
          • version equals '0.28.0'
          • evr equals '0:0.28.0-4.el7'
          • signature_keyid equals '199e2f91fd431d51'
          • extended_name equals 'dconf-(none):0.28.0-4.el7.x86_64'

          The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the Datagram Congestion Control Protocol (DCCP) kernel module is disabled unless required.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-92517r3_rule
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-07-020101
          Identities:CCI-001958 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-3)
          Description: Disabling DCCP protects the system against exploitation of any flaws in the protocol implementation. false
          Fix Text:Configure the operating system to disable the ability to use the DCCP kernel module.

          Create a file under "/etc/modprobe.d" with the following command:

          # touch /etc/modprobe.d/dccp.conf

          Add the following line to the created file:

          install dccp /bin/true

          Ensure that the DCCP module is blacklisted:

          # vi /etc/modprobe.d/blacklist.conf

          Add or update the line:

          blacklist dccp
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat 7
          Identifier:2777
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:92517
          Result:false
          Title:Disable dccp Kernel Module
          Description:The kernel module dccp should be disabled.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (kernel module dccp disabled)
            • true (kernel module dccp blacklisted in /etc/modprobe.d)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:9251700 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:kernel module dccp disabled
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:9251700 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • path must be equal to '/etc/modprobe.d'
          • filename must match the pattern '^.*\.conf$'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*install\s+dccp\s+(\S+)\s*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:9251700 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • all subexpression must be equal to '/bin/true'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:9251701 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:true
          Title:kernel module dccp blacklisted in /etc/modprobe.d
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:9251701 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • path must be equal to '/etc/modprobe.d'
          • filename must match the pattern '^.*\.conf$'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*blacklist\s+dccp\s*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Collected Item Properties:
          • filepath equals '/etc/modprobe.d/dccp-blacklist.conf'
          • path equals '/etc/modprobe.d'
          • filename equals 'dccp-blacklist.conf'
          • pattern equals '^\s*blacklist\s+dccp\s*$'
          • instance equals '1'
          • text equals ' blacklist dccp'
          • line equals ' blacklist dccp'
          • subexpression does not exist

          The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must implement virtual address space randomization.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-92521r2_rule
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-07-040201
          Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
          Description: Address space layout randomization (ASLR) makes it more difficult for an attacker to predict the location of attack code he or she has introduced into a process's address space during an attempt at exploitation. Additionally, ASLR also makes it more difficult for an attacker to know the location of existing code in order to repurpose it using return-oriented programming (ROP) techniques. false
          Fix Text:Configure the operating system implement virtual address space randomization.

          Set the system to the required kernel parameter by adding the following line to "/etc/sysctl.conf" or a config file in the /etc/sysctl.d/ directory (or modify the line to have the required value):

          kernel.randomize_va_space = 2

          Issue the following command to make the changes take effect:

          # sysctl --system
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat 7
          Identifier:2777
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:92521
          Result:false
          Title:The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must implement vitrual address space randomization.
          Description:Address space layout randomization (ASLR) makes it more difficult for an attacker to predict the location of attack code he or she has introduced into a proccess's address space during an attampt at exploitation. Additionally, ASLR also makes it more difficult for an attacker to know the location of existing code in order to repurpose it using return-oriented programming (ROP) techniques.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
              • false (Check /etc/sysctl.conf has kernel.randomize_va_space set to 2)
              • false (Check if any .conf file in /etc/sysctl.d has kernel.randomize_va_space set to 2)
            • true (Check /etc/sysctl.conf has kernel.randomize_va_space set to a value other than 2)
            • true (Check if any .conf file in /etc/sysctl.d has kernel.randomize_va_space set to a value other than 2)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:9252100 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:Check /etc/sysctl.conf has kernel.randomize_va_space set to 2
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:9252100 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/sysctl.conf'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*kernel\.randomize_va_space\s*=\s*(\d+)\s*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:9252100 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • all subexpression must be equal to '2'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:9252101 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:Check if any .conf file in /etc/sysctl.d has kernel.randomize_va_space set to 2
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:9252101 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • behavior requirements:
            • recurse_direction = down
          • path must be equal to '/etc/sysctl.d'
          • filename must match the pattern '^.+\.conf$'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*kernel\.randomize_va_space\s*=\s*(\d+)\s*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:9252100 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • all subexpression must be equal to '2'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:9252102 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:true
          Title:Check /etc/sysctl.conf has kernel.randomize_va_space set to a value other than 2
          Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:9252102 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • Collect any available items.
          Exclude Items If:
          • all subexpression equals '2'
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:9252103 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:true
          Title:Check if any .conf file in /etc/sysctl.d has kernel.randomize_va_space set to a value other than 2
          Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:9252103 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • Collect any available items.
          Exclude Items If:
          • all subexpression equals '2'

          The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must prevent a user from overriding the screensaver idle-activation-enabled setting for the graphical user interface.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-93703r2_rule
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-07-010101
          Identities:CCI-000057 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-11 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-11.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-11 a)
          Description: A session lock is a temporary action taken when a user stops work and moves away from the immediate physical vicinity of the information system but does not want to log out because of the temporary nature of the absence.

          The session lock is implemented at the point where session activity can be determined.

          The ability to enable/disable a session lock is given to the user by default. Disabling the user's ability to disengage the graphical user interface session lock provides the assurance that all sessions will lock after the specified period of time. false
          Fix Text:Configure the operating system to prevent a user from overriding a screensaver lock after a 15-minute period of inactivity for graphical user interfaces.

          Create a database to contain the system-wide screensaver settings (if it does not already exist) with the following command:

          Note: The example below is using the database "local" for the system, so if the system is using another database in "/etc/dconf/profile/user", the file should be created under the appropriate subdirectory.

          # touch /etc/dconf/db/local.d/locks/session

          Add the setting to lock the screensaver idle-activation-enabled setting:

          /org/gnome/desktop/screensaver/idle-activation-enabled
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat 7
          Identifier:2777
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:93703
          Result:false
          Title:The operating system must prevent a user from overriding the screensaver idle-activation-enabled setting for the graphical user interface.
          Description:A session lock is a temporary action taken when a user stops work and moves away from the immediate physical vicinity of the information system but does not want to log out because of the temporary nature of the absence. The session lock is implemented at the point where session activity can be determined. The ability to enable/disable a session lock is given to the user by default. Disabling the user's ability to disengage the graphical user interface session lock provides the assurance that all sessions will lock after the specified period of time.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (All child checks must be true.)
              • false (idle-activation-enabled configuration is present)
              • false (idle-activation-enabled lock exists)
              • true (all idle-activation-enabled entries are locked)
            • false (All child checks must be true.) (negated)
              • true (package dconf is installed)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:9370300 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:idle-activation-enabled configuration is present
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:9370300 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • behavior requirements:
            • max_depth = 1
            • recurse_direction = down
          • path must be equal to '/etc/dconf/db/'
          • filename must match the pattern '^[0-9].*$'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\[org/gnome/desktop/screensaver\]([^\n]*\n+)+?idle-activation-enabled\s*=\s*(?:true|false)\s*$'
          • instance must be equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:9370302 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:idle-activation-enabled lock exists
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:9370302 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • behavior requirements:
            • max_depth = 1
            • recurse_direction = down
          • for path, at least one of the following must be true:
            • path must be equal to '/locks'
          • filename must match the pattern '^.*$'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^/org/gnome/desktop/screensaver/idle-activation-enabled\s*$'
          • instance must be equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:9370301 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:true
          Title:all idle-activation-enabled entries are locked
          Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:9370301 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • Collect any available items.
          Exclude Items If:
          • for all path, at least one of the following must be true:
            Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1252 (rpminfo_test)
            Result:true
            Title:package dconf is installed
            Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
            Check:Result is based on check existence only.
            Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2983 (rpminfo_object)
            Object Requirements:
            • name must be equal to 'dconf'
            Collected Item Properties:
            • name equals 'dconf'
            • arch equals 'x86_64'
            • epoch equals '(none)'
            • release equals '4.el7'
            • version equals '0.28.0'
            • evr equals '0:0.28.0-4.el7'
            • signature_keyid equals '199e2f91fd431d51'
            • extended_name equals 'dconf-(none):0.28.0-4.el7.x86_64'

            The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the create_module syscall.

            Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-93705r3_rule
            Result:Fail
            Version:RHEL-07-030819
            Identities:CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
            Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

            Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

            Satisfies: SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00216, SRG-OS-000477-GPOS-00222 false
            Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "create_module" syscall occur.

            Add or update the following rules in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

            -a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S create_module -k module-change

            -a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S create_module -k module-change

            The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
            Severity:medium
            Weight:10.0
            Reference:
            Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
            Publisher:DISA
            Type:DPMS Target
            Subject:Red Hat 7
            Identifier:2777
            Definitions:
            Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:93705
            Result:false
            Title:Audit Kernel Module Creation - create_module
            Description:The audit rules should be configured to log information about kernel module creation.
            Class:compliance
            Tests:
            • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
              • false (All child checks must be true.)
                • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
                  • false (audit augenrules 64-bit create_module)
                  • false (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
                    • true (All child checks must be true.)
                      • true (64 bit architecture)
                    • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
                      • false (64 bit architecture)
                      • false (64 bit architecture)
                • false (audit augenrules 32-bit create_module)
                • true (All child checks must be true.)
                  • true (audit augenrules)
              • false (All child checks must be true.)
                • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
                  • false (audit auditctl 64-bit create_module)
                  • false (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
                    • true (All child checks must be true.)
                      • true (64 bit architecture)
                    • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
                      • false (64 bit architecture)
                      • false (64 bit architecture)
                • false (audit auditctl 32-bit create_module)
                • false (All child checks must be true.)
                  • false (audit auditctl)
            Tests:
            Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:9370502 (textfilecontent54_test)
