            • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
            • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
            • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+(?:.*-F[\s]+arch=b64[\s]+)(?:.*(-S[\s]+create_module[\s]+|([\s]+|[,])create_module([\s]+|[,]))).*(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
            • instance must be equal to '1'

            The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the finit_module syscall.

            Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-93707r3_rule
            Result:Fail
            Version:RHEL-07-030821
            Identities:CCE-80547-3
            CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
            Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

            Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

            Satisfies: SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00216, SRG-OS-000477-GPOS-00222 false
            Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "finit_module" syscall occur.

            Add or update the following rules in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

            -a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S finit_module -k module-change

            -a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S finit_module -k module-change

            The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.

            Weight:10.0

            Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.

            Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:3099 (uname_object)
            Object Requirements:
            • Collect any available items.

            Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating systems version 7.2 or newer with a Basic Input/Output System (BIOS) must require authentication upon booting into single-user and maintenance modes.

            Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-95717r1_rule
            Result:Fail
            Version:RHEL-07-010482
            Identities:CCE-27309-4
            CCI-000213 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-3)
            Description: If the system does not require valid root authentication before it boots into single-user or maintenance mode, anyone who invokes single-user or maintenance mode is granted privileged access to all files on the system. GRUB 2 is the default boot loader for RHEL 7 and is designed to require a password to boot into single-user mode or make modifications to the boot menu. false
            Fix Text:Configure the system to encrypt the boot password for root.

            Generate an encrypted grub2 password for root with the following command:

            Note: The hash generated is an example.

            # grub2-setpassword
            Enter password:
            Confirm password:

            Edit the /boot/grub2/grub.cfg file and add or modify the following lines in the "### BEGIN /etc/grub.d/01_users ###" section:

            set superusers="root"
            export superusers
            Severity:high
            Weight:10.0
            Reference:
            Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
            Publisher:DISA
            Type:DPMS Target
            Subject:Red Hat 7
            Identifier:2777
            Definitions:
            Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:95717
            Result:false
            Title:Set Boot Loader Password (BIOS) for RHEL 7.2 and up
            Description:The grub2 boot loader should have password protection enabled.
            Class:compliance
            Tests:
            • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
              • false (All child checks must be true.)
                • false (make sure a password is defined in /boot/grub2/user.cfg)
                • true (superuser is defined in /boot/grub2/grub.cfg files.)
              • false (Running RHEL 7.0 or 7.1?)
              • false (/boot/grub2/grub.cfg does not exist)
            Tests:
            Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:9571700 (textfilecontent54_test)
            Result:false
            Title:make sure a password is defined in /boot/grub2/user.cfg
            Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
            Check:Result is based on check existence only.
            Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:9571700 (textfilecontent54_object)
            Object Requirements:
            • filepath must be equal to '/boot/grub2/user.cfg'
            • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*GRUB2_PASSWORD=grub\.pbkdf2\.sha512.*$'
            • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
            Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
            Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:9571701 (textfilecontent54_test)
            Result:true
            Title:superuser is defined in /boot/grub2/grub.cfg files.
            Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
            Check:Result is based on check existence only.
            Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:9571701 (textfilecontent54_object)
            Object Requirements:
            • filepath must be equal to '/boot/grub2/grub.cfg'
            • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*set[\s]+superusers=\"root\"\s*$'
            • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
            Collected Item Properties:
            • filepath equals '/boot/grub2/grub.cfg'
            • path equals '/boot/grub2'
            • filename equals 'grub.cfg'
            • pattern equals '^[\s]*set[\s]+superusers=\"root\"\s*$'
            • instance equals '1'
            • text equals ' set superusers="root"'
            • line equals ' set superusers="root"'
            • subexpression does not exist
            Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8658500 (textfilecontent54_test)
            Result:false
            Title:Running RHEL 7.0 or 7.1?
            Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
            Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
            State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.
            Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:16900 (textfilecontent54_object)
            Object Requirements:
            • filepath must be equal to '/etc/redhat-release'
            • pattern must match the pattern '^Red Hat Enterprise Linux.*release\s+(\S+)\s+'
            • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
            State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:8658500 (textfilecontent54_state)
            State Requirements:
            • all subexpression must be equal to '7.0'
            State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:8658501 (textfilecontent54_state)
            State Requirements:
            • all subexpression must be equal to '7.1'
            Collected Item Properties:
            • filepath equals '/etc/redhat-release'
            • path equals '/etc'
            • filename equals 'redhat-release'
            • pattern equals '^Red Hat Enterprise Linux.*release\s+(\S+)\s+'
            • instance equals '1'
            • text equals 'Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server release 7.8 '
            • line equals 'Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server release 7.8 '
            • subexpression equals '7.8'
            Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
            Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:909 (file_test)
            Result:false
            Title:/boot/grub2/grub.cfg does not exist
            Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
            Check:Result is based on check existence only.
            Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2710 (file_object)
            Object Requirements:
            • filepath must be equal to '/boot/grub2/grub.cfg'
            Collected Item Properties:
            • filepath equals '/boot/grub2/grub.cfg'
            • path equals '/boot/grub2'
            • filename equals 'grub.cfg'
            • type equals 'regular'
            • group_id equals '0'
            • user_id equals '0'
            • a_time equals '1591061322'
            • c_time equals '1590783461'
            • m_time equals '1590783461'
            • size equals '6179'
            • suid equals '0'
            • sgid equals '0'
            • sticky equals '0'
            • uread equals '1'
            • uwrite equals '1'
            • uexec equals '0'
            • gread equals '1'
            • gwrite equals '0'
            • gexec equals '0'
            • oread equals '1'
            • owrite equals '0'
            • oexec equals '0'
            Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

            The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured to use the au-remote plugin.

            Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-95727r1_rule
            Result:Fail
            Version:RHEL-07-030200
            Identities:CCI-001851 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-4 (1))
            Description: Information stored in one location is vulnerable to accidental or incidental deletion or alteration.

            Off-loading is a common process in information systems with limited audit storage capacity.

            Without the configuration of the "au-remote" plugin, the audisp-remote daemon will not off-load the logs from the system being audited.

            Satisfies: SRG-OS-000342-GPOS-00133, SRG-OS-000479-GPOS-00224 false
            Fix Text:Edit the /etc/audisp/plugins.d/au-remote.conf file and change the value of "active" to "yes".

            The audit daemon must be restarted for changes to take effect:

            # service auditd restart
            Severity:medium
            Weight:10.0
            Reference:
            Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
            Publisher:DISA
            Type:DPMS Target
            Subject:Red Hat 7
            Identifier:2777
            Definitions:
            Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:95727
            Result:false
            Title:The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured to use the au-remote plugin.
            Description:The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured to use the au-remote plugin.
            Class:compliance
            Tests:
            • false (All child checks must be true.)
              • false (/etc/audisp/plugins.d/au-remote.conf active = yes)
            Tests:
            Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:9572700 (textfilecontent54_test)
            Result:false
            Title:/etc/audisp/plugins.d/au-remote.conf active = yes
            Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
            Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
            Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:9572700 (textfilecontent54_object)
            Object Requirements:
            • behavior requirements:
              • ignore_case = true
            • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audisp/plugins.d/au-remote.conf'
            • pattern must match the pattern '^[ ]*active[ ]+=[ ]+([^ ]*)[ ]*$'
            • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
            State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:9572700 (textfilecontent54_state)
            State Requirements:
            • all subexpression must match the pattern '^[Yy][Ee][Ss]$'
            Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

            The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must configure the au-remote plugin to off-load audit logs using the audisp-remote daemon.

            Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-95729r1_rule
            Result:Fail
            Version:RHEL-07-030201
            Identities:CCI-001851 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-4 (1))
            Description: Information stored in one location is vulnerable to accidental or incidental deletion or alteration.

            Off-loading is a common process in information systems with limited audit storage capacity.

            Without the configuration of the "au-remote" plugin, the audisp-remote daemon will not off load the logs from the system being audited.

            Satisfies: SRG-OS-000342-GPOS-00133, SRG-OS-000479-GPOS-00224 false
            Fix Text:Edit the /etc/audisp/plugins.d/au-remote.conf file and add or update the following values:

            direction = out
            path = /sbin/audisp-remote
            type = always

            The audit daemon must be restarted for changes to take effect:

            # service auditd restart
            Severity:medium
            Weight:10.0
            Reference:
            Title:DPMS Target Red Hat 7
            Publisher:DISA
            Type:DPMS Target
            Subject:Red Hat 7
            Identifier:2777
            Definitions:
            Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:95729
            Result:false
            Title:The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must configure the au-remote plugin to off-load audit logs using the audisp-remote daemon.
            Description:The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must configure the au-remote plugin to off-load audit logs using the audisp-remote daemon.
            Class:compliance
            Tests:
            • false (All child checks must be true.)
              • false (/etc/audisp/plugins.d/au-remote.conf direction = out)
              • false (/etc/audisp/plugins.d/au-remote.conf path = /sbin/audisp-remote)
              • false (/etc/audisp/plugins.d/au-remote.conf type = always)
            Tests:
            Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:9572900 (textfilecontent54_test)
            Result:false
            Title:/etc/audisp/plugins.d/au-remote.conf direction = out
            Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
            Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
            Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:9572900 (textfilecontent54_object)
            Object Requirements:
            • behavior requirements:
              • ignore_case = true
            • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audisp/plugins.d/au-remote.conf'
            • pattern must match the pattern '^[ ]*direction[ ]+=[ ]+([^ ]*)[ ]*$'
            • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
            State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:9572900 (textfilecontent54_state)
            State Requirements:
            • all subexpression must match the pattern '^[Oo][Uu][Tt]$'
            Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
            Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:9572901 (textfilecontent54_test)
            Result:false
            Title:/etc/audisp/plugins.d/au-remote.conf path = /sbin/audisp-remote
            Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
            Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
            Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:9572901 (textfilecontent54_object)
            Object Requirements:
            • behavior requirements:
              • ignore_case = true
            • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audisp/plugins.d/au-remote.conf'
            • pattern must match the pattern '^[ ]*path[ ]+=[ ]+([^ ]*)[ ]*$'
            • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
            State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:9572901 (textfilecontent54_state)
            State Requirements:
            • all subexpression must match the pattern '^\/sbin\/audisp\-remote$'
            Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
            Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:9572902 (textfilecontent54_test)
            Result:false
            Title:/etc/audisp/plugins.d/au-remote.conf type = always
            Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
            Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
            Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:9572902 (textfilecontent54_object)
            Object Requirements:
            • behavior requirements:
              • ignore_case = true
            • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audisp/plugins.d/au-remote.conf'
            • pattern must match the pattern '^[ ]*type[ ]+=[ ]+([^ ]*)[ ]*$'
            • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
            State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:9572902 (textfilecontent54_state)
            State Requirements:
            • all subexpression must match the pattern '^[Aa][Ll][Ww][Aa][Yy][Ss]$'
            Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
            SCAP Compliance Checker - 5.3 - NIWC Atlantic
